General Information

Ref #: 31259

Functional Area: Accounting/Finance/Tax

Employee Type: Full Time

Location: Newport Beach

Date published: 20-Aug-2021

About Us

We are PIMCO, a leading global asset management firm. We manage investments and develop solutions across the full spectrum of asset classes, strategies and vehicles: fixed income, equities, commodities, asset allocation, ETFs, hedge funds and private equity. PIMCO is one of the largest investment managers, actively managing more than $2.2 trillion in assets for clients around the world. PIMCO has over 3,070 employees in 22 offices globally. PIMCO is recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.

PIMCO is one of the world’s premier fixed income investment managers with thousands of professionals around the world united in a single purpose: creating opportunities for our clients in every environment. Since 1971, we have brought innovation and expertise to our partnership with the institutions, financial advisors and millions of individual investors who entrust us with their assets. We aspire to cultivate performance and leadership through empowering our people, diversity of thought, and a commitment to an inclusive culture that engages in our global communities.

Position Description

We are looking to level-up our analytical capacity. You will be part of a small but influential team with broad responsibility to perform trend analyses, predictive analytics and in-depth modeling to refine our forecasts of Assets under Management (“AUM”), revenue and AUM-driven expenses for all domestic and global operations. You will partner with senior leaders across the firm to understand and illustrate the financial health of the business and provide key insights that shape our strategic direction. The right person for this role is self-motivated, innovative and solution-oriented with solid communication and problem solving skills. Those who are naturally curious, data-driven, and expert communicators will excel in this role. Attention to detail, accountability, and flexibility are essential.

What You’ll Be Doing
Proactively identify and execute on deep-dive analyses of current and historical business/industry trends
Independently build and continually refine scalable predictive models and perform in-depth trend analyses to inform forecasts and present insights to senior management using SQL, Python or R
Increase our analytical capabilities, Identify key model/forecast drivers and provide valuable insights to senior management that promote data-driven strategic decision-making
Identify new data sources to discover insights within our data and/or in combination with external data
Work closely with technology infrastructure teams to source and refine raw data for your models
Build relationship with teams across the firm to research and resolve questions, and to further your understanding of the business to improve modelling and analyses
Maintain, update and continually improve upon sophisticated business models for monthly and quarterly reporting, ad hoc analysis and forecasting
Tackle special projects, ad-hoc reporting, and analyses
Identify and implement opportunities for improvement through automation
Position Requirements
Minimum of two years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar role
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Finance or similar. Master’s degree is a plus.
Ability to build predictive models in Python or R and to source data using SQL, OBI or other tools
Experience using machine learning and statistical packages such as Pandas, Matlab, SciKit Learn.
Proficiency in modeling/forecasting in Excel as needed
Passion for data-driven decision-making, a natural curiosity, a desire to pursue continual improvement and the tenacity to implement it
Ability and desire to work in a team environment as well as work independently with little supervision.
Proactive, resourceful and motivated to seek additional work when tasks are completed and to go above-and-beyond to help the team
Experience and ability to work well under pressure and handle multiple tasks, challenges, and deadlines
Experience in the Asset Management industry is a plus
Experience using Oracle EPM/Hyperion/Essbase or other planning system is a plus but not required
Benefits

PIMCO is committed to offering a comprehensive portfolio of employee benefits designed to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Benefits vary by location but may include:
Medical, dental, and vision coverage
Life insurance and travel coverage
401(k) (defined contribution) retirement savings, retirement plan, pension contribution from your first day of employment
Work/life programs such as flexible work arrangements, parental leave and support, employee assistance plan, commuter benefits, health club discounts, and educational/CFA certification reimbursement programs
Community involvement opportunities with The PIMCO Foundation in each PIMCO office

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Ubertal, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Title Data Analyst Location 100 remote Duration 6 Months Requirements Bachelor, Masters, or PhD. Examples include business analytics, statistics, mathematics, finance, economics, engineering, and computer science 2-3 years of experience in a Data Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Engineer or similar role. Demonstrated lead role in multiple high priority analytics projects. Ability to formulate business problems into scoped data projects. Experience providing technical mentorship to junior and senior analysts. Set the technical norms of the team such as reviewing pull requests and influencing technical standards. Technically proficient in SQL, PythonR. We donrsquot expect data engineer quality, but we need to create analysis scripts and direct data engineering resources. Marketing or business experience Demonstrated intellectual curiosity and interest in solving problems, particularly using data to help answer nebulous questions Able to communicate results to a non-technical audience. Coach other data scientists on delivering effective presentations.

Bloomberg runs on data, and data drives the market. Our Data team acquires and supplies this data to our clients. Teams work collaboratively to collect, analyze, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal - the data ultimately feeding and moving the financial markets.

The Role

The Profiles team maintains biographical information of the most influential individuals in the Financial Markets, and beyond. We are the LinkedIn of the Financial Markets! In addition, the team tracks the Leadership of the companies that impact our everyday lives. From the C-Suite, to the Board Room, the team is responsible for ensuring that Bloomberg is 'First in Class' of Company Governance Data.

As a Data Analyst you will apply your problem-solving skills to manage the financial data that feeds Bloomberg products, identify innovative workflow efficiencies, implement technical solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes, and establish links with key players in the financial market.

Our Data Analysts possess a unique combination of business insight and technical aptitude, as well as strong communication skills and ability to build relationships with various stakeholders. They use these skills to extract, transform and load timely, accurate and comprehensive data accessible to our clients across various Bloomberg platforms, playing a key role in empowering our clients to make well informed business decisions. Providing exceptional support assisting our clients with their data queries is a key part to the role.

We'll Trust You To
Use a variety of software solutions to extract and rationalize data to Bloomberg taxonomies
Provide in-depth customer support for users of Bloomberg products such as the Professional Service, News, Enterprise Solutions, and Bloomberg Law by resolving inquiries in a timely manner
Implement business rules for programmatic data validation by codifying market conventions and/or data relationships
Design and manage workflow configurations for critical functions such as acquisition, worklist management, and quality control
Build subject matter expertise and technical skills to generate premium content, including data-driven news stories
Analyze internal processes to identify opportunities for improvement, as well as devise and implement innovative solutions
Lead ad hoc projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the data set
Use statistics and data visualization skills to report on results of on-going operations and projects, as required
Contribute to continuous improvement by generating ideas to improve our data products and/or associated processes and building prototypes to validate and illustrate requirements
Partner with a wide variety of stakeholders from Engineering to Sales on product development
You'll Need To Have
Legal authorization to work full-time in the United States and will not require visa sponsorship now or in the future
At least a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business, Economics, Accounting, Information Systems, STEM, or a related degree or equivalent experience
Strong passion for data, technology and finance with the aspiration to work in the financial/fintech services industry
0 to 2 years of work/internship/academic experience in data analysis, financial market research and/or information technology
A can-do attitude, and a proactive approach to each day
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Effective project management skills and ability to prioritize tasks accordingly
Demonstrated experience using Python, SQL, or related languages
We'd Love To See
Demonstrated experience interpreting financial statements; understanding of finance and accounting principles and procedures
Experience in customer service or client relationship management within the financial industry
Previous work experience with the Bloomberg Terminal, or Bloomberg Market Concepts (BMC) certification
Does this sound like you?

Posted by
Alison Polidore
Build the teams that shape Robin's future
Send InMail
Remote Work. We know the best work doesn’t always happen in person. Our people have the choice to work from wherever they do their best work. For some of us that means our homes, while others prefer to use our office in Boston (the Seaport). With flexible working locations and hours, we support Robinauts across the US.

About Robin:

Robin is the first workplace management platform designed for flexible work. Every day, thousands of offices across the world use our software to find rooms, desks, and coworkers. Used by companies such as Toyota and Twitter, Robin empowers workplace professionals to build (and reopen) the best version of their office, so people do their best work.

What We’re Looking For:
The Robin Revenue Operations team is working hard to equip our internal partners (Sales, Marketing, Finance and more) with data-driven, actionable insights that will be used to propel future growth at Robin, and that’s where you come in.

We are hiring a Data Analyst who will:
Manage the back-end flow of data across various sources (Salesforce, Hubspot, Stripe, Redshift, Looker) and ensure data consistency across those sources.
Maintain data integrity by developing automated process/audit checks and troubleshooting data issues as they arise.
Partner with commercial management to build out automated reporting dashboards using Looker and other visualization tools.
Identify “stories” through reading data that can provide actionable insights to various business stakeholders.
Provide feedback to the sales team and other business stakeholders regarding ways to improve data collection processes.

You’ll Succeed In This Role If You:
Have experience using SQL to query, analyze and present data.
Have experience with CRM systems (Salesforce, Hubspot).
Have advanced user knowledge of B.I. reporting tools such as Looker, Tableau or Power BI.
Have advanced user knowledge of Microsoft Excel.

It’s an Added Bonus If You:
Have experience in an analytics environment, sales operations, and/or finance -- preferably in a SaaS environment
Have familiarity with relational databases such as AWS Redshift.
Have familiarity with Python/R or other statistical languages.
Have familiarity with JIRA or other agile project management tools.
Have familiarity with Git workflow.

Why You’ll Love This Job:
You’ll have direct access to working with executives such as the CFO, CRO and Head of Marketing - gaining exposure to all departments across the organization.
You’ll be part of a fast-paced, start-up work environment. Never a boring day!
You’re entering a company and analytics team that is still young; you will be able to have a real impact in crafting our long-term data and growth strategy.

Benefits:
Medical & Dental Insurance through Blue Cross Blue Shield covered at 100% for employee-only plans and 85% for family members.
Vision Insurance offered through EyeMed
Company sponsored 401k with up to a 3% match
Incentive Stock Options
100% Paid Parental Leave
Unlimited vacation time (that we actually use!)
12 company holidays

Perks:
Work from Anywhere
Monthly Hybrid Stipend Program
Equipment Stipend
Weekly Meal Stipend through DoorDash
Professional Development Stipend
Talent Referral Program
Recognition perks through Blueboard
Travel to HQ for Remote Employees

We Celebrate Diversity

Robin is committed to creating a workplace that reflects the world around us. We believe that the key to good work is empowering our people and we know that diversity and inclusion are a large part of this equation. Our realities shape our everyday experiences and it’s our responsibility to our employees, our customers and our communities to address the issues with workplace representation. Robin does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

COVID-19 Policy

For office access, all Robinauts and visitors must provide documented proof of vaccination against COVID-19. If documentation is unavailable, Robinauts and visitors can provide either:
- A negative COVID-19 test with results dated within 72 hours prior to their accessing the office, every time they access the office
- OR for regular office users, proof of negative COVID-19 testing on at least a weekly basis.

position: Data Analyst - Security, Integrity, and Investigations
details:
Do you like working with big data? Do you want to use data to help drive the direction of products that impact the lives of over 1 billion people every day? If yes, we want to talk to you. The Security, Integrity, and Investigations (SI2) team ensures Facebook maintains a healthy balance between community safety, user privacy, and its legal obligations. The team focuses on reporting and using data to forecast, build insights and draw correlations between our external and internal sites. We are looking for an experienced individual with a strong background in analytics, automation, and reporting. The SI2 Data Analyst will work with a team of data professionals that assist other Trust & Safety oriented teams by providing deep technical solutions to highly complex and real-world impacting problems. They will also work on the formation of pipelines and transport mechanisms for existing systems. In this role, the team will see a direct link between the work and Facebook’s efforts to thwart real-world harm. This candidate will be highly organized, productive, and able to thrive in high-pressure, time-sensitive scenarios, with a people-centric approach to problem solving.

Data Analyst - Security, Integrity, and Investigations Responsibilities:

Support multiple specialist teams across the Security, Investigations and Integrity Organization
Serve as an escalation point for frontline difficulties where the next step to resolution is missing or ambiguous
Leverage data to identify, understand, troubleshoot, and report on areas of opportunity in Facebook SI2 across multiple specialist Teams within the Security, Investigations and Integrity Organization
Monitor key metrics to forecast and explain the root causes of changes in internal and external conditions that drive those metrics
Analyze large data sets to identify trends and patterns that require deeper analysis or policy changes
Use data and analysis to provide strategic direction to the broader SI2 teams and their leaders
Receive and respond to requests for data requests
Receive and respond to requests for ad-hoc reporting
Convert ad-hoc reporting to normalized/automated reports when the need arises
Retrofit outdated/cumbersome existing reports

Minimum Qualifications:

B.S. in a technical discipline (e.g. Math, Physics, Statistics, Computer Science, or equivalent)
5+ years of quantitative or statistical analysis experience
3+ years of experience in business strategy, finance, engineering, or analytics
2+ years of experience in technology focused project management
Experience working within sensitive data systems (e.g. banking, medical, government restricted, etc.)
Experience processing and analyzing complex data sets, and interpreting them for making business decisions
Experience creating ad hoc queries to answer unique questions from a diverse set of stakeholders
Data visualization experience with an intuitive knowledge of data storytelling, communication skills, and experience working as part of a team and collaborating with cross-functional partners

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with Python and R
Experience working in a fast-paced, tech focused, web/internet start-up environment
Experience identifying and leading engagements with internal legal stakeholders as well as external cross-functional work stream leads, stakeholders and engineering partners

We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. Loom is the video communication platform for async work that helps companies communicate better at scale. Loom makes it easy to record quick videos of your screen and camera and instantly share them with a link. More than 14M users across more than 200k companies around the world trust Loom to share feedback, updates, intros, training, and more – every day. Founded in late 2015, Loom has raised $203M from world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Iconic, and Coatue.

The Role

We’re looking to add a Senior Analyst to our growing Data team to help us measure the impact of our Collaborate & Enterprise initiatives and identify opportunities to expand the network of people who use async video at work. In this role you will help the Collaborate & Enterprise teams drive initiatives that range from big bets that inflect Loom’s growth trajectory to quick wins that continuously remove friction for our users.

We have rich, complex datasets and our team performs a wide variety of analytical tasks, ranging from conducting ad-hoc research, creating dashboards, building funnels, designing and evaluating tests, crafting complex database queries and ETL pipelines, and developing sophisticated predictive models. The ideal candidate will be data-driven, intellectually curious, and a clear communicator.
We are currently hiring remotely in the United States and Canada
Responsibilities
Be a primary partner for the Collaborate & Enterprise teams working with Product, Engineering and Design to understand growth and optimization opportunities and measure impact of initiatives
Provide data insights through A/B testing, dashboards, user behavior analyses and ad-hoc requests
Design and develop core business metrics, creating insightful automated dashboards (and the necessary data pipelines) and data visualization to track progress
Proactively derive data insights and turn them into growth recommendations, communicate results and learnings to the rest of the team
Lead A/B experiments from the Data side by supporting experiment design, tracking, implementation and owning the final analysis and readout
Build analytics plans for new products and features, helping the Collaborate & Enterprise teams understand which metrics need to be measured and which events need to be tracked
Inform future experimentation design and roadmaps by performing exploratory analysis to understand user acquisition and activation behavior
What We're Looking For
5+ years of experience in an analytics role turning data into insights and recommendations
Strong analytical and communication skills with the ability to synthesize insights into compelling stories
Experience with the SaaS customer lifecycle from acquisition to retention
Experience with designing and analyzing experiments
Superior SQL (Snowflake, Postgres) skills - able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets
Experience with a Business Intelligence tool (e.g. Tableau or Mode)
Experience with a statistical scripting language (e.g. R or Python) is a plus
Experience with ETL tools such as Airflow or DBT is a plus
Experience in data modeling and ETL development is a plus
Experience collaborating with multiple business functions and stakeholders to develop metrics and key insights
A Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field or higher
How We Work

Freedom and Flexibility: At Loom, we believe work is an act, not a place. When we disengage work from a location, we can accommodate a broad range of life choices. You can choose to work from home or while you travel. If you are in the Bay Area, you can drop by our San Francisco office on 2nd and Market St. We are able to hire across the United States and Canada and are continuing to expand our international presence. And you are free to move within a country without any adjustment to compensation.

Engaging Workday: The key to an engaging workday is finding the right balance between different ways to work sync, async, text and video. Loom makes it easier for us to say what we mean without having to schedule a zoom meeting or struggle to find the right words. And using async communication allows us to free up time for deep work every day. We believe there's a place for sync time - often a conversation on Zoom is exactly what is needed. For team meetings, this ‘sync time’ is typically between 9AM-Noon PT given where the overlap of timezones where Loommates are located.

Work-Rest Balance: The way we balance the fast-paced demands of a high-growth startup and sustainability is making rest a priority. We offer a flexible PTO policy so you're able to take time off when you need it. We also go fully offline once a year between Christmas and New Year (and twice during the Pandemic). Rest is also part of the workday, not just during PTO. Taking a break for personal commitments, whether it's watching the kids or getting some exercise is a natural part of the workday.

Social Connection: Relationships and connectedness matter. We are intentional about building trust and relationships through unique, shared experiences. Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Looms celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Loommates are able to meet in person with their teams at least twice a year purely for fun. We have also built local offices for those who want to work or meet in person, starting with San Francisco and New York City.

Perks at Loom
Competitive compensation and equity package
99% company paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents (for US employees)
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DCFSA)
Healthcare reimbursement (for International employees)
Life, AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance
401(k) with 4% company matching
Professional development reimbursement
Wellness stipends
Unlimited PTO
Paid parental leave
Remote work opportunities
Home office & technology reimbursement
Loom = Equal Opportunity Employer

We value a diverse workplace and encourage women, people of color, LGBTQIA individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, older members of society, and others from minority groups and diverse backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. All employees and contractors of Loom are responsible for maintaining a work culture free from discrimination and harassment by treating others with kindness and respect.

Description

We are:

Accelerators of innovation. Enablers of collaboration. Protectors of ideas.

Code42 speeds the time to detect and respond to Insider Risks by delivering a fast, simple path to data loss detection, investigation and response. With our product, Incydr™, security teams easily protect corporate data and reduce insider risk while fostering a collaborative and productive culture for employees. We’re here to support organizations made up of people that move fast and think big. The ones who work together to solve hard problems and relentlessly pursue better.

You belong at Code42 if you crave being a part of a transparent and team-first culture, you want to drive innovation, and security is always top of mind. We look for authentic people who are inquisitive, enjoy solving complex problems, and provide diverse insights to help us think differently and thrive together.

Interested? Head to code42.com/careers to learn more about why we’ve consistently been recognized for the quality of our product and the culture of our company.

Don’t wait. #BeCode42

The Role

You will play a critical role within the Internal Analytics team as we build new data products that help decision makers around the company improve decision velocity and quality. Your intellectual curiosity and drive for results means you aren’t afraid to explore new areas. Your collaborative approach and effective communication build culture and provide insight. You are a critical part of building a data culture that makes data accessible and usable by a variety of people around the organization regardless of their skill level.

What You’ll Be Doing
Partnering with stakeholders in Finance, Marketing, Product, Security, IT to understand analysis needs around product usage, adoption, and Amazon Web Services (AWS) cost.
Building visualizations and reporting in tools (Tableau) that answer critical business questions in a repeatable, distributable way.
Exploring data sets to find insights that move the company forward.
Get others excited about your visualizations and analysis by effectively communicating outputs to necessary stakeholders.
Leading the usage of data by championing best practices and data processes; define, assist, monitor, and refine the approach
Ensuring data products are built to support long term goals and deliver valuable insights.
Actively engage in daily scrums and work with Analytics Managers, Analytics Engineers, and other Data Analysts to ensure data quality and data availability.
What You Bring
A Bachelor’s Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance, Economics, or similar field.
5+ years of experience working in a finance or analytics focused role.
A focus on finding insights that drive the business forward.
An intellectual curiosity that can only be tamed by diving into new areas of analysis..
Demonstrated ability to communicate analytics outputs in business terms that others can easily understand.
Solid proficiency with data analytics tech stack/tools. Code42 uses Fivetran, dbt, Snowflake and Tableau.
Proficiency in SQL.
Anticipate salary range for this position is $85,000-100,000. Final salary will be determined based on seniority, geographic location, training and experience.
Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for employment, if not currently employed by Code42.
Preferred
An understanding of AWS architecture and cost.
Proficiency in Python.
WHY #BECODE42:

A first-class onboarding experience which includes professional development and personal development all while learning and living our Code42 values. We provide comprehensive benefits that include health, dental, vision, wellness, 401k, parental leave, pet insurance, generous paid time off and volunteer opportunities. At Code42 everyone is an owner. We participate in commission or bonus plans and all employees receive stock options. We win together.

Code42 values workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. Employment opportunities are available to all applicants without regards to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, genetic information, or any other category protected by law. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

At U.S. Bank, we're passionate about helping customers and the communities where we live and work. The fifth-largest bank in the United States, we’re one of the country's most respected, innovative and successful financial institutions. U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Job Description

Responsible for very complex reporting projects that gather and integrate large volumes of data, performs in depth analysis, interprets results and develops actionable insights and recommendations for use across the company for customer and employee populations. Acquires data from multiple data sources in order to perform analysis and reporting. Identifies, analyzes and interprets trends or patterns in complex data in order to provide answers to business questions as well as provide recommendations for action. Presents data and analysis in a clear and concise manner allowing the audience to quickly understand the results and recommendations so they activate upon them and make data driven decisions. Collaborates with various partners to provide a holistic view of the analysis. Measures and monitors results of applied recommendations and present adjustments. Ensures all data acquisition, sharing and results of applied recommendations are compliant with company standards.

Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree, or equivalent work experience
5-7 years of data analysis experience, predictive analytics strongly preferred
Preferred Skills/Experience
Experience with predictive analytics
Experience in SQL or other BI tool for querying data and for data manipulation/transformation
Experience in SAS & Power BI
Experience in financial services, with thorough knowledge of HR systems or financial services products, customers, transactions and interaction data
Strong analytic skills with the ability to extract, collect, organize, analyze and interpret results for insights
Ability to data mine, analyze data, and present insights in a meaningful way
Ability to develop and maintain strategic partnership with Senior Business unit management, business partners and project sponsors, as well as communicate effectively with business, and development teams, end users, and product owners
Strong decision-making and problem-solving skills
Strong organization and project management skills
Effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills

position: Senior Data Analyst (Marketing & Growth Analytics, Python, SQL)
details:
Job Description

It’s a new day in health care!

Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a ground-breaking moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health.

Want to help drive the next level of growth at a leading national B2C healthcare brand, touching millions of prospects and members? We’re looking for go-to-market leaders to drive innovation and growth in Aetna’s Medicare Business, using consumer marketing, sales, and product design that leverages data science and consulting skills to help Aetna acquire new members.

You are a problem-solver at heart. You attack complex problems with techniques rooted in statistics and logic and have a comfort translating technical analytics problems into simple business solutions.

Our Medicare Analytics team is integrated into all of Aetna’s go-to-market activities, including overall growth strategies, business case development, customer segmentation, product design, media mix planning, attribution modeling, and member retention. We infuse data science into all growth analytics, powered by petabytes of data, and the latest machine learning techniques.

In the past 4 years our membership has doubled and our market share has grown 50%; you will help us take all this to the next level, using your passion for problem solving, quantitative analysis, and analytic storytelling to identify, incubate, and deploy the next set of innovations to power the growth of tomorrow’s business!

One of the many projects you could be working on:
Work closely with our Marketing and Sales partners to inform Aetna’s Medicare member growth strategy through analytics – e.g., forecasting, marketing mix optimization, customer segmentation, test design, what-if scenarios, and more
Build models that translate and simplify ambiguous problems into logical frameworks which inform operational and strategic solutions to drive short and long-term business strategy
Investigate opportunities to drive revenue growth across our business operations and our marketing growth funnels
Consult on the creation of analytics solutions that effectively weigh business and technical tradeoffs using an intermediate understanding of business strategy as well as available data science toolkits
Hybrid work Location options (2 days onsite every other week): NYC; Hartford, CT or Boston, MA area.

Required Qualifications

3 years of experience using statistical techniques on complex data to solve business problems.
Able to clearly articulate and communicate complex problems and solutions in a simple, logical, and impactful manner
Proven track record of leveraging data to influence cross-functional stakeholders, partners, and leadership to drive decisions
Experience with using data querying and scripting languages to analyze large data sets (Python, R, Hive, SQL)

COVID Requirements

COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement

CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.

You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in marketing analytics or management consulting preferred
Experience building dashboards to visualize data for technical and non-technical audiences with mainstream BI software (Tableau, PowerBI)
Education

Bachelor's degree in quantitative field, or an equivalent combination of formal education and experience.

Master’s or PhD degree in a quantitative major (e.g., mathematics, statistics, economics, operations, finance, computer science) is a big plus

Business Overview

At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.

We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

FORENSIC DATA ANALYST (Office of Inspector General) Visit www.igchicago.org to apply The Office of the Inspector General (OIG), Center for Information Technology and Analytics (CITA) has a new opportunity for an individual(s) who love problem-solving and is civic minded, who is interested in designing, building, and implementing analytical models and visualizations to provide OIG with facts and insights to promote economy, effectiveness, efficiency, and integrity in City government. Under guidance, this position develops and employs innovative techniques for data analysis, resulting in the extraction of critical, near real-time information. business intelligent dashboards to provide actionable insights for fact-based decision making bull Reviews and classifies data across the City and identifies core data sources bull Designs and reports to summarize the findings of analysis work bull Participates in both internal and external meetings and conferences to present or share project outcomes or findings bull Performs related duties as required PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS bull Advanced degree in data analytics, data science, predictive analytics, statistics, mathematics, or related field bull Work experience in an Description

We are seeking a certified Data Analyst to join the team. To be successful in this role, you should be able to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Some responsibilities of the Data Analyst include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design, as well as developing analysis and reporting capabilities. You will also identify improvements to quality control plans by monitoring performance.

Responsibilities
Design business analysis and data recording systems for use throughout the department
Analyze data reports regularly, identifying and resolving any mistakes
Monitor data and call out any changes in business and financial trends
Create business reports that provide insight into key data points
Collect data and perform accurate analysis for various types of business reports
Communicate findings of data analysis to managers, written and verbally
Support other departments in reaching their goals through analysis
Support database updates and maintain accuracy
Requirements
Comfortable with business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow
Skilled in creating pivot tables, graphs, and charts using data tools
1 to 3 years of experience as a financial or business analyst
Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions
Tendency to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
Demonstrated ability to manage time and prioritize projects to meet deadlines
Experience with object-oriented programming and other data analysis programs
Strong analytical skills that allow for the development of data-driven reports
Skilled in written and verbal communication to effectively relate data to coworkers

In alignment with Vanguard’s dedication to making advice more accessible and affordable for investors, Vanguard Institutional is dedicated to supporting all aspects of our growing advice businesses for our Institutional clients and participants. This role will deliver analytics to supplement Vanguard’s hardworking roster of advice-focused products and advisors and offer leadership and development opportunities. As a member of a growing team supporting a strategic initiative, you will have a unique opportunity to advance analytics capabilities as Vanguard’s Advice business grows.

This position is designated as hybrid (In-office + remote) and will be based in one of Vanguard’s business centers (Malvern PA, Charlotte NC, Scottsdale AZ, Plano TX) when the time comes for our offices to re-open in 2022.

Create the strategies and experiences that are changing an industry.

In Vanguard's Institutional (IIG) division, we serve millions of employees (known as participants) by partnering with their employers to create smart, effective retirement plans and ensure our low-cost, high-performing funds are available within retirement plans. As an analyst, you’ll help us build and evolve our advice experiences, capabilities, and product line-up to serve the needs of individual investors and plan sponsors. You’ll help us tap into unmet investor needs and disrupt the traditionally high-cost advice marketplace using quantitative insights to uncover areas of opportunity and drive strategies that enhance the client experience. You will play a critical role in implementing the use of advanced analytics into business processes to drive strategic decision making and deepen understanding of our participants.

Summary.

We are looking for passionate crew who want to leverage the power of analytics to drive strategic enhancements to the client experience. As a senior analyst, you will use quantitative methods to inform strategy, uncover areas of opportunity, and enhance the client experience. You will perform descriptive and predictive analyses, design and measure experiments with statistical rigor, and visualize data to deliver actionable insights.

Core Responsibilities

Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and leads projects through completion. Delegates tasks and provides tactical and strategic guidance to peers.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using advanced analytical methods. Validates analytical techniques employed by other analysts.
Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
Develops, owns and manages recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Mentors, coaches, trains, and develops junior data analysts. Proactively expands knowledge of business and analytics and shares with team members. Shares and documents best practices.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum of five years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.

Additional Skills

Undergraduate degree in an analytic/quantitative field such as: Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related analytical field of study or equivalent combination of training and experience. A graduate level degree in an analytics focused field is strongly preferred
Advanced level skills in SQL. Proficiency with relational databases or Big Data platforms, Data Analysis packages (Python, R, SAS etc.) and Data Visualization packages (Tableau, etc.)
Advanced analytical skills, coupled with the ability to form hypotheses and draw meaningful insights from disparate data sources. The ability to understand data, process it, extract value from it, visualize it and communicate insights to audiences of various backgrounds, including senior management
Bonus points for experience with advanced statistical and machine-learning methods such as: regression models, propensity models, segmentation, optimization, experimental test design, time series analysis, cohort analysis, Bayesian methods, decision trees, text analysis, etc

Special Factor

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

AT&T Global Public Sector is a trusted provider of secure, IP enabled, cloud-based, network solutions and professional services to the Federal Government. We are dedicated to recruiting, developing and empowering a diverse, high-performing workforce that is passionate about what they do, committed to our shared values and dedicated to our customers’ mission.

Our National Security Team supports our Nation’s Intelligence Community (IC), with specific emphasis on delivering advanced networking, big data, and cyber analytic capabilities.

AT&T has an opening for a data analyst who is passionate about driving business decisions based on data. They will join a team that has provided exemplary support for a government customer’s classified network for over twenty years. This individual will play a critical role in defining analytic techniques for managing emerging capabilities, as well as provide analytic support for legacy program functionality.

Job Duties/Responsibilities:
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Integrate data from multiple sources, design and implement new tools and techniques for measuring and improving program productivity
Maintain current monitoring capabilities, detect and troubleshoot network problems and traffic anomalies
Make recommendations for optimization when resources are limited and provide input to capacity and capability planning processes.
They will be expected to come up to speed very quickly, develop a broad understanding of a complicated network and participate in decision-making as the network evolves.

Required Clearance:

TSSCI and willing to sit for poly (#ts/sci) (#polygraph)

Required Qualifications:
Track record of innovative and successful approaches to data analysis, statistical analysis, pattern recognition, or intrusion detection . 3+ years of data analysis, statistical analysis, modeling or simulation techniques.
3+ yrs experience in Unix or Linux environments using Unix scripting languages (e.g., perl, python or awk).
In-depth experience with both TDM and IP protocols and applications.
Ability to work independently as well as part of a team that includes remotely located colleagues.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including ability to present highly technical material in an accessible manner.
Education: MS in any STEM field (or equivalent experience)

Desired Qualifications:

Cybersecurity expertise, Experience writing requirements, Protocol analysis, Working knowledge of basic statistics, Familiarity with BGP and/or other routing protocols, Familiarity with AT&T Architecture.

Ready to join our team? Apply today!

Description

Robert Half is looking for a Senior Data Analyst for a rapidly growing client in the healthcare space. This role will be focused in exploring the data and unlocking insights that will open up opportunities for clinical professionals. Tech stack includes Python, SQL, and AWS (S3, AWS Redshift, RDS, Postgres).

Responsibilities Include
Quantitatively explore rich historical data from sites, other stakeholders and use it to uncover applicable insights to enable more effective trial support and more predictable enrollment management decisions.
Collaborate with diverse teams of technical and non-technical stakeholders to deliver insights through models, reports, visualizations, dashboards, and other mediums.
Develop clean, reusable, and testable analytical code and make use of existing data team libraries and modules
Working in techniques including frequentist/Bayesian (bio)statistical modeling, supervised/unsupervised learning, and linear/nonlinear regression.
You bring substantial experience working scalably with Python and SQL and working with structured and unstructured data from a variety of cloud-based (e.g. S3, AWS Redshift, RDS, Postgres) and offline sources
Requirements

SQL, Spark SQL, Python, Amazon Web Services (AWS), AWS CloudTrail, AWS Technologies, AWS Technologies, AWS CloudTrail, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Data Analytics, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Analysis Tools

You could be the one who changes everything for our 25 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, multi-national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Position Purpose
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims, provider, member, and encounters data. Identify and assess the business impact of trends
Develop, maintain, and troubleshoot complex scripts and reports developed using SQL, Microsoft Excel, or other analytics tools
Contribute to the planning and execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
Assist in the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation

Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines and thrive in a demanding, quickly changing environment

Partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners

Provide technical guidance to junior analysts

The Data Analyst (Healthcare Analytics) will have the opportunity to make a significant impact through the discovery, development, and implementation of leading-edge analytics that answer important business questions. The analyst will collaborate with key corporate and health plan business partners for the purpose of identifying and delivering robust reporting and analytics capabilities to drive improved business performance.

Education/Experience
Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience.
Master's degree preferred.
4+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management or 2+ years of IT experience.
Healthcare analytics experience preferred.
Ability to integrate, validate, and reconcile data from multiple sources as well as design and construct analysis tools that extract, prepare, analyze, and store/present results to support business needs.
Knowledge of query development using SQL or other coding languages.
Knowledge of basic statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Working knowledge of analytical tools, including R, Python, SAS, ArcGIS, QGIS, Microstrategy, Tableau, Hadoop, or related tools preferred.
Working knowledge of relational databases preferred.
Working knowledge of automation capabilities such as batch processes, stored procedures, scripting languages, Microstrategy, or other tools preferred.

Must have experience in Banking domain. Requirement Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion. Experience in SSIS SQL Server Managing users and user roles. Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.

In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace.

Work you'll do
Provide strategic and predictive data analytic support to include identification of data sources.
Employ data analytic methodologies and data science modeling, algorithms, and other techniques and tools to identify trends, provide analysis, make assessments, inform decision making, and incorporate insights into intelligence and other products by increasing data driven decision making.
Collect, analyze, and present data and trends in support of IC-demographic and IC-workforce reports and Congressional tasks.
The team

Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.

The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.

Qualifications

Required:
3+ years of experience with data mining and predictive modeling, data analytics and digital data science
Bachelor's degree
Active certification: AWS Certified Solutions Architect
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future
Active TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance required
Preferred:
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics or Computer Science
Experience with developing and implementing advanced analytics on large datasets to identify threats and vulnerabilities on a network
Experience with the following technologies, systems, and tools: SQL, Python, Tableau, and Spark, Analytics and Modeling Tools
How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

About Us

DailyPay is the leader in the on-demand pay industry with an unrivaled technology platform, an unmatched list of blue-chip clients and an extensive list of industry awards. We are rewriting the invisible rules of finance by creating a new financial system. A financial system that is more equitable and inclusive, and benefits everyone. A financial system that enables workers to access their earned pay when they need it. We believe that money should move faster and smoother between employer and employee, between merchant and shopper, between financial institution and customer.

We are a mission-driven company hyper-focused on designing technology that can build a better financial system and future. It's no wonder that we are growing at an extraordinary pace. Now we are looking for people who are as passionate as we are about reimagining how money moves. If you're willing to define new rules, change systems and lives, come join us at DailyPay.

The Role

As an Associate Tableau Developer, Revenue Analytics, your work, whether it's modeling business scenarios or tracking performance metrics, is used by our leaders to make strategic company decisions. You will focus on building key Tableau reporting as we scale the Revenue team. Working on multiple projects at a time, you will be focused on the details while finding creative ways to take on big picture challenges.

As someone who knows the workings of the Revenue Team inside and out, you'll lead individual projects to transform planning, tracking and control processes. You will focus on building key Tableau reporting as we scale the Revenue team. You'll provide senior level management with insightful recommendations, planning and reporting support. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, you will be an important partner and advisor to the business. You will report directly to the Director of Revenue Analytics.

The Data Analyst, Revenue Analytics role is located in New York City and will report to the Director of Revenue Analytics. If this opportunity excites you, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the qualifications.If this opportunity excites you, we encourage you to apply even if you do not meet all of the qualifications.

How You Will Make An Impact
Tableau Reporting and Dashboards: Own creation of reports and dashboards to measure and report on key revenue metrics, and perform deep analyses on the leading, in-process, and lagging indicators to support the revenue organization.
Process & Methodology: Proactively monitor and strive to maintain high levels of data quality, accuracy, and process consistency across all Revenue Operations functions.
Drive end to end initiatives: Aligned with the strategic quarterly goals of the Revenue Org and the company, support strategic projects working internally and cross functionally.
Compensation Plans: Support Director of Revenue Analytics and team on evaluating, recommending, and managing compensation plans and incentive schemes to motivate teams and align incentives to corporate OKRs. Work cross functionally with HR, Finance and other departments.
Sales Forecast and Territory Management: Enable a best-in-class sales forecast, pipeline and operating cadence. This will include everything from gathering data, improving predictive measures, running analysis, and facilitating forecasting and planning while supporting on territory design and administration to ensure all teams have the right list of companies to support hitting their aggressive targets.
Support on revenue org productivity and efficiency improvements: Unify and standardize actionable insights from reporting tools across revenue teams. Support on implementing regular reporting of key performance metrics including forecasting, funnel analysis, and pipeline management by working with Finance and Sales. Capacity management, headcount projections, budget approvals and facilitating and tracking of recruitment across all the revenue teams
Budgeting: Work with Finance and Revenue leadership on Annual budgeting, and monthly/quarterly tracking and insights areas of deviations and recommendations
What You Bring To The Team
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline (Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Mathematics)
3+ years of experience in an analytics or data-driven role
2+ years of Tableau Desktop experience required
A portfolio of Tableau Dashboards a plus
2+ years of SQL experience
Advanced Excel and Salesforce reporting a nice to have
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Exceptional analytical abilities and sharp attention to detail
Excellent communication skills in a variety of mediums - must be comfortable working cross-functionally with people at multiple levels and from multiple disciplinary backgrounds
What We Offer
Competitive compensation
Opportunity for equity ownership
Exceptional health, vision, and dental care
Employee Resource Groups
Fun company outings and events
Unlimited books from Amazon
Unlimited PTO
401K with company match
No sponsorship is available for this position.

The Junior Data Analyst is responsible for analyzing and manipulating data along with researching data. The incumbent will collect and validate critical data elements [in addition to identifying aberrant or missing data elements] to accurately perform fair lending analyses utilizing basic statistical techniques (mean, standard deviations). The candidate will be comfortable [and preferably experienced] in managing large quantities of data with a demonstrated ability to quickly assimilate/organize large amounts of new information; identify possible exceptions and trends; document results and produce professional summary of findings or reports.

About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

Toptal is seeking an experienced, results-driven Data Analyst, SEO who will be responsible for analyzing data and obtaining insights for use in daily activities and projects which will be focused on increasing the organic visibility of the Toptal website. This person will be responsible for interpreting market, web, and business metrics to identify high-impact optimization opportunities and working cross-functionally with product, engineering, and content teams to implement them. This role will also have a heavy focus on conducting experimentation, technical SEO, and helping maintain and build our analytics capabilities.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities
Monitor and report on KPIs, share with the SEO and adjacent teams, and quickly respond to divergences.
Help design SEO experiments and test new strategies and opportunities for growth.
Analyze SEO test results and execute next steps at a fast pace.
Analyze keyword, traffic, user, and business trends to gain insight and take action.
Lead, manage, and prioritize projects that involve cross-functional stakeholders.
Grow the business through technical SEO, data analysis, and various optimizations.
Participate in understanding each department’s SEO needs and evangelizing SEO.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct coding problems.
Help locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
The Successful Candidate For This Role Will Be
Passionate and curious in problem-solving: You’re genuinely curious about how and why people search, interested in SEO best practices and trends, and relish in the analytical and technical depths of the industry. You have a knack for identifying problems and finding solutions.
Extremely detail-oriented professional: You can also see the forest from the trees, balancing the intricacies of a discipline like SEO with larger company objectives.
Quantitative yet Pragmatic: You have a data-driven approach to making decisions.
Analytical, tactical & strategic: You have experience building a strategic and tactical plan based on analyzing large amounts of data, from multiple sources.
Responsible and Responsive: You’re able to work autonomously and take pride in your work, with a sense of urgency, and grit through difficulty to deliver high-quality results. Strong organizational skills to manage multiple concurrent projects.
Driven: You’re an ambitious go-getter who takes initiative without being asked and over-delivers on promises.
An excellent communicator: You have the ability to clearly communicate and evangelize data insights.
Results-driven: You’re focused on achieving results, setting ambitious goals, and able to prioritize appropriately by understanding the balance of value.
Innovative: You’re constantly focused on improving, growing, and coming up with new ways to grow and scale the business through actionable data-driven opportunities and trends.
Teamwork & positive attitude: You work collaboratively with a positive and can-do approach to opportunities and challenges to get the right things done quickly.
In The First Week, Expect To
Onboard and integrate into Toptal.
Familiarize yourself with current and past SEO strategies and tactics.
Dive into the roadmap and the biggest opportunities for improvement.
Connect with a series of direct and adjacent team members.
In The First Month, Expect To
Hit the ground running with analysis and deriving insights from available data for SEO/Business.
In The First Three Months, Expect To
Expand your abilities into specific projects and getting more acquainted with opportunities.
In The First Six Months, Expect To
Contribute to high-value projects and experimentations.
In The First Year, Expect To
Develop ideas for SEO through data analysis and dive deeper into data projects.
Requirements
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience (preferred in quantitative fields such as economics, mathematics, statistics, or computer science/engineering).
Demonstrable track record of success at driving significant results & business growth.
3+ years of web analytics experience with enterprise level websites (i.e. hundreds of thousands or millions of pages).
Advanced excel/google sheet skills and SQL is required.
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills; experience synthesizing data into information, and presenting concise analyses.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Experience with text analytics.
Experience with Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Tableau, Kibana strongly desired.
Experience and knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analyzing datasets using R and/or Python.
Functional knowledge of JavaScript, CSS and HTML is strongly preferred.
Ability to analyze optimization needs of webpages is a plus.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks).
Knowledge of SEO tools and data sets, and an understanding of search engine workings are a plus.
For Toptal Use Only: , #west, #midwest, #ussouth, #northeast, #southamerica, #canada, #uk, #europe

Loom is the video communication platform for async work that helps companies communicate better at scale. Loom makes it easy to record quick videos of your screen and camera and instantly share them with a link. More than 14M users across more than 200k companies around the world trust Loom to share feedback, updates, intros, training, and more – every day. Founded in late 2015, Loom has raised $203M from world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Iconic, and Coatue.

The Role

We’re looking to add a Senior Analyst to our growing Product Data Science & Analytics team to help us measure the impact of our Product Growth initiatives and identify opportunities to expand the network of people who use async video at work. In this role you will help the Growth PM team drive initiatives that range from big bets that inflect Loom’s growth trajectory to quick wins that continuously remove friction for our users.

We have rich, complex datasets and our team performs a wide variety of analytical tasks, ranging from conducting ad-hoc research, creating dashboards, building funnels, designing and evaluating tests, crafting complex database queries and ETL pipelines, and developing sophisticated predictive models. The ideal candidate will be data-driven, intellectually curious, and a clear communicator.
We are currently hiring remotely in the United States and Canada
Responsibilities
Be a primary partner for the Product Growth team and collaborate with Product, Engineering and Design to understand growth and optimization opportunities and measure impact of initiatives
Provide data insights through A/B testing, dashboards, user behavior analyses and ad-hoc requests
Design and develop core business metrics, creating insightful automated dashboards (and the necessary data pipelines) and data visualization to track progress
Proactively derive data insights and turn them into growth recommendations, communicate results and learnings to the rest of the team
Lead A/B experiments from the Data side by supporting experiment design, tracking, implementation and owning the final analysis and readout
Build analytics plans for new products and features, helping the Product Growth team understand which metrics need to be measured and which events need to be tracked
Inform future experimentation design and roadmaps by performing exploratory analysis to understand user acquisition and activation behavior
Lead and mentor team members with processes and analytical and technical expertise for executing experiments, building pipelines and answering open ended business questions
What We're Looking For
5+ years of experience in an analytics role turning data into insights and recommendations
Strong analytical and communication skills with the ability to synthesize insights into compelling stories
Experience with the SaaS customer lifecycle from acquisition to retention
Experience with designing and analyzing experiments
Superior SQL (Snowflake, Postgres) skills - able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets
Experience with a Business Intelligence tool (e.g. Tableau or Mode)
Experience with a statistical scripting language (e.g. R or Python) is a plus
Experience with ETL tools such as Airflow or DBT is a plus
Experience in data modeling and ETL development is a plus
Experience collaborating with multiple business functions and stakeholders to develop metrics and key insights
A Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field or higher
How We Work

Freedom and Flexibility: At Loom, we believe work is an act, not a place. When we disengage work from a location, we can accommodate a broad range of life choices. You can choose to work from home or while you travel. If you are in the Bay Area, you can drop by our San Francisco office on 2nd and Market St. We are able to hire across the United States and Canada and are continuing to expand our international presence. And you are free to move within a country without any adjustment to compensation.

Engaging Workday: The key to an engaging workday is finding the right balance between different ways to work sync, async, text and video. Loom makes it easier for us to say what we mean without having to schedule a zoom meeting or struggle to find the right words. And using async communication allows us to free up time for deep work every day. We believe there's a place for sync time - often a conversation on Zoom is exactly what is needed. For team meetings, this ‘sync time’ is typically between 9AM-Noon PT given where the overlap of timezones where Loommates are located.

Work-Rest Balance: The way we balance the fast-paced demands of a high-growth startup and sustainability is making rest a priority. We offer a flexible PTO policy so you're able to take time off when you need it. We also go fully offline once a year between Christmas and New Year (and twice during the Pandemic). Rest is also part of the workday, not just during PTO. Taking a break for personal commitments, whether it's watching the kids or getting some exercise is a natural part of the workday.

Social Connection: Relationships and connectedness matter. We are intentional about building trust and relationships through unique, shared experiences. Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Looms celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Loommates are able to meet in person with their teams at least twice a year purely for fun. We have also built local offices for those who want to work or meet in person, starting with San Francisco and New York City.

Perks at Loom
Competitive compensation and equity package
99% company paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents (for US employees)
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DCFSA)
Healthcare reimbursement (for International employees)
Life, AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance
401(k) with 4% company matching
Professional development reimbursement
Wellness stipends
Unlimited PTO
Paid parental leave
Remote work opportunities
Home office & technology reimbursement

Description

Many of the world’s top engineers and scientists come together in our Water business because they view a community’s interaction with water a bit differently—as a single holistic system, rather than unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. Working throughout the hydrologic cycle, we are delivering sustainable solutions to make sure water is where it should be and available when needed. Our experts guide our work with scientific rigor, an innovative spirit, and a vision for growth. Luxottica is a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of fashion, luxury and sports eyewear. Our wholesale network covers more than 150 countries and our retail presence consists of over 9,100 retail stores across the globe.
