About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

Toptal is seeking an experienced, results-driven Data Analyst, SEO who will be responsible for analyzing data and obtaining insights for use in daily activities and projects which will be focused on increasing the organic visibility of the Toptal website. This person will be responsible for interpreting market, web, and business metrics to identify high-impact optimization opportunities and working cross-functionally with product, engineering, and content teams to implement them. This role will also have a heavy focus on conducting experimentation, technical SEO, and helping maintain and build our analytics capabilities.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities
Monitor and report on KPIs, share with the SEO and adjacent teams, and quickly respond to divergences.
Help design SEO experiments and test new strategies and opportunities for growth.
Analyze SEO test results and execute next steps at a fast pace.
Analyze keyword, traffic, user, and business trends to gain insight and take action.
Lead, manage, and prioritize projects that involve cross-functional stakeholders.
Grow the business through technical SEO, data analysis, and various optimizations.
Participate in understanding each department’s SEO needs and evangelizing SEO.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct coding problems.
Help locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
The Successful Candidate For This Role Will Be
Passionate and curious in problem-solving: You’re genuinely curious about how and why people search, interested in SEO best practices and trends, and relish in the analytical and technical depths of the industry. You have a knack for identifying problems and finding solutions.
Extremely detail-oriented professional: You can also see the forest from the trees, balancing the intricacies of a discipline like SEO with larger company objectives.
Quantitative yet Pragmatic: You have a data-driven approach to making decisions.
Analytical, tactical & strategic: You have experience building a strategic and tactical plan based on analyzing large amounts of data, from multiple sources.
Responsible and Responsive: You’re able to work autonomously and take pride in your work, with a sense of urgency, and grit through difficulty to deliver high-quality results. Strong organizational skills to manage multiple concurrent projects.
Driven: You’re an ambitious go-getter who takes initiative without being asked and over-delivers on promises.
An excellent communicator: You have the ability to clearly communicate and evangelize data insights.
Results-driven: You’re focused on achieving results, setting ambitious goals, and able to prioritize appropriately by understanding the balance of value.
Innovative: You’re constantly focused on improving, growing, and coming up with new ways to grow and scale the business through actionable data-driven opportunities and trends.
Teamwork & positive attitude: You work collaboratively with a positive and can-do approach to opportunities and challenges to get the right things done quickly.
In The First Week, Expect To
Onboard and integrate into Toptal.
Familiarize yourself with current and past SEO strategies and tactics.
Dive into the roadmap and the biggest opportunities for improvement.
Connect with a series of direct and adjacent team members.
In The First Month, Expect To
Hit the ground running with analysis and deriving insights from available data for SEO/Business.
In The First Three Months, Expect To
Expand your abilities into specific projects and getting more acquainted with opportunities.
In The First Six Months, Expect To
Contribute to high-value projects and experimentations.
In The First Year, Expect To
Develop ideas for SEO through data analysis and dive deeper into data projects.
Requirements
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience (preferred in quantitative fields such as economics, mathematics, statistics, or computer science/engineering).
Demonstrable track record of success at driving significant results & business growth.
3+ years of web analytics experience with enterprise level websites (i.e. hundreds of thousands or millions of pages).
Advanced excel/google sheet skills and SQL is required.
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills; experience synthesizing data into information, and presenting concise analyses.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Experience with text analytics.
Experience with Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Tableau, Kibana strongly desired.
Experience and knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analyzing datasets using R and/or Python.
Functional knowledge of JavaScript, CSS and HTML is strongly preferred.
Ability to analyze optimization needs of webpages is a plus.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks).
Knowledge of SEO tools and data sets, and an understanding of search engine workings are a plus.

Cloud Operations + Innovation (CO+I) is the team behind one of the World’s largest Cloud Infrastructures, responsible for powering all Microsoft online Products and Services as well as powering Microsoft’s “Cloud First” mission. Our focus is on smart growth, high efficiency, and delivering a trusted experience to customers and partners worldwide, and we are looking for passionate, high energy data scientist/analyst to help achieve that mission.

If you want to have fundamental impact on how Microsoft’s Cloud is deployed and operated globally, want to be involved with one of the most strategically important teams at Microsoft, have strong technical and business acumen, leadership, creativity, and out of the box thinking are some of the skills you bring to the table - this job is for you!

In this role, the successful candidate will have demonstrable experience fostering a data-driven culture that enables stakeholders to make informed decisions through data that positively impact the business. The individual in this role will work across CO+I teams to understand and operationalize their analytical requirements and priorities and work closely with program managers, analysts, and management to create and deliver insightful analyses.

This is a hands-on data analyst role and will suit those individuals who are passionate about data analytics, is comfortable dealing with ambiguity, and has a track record of storytelling and making data-driven recommendations to drive business value. The ideal candidate is passionate about data and is experienced in a full range of data science and data engineering skills. A successful candidate will have experience in solving complex business problems through data analysis, building proof-of-concepts to prove out business value, and partner with the team to build out BI solutions in a deadline-driven environment, with a quality-first mindset.

Success in this role will depend on ability to translate business requirements into data-driven analytical projects and experiments. It will also depend on the ability to synthesize findings and effectively communicate the findings through visualizations. The data analyst needs to be comfortable working with data from diverse structured and unstructured sources in a variety of formats. Are you someone who is an out of the box, strategic thinker who thrives in a complex, ambiguous, fast-paced environment with the desire to deliver on BI solutions?  If so, this Data Analyst job is for you!

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities:

As a Data Analyst on our team within the Core Operations Functions (COF) organization, you will own the end-to-end reporting and key data assets utilized by leadership review and analysis.
Collaborate across teams to define our future state data strategy and data model.
Collaborate across teams to advance our tooling and capabilities.
Interpret data and analyses, write reports, create dashboards, and make actionable recommendations.
Evangelize analysis results to key stakeholders to positively impact player and business outcomes.
Define, automate, and deliver core reporting as a tool for presenting results and aid in storytelling.
Present insights and learnings to key stakeholders and executives in standard business forums.
Define, generate, automate, and monitor OKR metrics for the team. Ensure metrics are both simple to understand and easy to use in driving the business.
Manipulate and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources using a variety of tools and data analysis techniques.
Define and implement data governance policies and procedures.
Provide clarity to business and technical stakeholders on our data nuances.
Continually seek opportunities in how we can make better use of data to inform better business decisions.
Learn, live, and coach the One Microsoft culture and values. Lead through change by bringing clarity, generating energy, and delivering success.

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Engineering, or other Information Technology related fields
2+ years of experience in processing and building visualizations using reporting tools such as Power BI and Excel

Ampla Technologies is a New York-based financial technology company with an overarching mission to provide tech-enabled financial solutions to help consumer brands grow and scale. Ampla's flagship working capital product solves universal pain points for growing brands that are caused by major cash outlays required for inventory purchasing and marketing spend prior to revenue realization. Ampla currently serves SMBs in the consumer brand industry across both ecommerce and retail channels.

Company Overview

Ampla Technologies is a New York-based financial technology company with an overarching mission to provide tech-enabled financial solutions to help consumer brands grow. Ampla's flagship working capital product solves universal pain points caused by major cash outlays for inventory purchasing and marketing spend prior to revenue realization. Ampla currently serves SMBs in the consumer brand industry across both ecommerce and retail channels.

Position Overview

Ampla is hiring a Data Analyst to architect solutions for both customer-facing apps and internal stakeholders. We are looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to drive existing and future work streams as well as uncover improvement opportunities. You'll be leading these efforts by identifying and detailing the requirements needed for these initiatives to succeed. To accomplish this, you'll be working alongside talented colleagues from our Engineering, Finance, Go-to-Market, Operations, and Product teams.

This role will be one of the first 60 employees for a hyper growth VC-backed FinTech startup and will have the opportunity to make a meaningful contribution to the success of the business.

Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with cross-functional partners to deeply understand business problems and be a guiding voice in architecting the solutions.
Scope, design and build tools for direct user interaction with data sets and increase their efficiency ten-fold.
Design, execute, analyze, and interpret the results of experiments across our products and customer segments.
Work with business stakeholders and engineers to reconcile crucial data integrity issues.
Maintain a strong data-driven culture within the company by interacting with diverse internal functions.

Key Skills
2+ years in a Software Engineering / Data Analytics / Data Science role.
Experience with data pipelines and data warehousing, such as Big Query and Snowflake.
Experience working with SQL or NoSQL databases.
Familiarity working with backend programming languages (Python, Java, etc).
Previous experience with Data Engineering is highly desirable.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills including interaction with different business functions.
Professional experience with Airflow, BigQuery, dbt, or Looker in a large production environment
Experience with building fintech products
Experience working with large volumes of financial, e-commerce or advertising data
Built or maintained integrations with 3rd party platforms involving financial, e-commerce or advertising data

We are looking for an experienced analyst on the Analytics Team who will provide analytical support to the sales, marketing, and business development departments. Core responsibilities include optimizing campaigns, preparing and interpreting data and reporting, and reviewing key performance indicators (KPIs) to provide suggestions and guidance to both our clients and internal teams.

Responsibilities
Compile, analyze, and interpret marketplace data to maximize revenue and profitability.
Be an expert on the MediaAlpha platform’s tools and data.
Help clients build, execute, and optimize campaigns and measure results.
Provide consultative and strategic marketing guidance for clients.
Build templates, tools, and dashboards to support all facets of a business unit.
Build, automate, and iterate on bidding strategies.

Strong analytical ability and experience synthesizing large data sets.
Capacity to think critically and creatively, identify problems, and propose solutions.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

In alignment with Vanguard’s dedication to making advice more accessible and affordable for investors, Vanguard Institutional is dedicated to supporting all aspects of our growing advice businesses for our Institutional clients and participants. This role will deliver analytics to supplement Vanguard’s hardworking roster of advice-focused products and advisors and offer leadership and development opportunities. As a member of a growing team supporting a strategic initiative, you will have a unique opportunity to advance analytics capabilities as Vanguard’s Advice business grows.

This position is designated as hybrid (In-office + remote) and will be based in one of Vanguard’s business centers (Malvern PA, Charlotte NC, Scottsdale AZ, Plano TX) when the time comes for our offices to re-open in 2022.

Create the strategies and experiences that are changing an industry.

In Vanguard's Institutional (IIG) division, we serve millions of employees (known as participants) by partnering with their employers to create smart, effective retirement plans and ensure our low-cost, high-performing funds are available within retirement plans. As an analyst, you’ll help us build and evolve our advice experiences, capabilities, and product line-up to serve the needs of individual investors and plan sponsors. You’ll help us tap into unmet investor needs and disrupt the traditionally high-cost advice marketplace using quantitative insights to uncover areas of opportunity and drive strategies that enhance the client experience. You will play a critical role in implementing the use of advanced analytics into business processes to drive strategic decision making and deepen understanding of our participants.

Summary.

We are looking for passionate crew who want to leverage the power of analytics to drive strategic enhancements to the client experience. As a senior analyst, you will use quantitative methods to inform strategy, uncover areas of opportunity, and enhance the client experience. You will perform descriptive and predictive analyses, design and measure experiments with statistical rigor, and visualize data to deliver actionable insights.

Core Responsibilities

Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and leads projects through completion. Delegates tasks and provides tactical and strategic guidance to peers.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using advanced analytical methods. Validates analytical techniques employed by other analysts.
Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
Develops, owns and manages recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Mentors, coaches, trains, and develops junior data analysts. Proactively expands knowledge of business and analytics and shares with team members. Shares and documents best practices.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum of five years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.

Additional Skills

Undergraduate degree in an analytic/quantitative field such as: Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related analytical field of study or equivalent combination of training and experience. A graduate level degree in an analytics focused field is strongly preferred
Advanced level skills in SQL. Proficiency with relational databases or Big Data platforms, Data Analysis packages (Python, R, SAS etc.) and Data Visualization packages (Tableau, etc.)
Advanced analytical skills, coupled with the ability to form hypotheses and draw meaningful insights from disparate data sources. The ability to understand data, process it, extract value from it, visualize it and communicate insights to audiences of various backgrounds, including senior management
Bonus points for experience with advanced statistical and machine-learning methods such as: regression models, propensity models, segmentation, optimization, experimental test design, time series analysis, cohort analysis, Bayesian methods, decision trees, text analysis, etc

Special Factor

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

Job # 597728

When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

What You’ll Be Doing...

At Verizon, we run a world-class Engineering organization and as a part of the Engineering Program Office that manages large capital programs using state of the art analytics seek to improve the capital planning and management processes, enhancing systems, realigning the organization, and adding opportunities for personal skill-building and professional growth. The Network Strategy, Planning, and Engineering Analytics team supports multiple Verizon Lines of Business on strategy planning, geospatial data analytics, engineering support, and visual analytics.

As a Data Analyst on the team, you’ll work as part of an interdisciplinary team including Computer Scientists and Network Engineers and interact with internal Lines of Business and external business partners. You’re a data enthusiast eager to ingest, explore, and make connections between multiple large datasets from different sources. You’re analytical and a quick thinker capable of extracting valuable insights from data. You’re familiar with techniques for data munging and wrangling using multiple software packages. You work with a sense of urgency and have strong interpersonal and communication skills. You let your data come alive through creative storytelling and data visualization. You're able to present your insights with confidence, and have the leadership qualities to enable other teams to learn how to analyze the data. You’ll also connect various data locations to stage data before visualizations. The business insights and recommendations you provide will help to improve performance.
Identifying business problems and developing analytic techniques to provide solutions to external teams.
Driving multiple technical and data-related projects of varying scopes and complexities.
Working with other business units within Verizon, vendors, and executives to represent and drive our organization's strategy.
Using data visualization and other data-gathering methods to either provide internal strategic direction or guide decisions for other teams.
In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.

What We’re Looking For...

You are good with numbers and you love to dig into data to find the story. Crafting reports and dashboards is a fun afternoon for you. You’re able to translate numbers into compelling stories - and tailor your presentation and recommendations to the audience function and level to meet their needs. You are detail-oriented and know how to focus on what really matters. You have a knack for understanding and visualizing just the right way to share data and practical insights so that people can understand. You enjoy aligning various work streams to ensure the same vision and goal is achieved. We’re looking for someone who can partner with a product group to provide business intelligence from understanding what’s going on with the business, identifying the right data, conducting research and doing analyses, to coming up with insights and making recommendations. The business insights you provide will help your product team run better and make better decisions. Collaborating with your product group to understand business needs and staying up to date on all the product initiatives and plans.

You’ll Need To Have
Associate’s degree or two or more years of work experience.
Three or more years of relevant work experience.
Willingness to travel.
Even better if you have one or more of the following:
A degree in Business, Marketing, Information Systems, Analytics/Business Intelligence, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or in a related field.
Demonstrated experience with SQL (PostgreSQL, Oracle, Teradata).
Experience working with statistical packages like R, Python, SPSS, JMP, or SAS.
Experience creating powerful data visualizations using various tools (Tableau, matplotlib, D3.js).
Lead projects independently from start to finish in a team environment.
Experience crafting and delivering executive level presentations to non-technical audience including data summaries and visualizations.
Ability to adapt to quickly changing business environments which has changing priorities on a daily basis.
Experience working with large datasets using tools like SQL, Hadoop, MapReduce, Pig/Hive, Spark, H2O.
Experience working with NoSQL databases and big data repositories (Hadoop) and cloud-based repositories (AWS, Google Cloud).
Experience working with business intelligence systems to provide diagnostic self-serve information to clients and business units.
Program management experience.
Experience with SQL/NoSQL or equivalent programs.
Experience with Word, Excel, and PowerPoint presentation creation.
Experience with 5G, C-Band, Wireless technologies.
Business intelligence/visualization software experience (e.g., Tableau, Qlik, Splunk).
Data mining, preparation and modeling experience.
Statistical analysis language experience.
Data preparation tool experience.
Communication and presentation skills.

Your role
Are you detail oriented, with experience in translating analysis into real world insights? Are you a versatile individual who is able to juggle tasks ranging from administrative processes to technical analysis? Are you passionate about overseeing delivery of a high quality product to a variety of stakeholders and working in an environment where no two days are the same?

This Capital Management Data Analyst will be required to:

support data quality issue related activity across a range of stakeholders
monitor, track and report on status of data quality issues impacting capital management
establish and maintain transparency of how data quality impacts the capital management process and results
ensure that data quality issues are appropriately compensated for

Your team
You will be part of the Capital Management Process Oversight (CMPO) team. This role is within UBS's Capital Management group which oversees the front to back Capital Management framework and process. CMPO is responsible for coordinating the data management exercises surrounding Capital Management and ensuring that items such as data quality issues impacting the process are tracked, assessed, mitigated and remediated.

This role will liaise with Finance, Risk and the Data Management Office (DMO) to coordinate data quality identification, tracking and mitigation across the capital management process. This role will also be responsible for identifying data quality impacts to capital management process and how those impacts are controlled to ensure a quality product.

Diversity helps us grow, together. That’s why we are committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.

Your expertise
You have:

3 years of experience, preferably in the financial services, tech or Data Management Industry
demonstrated knowledge and skills in data quality management
hands on experience regarding data quality practices such as data profiling/analysis and impact analysis
excellent stakeholder management and communication skills, both written and oral; comfortable interacting with colleagues at all levels
strong investigative mindset
advanced MS Excel skills (lookups, pivot tables, VBA) are preferred
advanced data visualization skills (Power BI, Tableau) are preferred

You Are

methodical, concise and accurate, with strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills, including the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
collaborative with the ability to bring teams to work together towards a common goal, listen to different views and facilitate decision making in a proactive manner
team player with a flexible and adaptable approach to work, and a motivated self-starter

The team

Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise.

The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights.

Qualifications

Required:
3+ years of experience with data mining and predictive modeling, data analytics and digital data science
Bachelor's degree
Active certification: AWS Certified Solutions Architect
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future
Active TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance required
Preferred:
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics or Computer Science
Experience with developing and implementing advanced analytics on large datasets to identify threats and vulnerabilities on a network
Experience with the following technologies, systems, and tools: SQL, Python, Tableau, and Spark, Analytics and Modeling Tools
How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Do you have a passion for data? Are you interested in being part of a team that takes data and creates tools that highlight successes and provides insight into new opportunities for Vanguard to grow?

This is a great opportunity to join the expanding Chief Data Analytics office and join the team supporting IIG (Institutional Investor Group). Crew will develop an understanding of B2B sales strategies, sales compensation plans and broaden their network with Senior level leaders and crew.

Responsibilities will include utilizing New Ways of Working techniques, working with MS Dynamics and communicating directly with crew to effectively administer sales plans and improve efficiencies for the organization.

Core Responsibilities

Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and leads projects through completion. Delegates tasks and provides tactical and strategic guidance to peers.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using advanced analytical methods. Validates analytical techniques employed by other analysts.
Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
Develops, owns and manages recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Mentors, coaches, trains, and develops junior data analysts. Proactively expands knowledge of business and analytics and shares with team members. Shares and documents best practices.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum of five years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

The Role

We are excited to invite applications for the position of Digital Data & Identity Analyst within our Global Digital Applications Team. Operating within the world’s leading Oral Care Company, we are leveraging leading cloud based marketing technology to digitally connect. This role will support our Digital Marketing and CRM organization in deploying best in class technology to optimize and expand our digital engagement programs leading to better targeting and engagement with our professionals, customers and consumers.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to join our team to help realize our vision. This role will involve planning, business and data analysis, functional and technical design, as well as the implementation of Digital Marketing and Customer Data Platform Technology. The ideal candidate is very customer focused and can work well both independently and within a team. Candidate needs to be a self-starter- eager to learn and leverage new technologies to build the best digital experience for our customers.

What You Will Do
Define & implement the digital marketing technology in support of our global strategy for First Party Data Acquisition
Configure and Implement customer focused platforms including Customer Data Platforms, Data Management Platforms, and Real Time Interaction platforms

Develop recommendations, strategies, methodologies to ensure that deliverables are met against campaign goals

Perform data analysis and modeling and ingest relevant first party data to further develop and identify new audience targets
Research and recommend new digital marketing technologies to advance our capabilities in digital advertising and marketing analytics.
Understand the Company’s consumer and professional environment and how we use technology across multiple platforms, including but not limited to: Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Google Cloud Platform, SAP Customer Data Cloud (Gigya), SAP Marketing Cloud, SAP Commerce, and Adobe Experience Manager.
Provide input into estimating engagement activities and execute engagements following the Agile methodology including SCRUM
Document knowledge and share best practices

Minimum of 2 years experience with Google Cloud Platform including Big Query, Data Fusion, Data Prep, Data Studio (or equivalent AWS)

At Lyft, our mission is to improve people's lives with the world's best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.

Lyft is hiring for its growing Regulatory Compliance team. If you want to help Lyft change the transportation industry and enjoy finding creative solutions to complex problems, this team is for you!

As a Compliance Data Analyst, you will develop a deep understanding of the processes Lyft has in place necessary to meet its regulatory obligations around the country. You will be a key member of the Audit and Analytics team responsible for hunting out any gaps in our processes and helping the Compliance team find solutions to plug those gaps. You will work hand in hand with our Compliance and Data Analytics teams to perform audits, document processes, and be responsive to data requests from regulators. In this role, you will report into the Manager, Compliance Analytics.

Responsibilities:
Partner with cross functional teams including Compliance, Product Management, Science, Engineering, Finance and Operations to design a robust reporting and analytics system
Define metrics and produce accurate reports and data analysis in a timely manner to meet contractual and compliance requirements
Collaborate with the Compliance team and others to continuously improve our reporting processes to make us faster, leaner, and more accurate
Work with the data team to obtain data that meets the needs of Compliance and analyze the business impact of compliance obligations
Support Compliance team in internal and external auditing data requests
Assist the Compliance Auditor to identify trends in the data reporting, in order to preemptively improve our compliance systems and processes
Develop analytical frameworks through automation to proactively monitor data reporting solutions
The work responsibilities of this role are expected to take place based on the Pacific Time Zone.

Experience:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineer, Mathematics or similar required (masters degree is a plus)
3+ years of relevant experience:
Candidate should be a SQL expert; must be able to optimize queries and join datasets efficiently
Proficiency in advanced SQL using Presto/Hive - able to write structured, complex and efficient queries on large data sets
Experience with Python/R or other statistical programming language
Knowledge of ETL concepts and data warehousing procedures, knowledge of Airflow
Knowledge of Tableau or any other data analysis dashboard is preferred
Ability to analyze and quickly understand processes in order to appropriately determine whether objectives and goals have been met
Ability to multi-task effortlessly and manage competing priorities under demanding deadlines
Drive to provide accurate results as quickly as possible and continuously iterate
Passion for Lyft and the ridesharing community

Benefits:
Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
In addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have unlimited paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off
401(k) plan to help save for your future
18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Lyft Pink - Lyft team members get an exclusive opportunity to test new benefits of our Ridership Program

For candidates living in Colorado the expected base pay range is $99,000-$116,000 and depending on a variety of non-discriminatory factors, including qualifications, experience and geographic location.

This role is work-from-anywhere, excluding the following states and territory: Alabama, Arkansas, Delaware, Iowa, Kansas, Maine, Mississippi, Nebraska, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, West Virginia, Wyoming, Puerto Rico.

Lyft is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.

position: Data Analyst, Cloud FinOps - USA, Remote - 1370792
details:
Cisco's heterogeneous landscape is comprised of both internally incubated and acquired product teams. Depending on a variety of factors such as cloud maturity, complexity of solutions, etc.; Cisco product teams require different levels of support and assistance across the product lifecycle from discovery through launch, iteration and optimization. The CloudX Team enables product teams to consume these environments efficiently, by developing and deploying frameworks, strategies, architectures and platforms to run and deliver products in the cloud at scale, securely and in compliance with Cisco policy and customer standards.



What You'll Do



As a Data Analyst, Cloud FinOps you will play a strategic role and will guide individual businesses and Cisco at large to highly efficient and optimized cloud consumption.

Responsibilities Include
Operationalize FinOps frameworks, establish business processes in support of globally distributed teams, promote a culture of cost awareness and accountability
Build data pipelines and dashboards for cost visibility at the enterprise level while supporting individual business unit requirements
Organize data in public cloud cost management tools such as CloudHealth and administer using best practices
Develop, measure, report and maintain key performance indicators for tracking real time costs, consumption, and metrics for measuring unit economics, product level visibility
Partner with Business Unit Finance, Operations and Engineering teams to implement cost optimization initiatives involving usage efficiencies, pricing efficiencies, deep dives into services such as compute, network, and storage usage
Build and deliver effective data driven presentations for various business partners on public cloud cost usage and spend insights.
Continuously monitor public cloud provider discount commitments (like Reserved Instances, Savings Plans, committed use discounts) with the vital governance, processes, and tooling and ensure key coverage and utilization metrics are trending in the right direction
Work with Cloud Service Providers (AWS, GCP Azure) teams to implement best practices in automations, new vendor related cost optimization programs and other initiatives
Support Business Unit, Procurement, and other teams with subject matter expertise on forecasting and cloud costing models.


Who You'll Work With



You will collaborate across the Transformational Operations (TRON) teams, and with the CloudX Technical Team - comprised of Cloud Service Engineers (infrastructure specialists; well-versed on hosting strategy, cloud platform administration and deployment architecture) and Cloud Developers (who focus on data, platforms and tools in support of operations and product lifecycle). The goal is come together and deliver the best of breed FinOps experience at scale.

The TRON CloudX team is responsible for accelerating Cisco's transformation toward a Cloud enabled SaaS product portfolio. This team supports ever-evolving operating requirements which underpin infrastructure enablement, policy administration, solution architecture, marketplace management and FinOps best practices across cloud and hybrid environments.

You will engage with practically every function across Cisco and a wide range of external partners and suppliers, all globally distributed. You will cultivate and maintain relationships within Product Engineering, Transformation Operations, SaaS Ops, Finance, Business Operations, Sourcing and Acquisitions. You will work directly with Cloud Service Providers and a range of external partners; assessing and influencing the ecosystem and how Transformation Operations leverages the landscape to accelerate Cisco's leadership in Hybrid and Public Cloud.

Who You Are

You are collaborative but know when to stand your ground. You are always learning (keeping up with what is new) but you are very experienced in public cloud and hybrid environments. You can roll up your sleeves (and know when to jump in) but also think strategically. You are a good listener and know when to step in to share your knowledge and recommendations succinctly and effectively.

You have strong and practical knowledge in public cloud environments (AWS, Azure or GCP at scale) with a solid understanding of cost optimization using Cloud Financial Management or FinOps frameworks.
Strong Data handling skills to analyze complex datasets and practical experience using Tableau or similar BI tools to build reporting dashboards
Practical experience in using cloud service provider APIs to implement code-based automations for the public cloud
Experience with public cloud infrastructure (compute, network, storage), capacity planning and forecasting, cloud services and ability to partner across the organization to drive cost optimization discussions
Competent in programming/query languages (Python, SQL etc.), data engineering concepts and basic understanding of DevOps related automation tools

Required
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Business Administration, Mathematics, or all relevant Engineering disciplines.
3-7 years of Public Cloud experience (AWS or GCP preferred) and knowledge of Cloud Service provider (AWS Preferred) services, architectures, and tools
Hands on experience in Cloud Cost Management, knowledge of Public Cloud offerings, consumption models, billing, cost management tools and processes (AWS or GCP preferred)

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Job Title: Data Analyst
Reports to: Data Science Lead

Summary: Data Analyst with focus on data analytics, machine learning, data visualization, and Python development.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:

· Able to complete new data integration tasks between various systems including SQL Server, Salesforce, Netsuite, and MySQL

· Assists with the creation and/or application of machine learning algorithms to create new opportunities for existing Stretto clients and for future Stretto opportunities
· Leads data analysis and data visualization
· Maintain working knowledge of Stretto products and tools

Position Expectations:

· Quality and Predictability of Work:
o Maintains high standards despite pressing deadlines
o Does work right the first time
o Corrects own errors
o Regularly produces accurate, thorough professional work
o Work with Leaders to drive growth, quality and customer satisfaction
· Critical Thinking:
o Possess the ability to break down situation into smaller pieces to identify its key or underlying issues
o Possess the ability to figure out cause-and-effect relationships (if…then…)
o Problem analysis and problem resolution at both a technical and functional level

str
· Job Knowledge/Technical Knowledge:
o Deep functional knowledge of Stretto products and tools
o Demonstrates knowledge of techniques, skills, equipment, procedures and materials related to Data Analytics, Data Science, SQL, and Python development
o Apply knowledge to identify issues and internal problems; works to develop additional technical knowledge and skills
· Communication:
o Listens, speaks and writes clearly and concisely and effectively, using conventions appropriate to the situation
o States own opinions clearly and concisely
o Asks questions to ensure understanding
o Exercises a professional approach with others using all appropriate tools of communication, uses consideration and tack when offering opinions
· Flexibility, Initiative and Creativity:
o Remains open-minded and changes opinions on the basis of new information
o Performs wide variety of tasks and changes focus quickly as demands change
o Manages transitions from task to task effectively, adapts to varying customer needs
· Teamwork:
o Ensures joint ownership of goal setting, commitments and accomplishments
o Involves everyone on the team
o Treats all clients and employees with respect, values diverse perspectives
o Demonstrates the ability to work with others throughout the organization
· Continuous Improvement:
o Displays an ongoing commitment to learning and self-improvement
o Ability to adapt and be open to new ideas and improvements to products and processes
· Data, Confidentiality and security:
o Practices all security and data handling procedures, policies to protect company security as well as client confidentiality and privacy. Protects the privacy and confidentiality of all customer and staff information at all times
o Appropriately handle confidential information to safeguard such information and only use it or disclose it as expressly authorized or specifically required in the course of performing their specific job duties. Misuse of confidential information can be intentional (acts and/or omissions), or a product of negligence or inadvertence. Misuse of data should be avoided such as but not limited to:
§ Accessing information not directly germane or relevant to the employee's specifically assigned tasks
§ Disclosing, discussing and/or providing confidential information to any individual not authorized to view or access that data, including but not limited to third parties, volunteers, vendors and other Stretto employees
§ Reckless, careless, negligent, or improper handling, storage or disposal of confidential data, including electronically stored and/or transmitted data, printed documents and reports containing confidential information
§ Deleting or altering information without authorization, generating and/or disseminating false or misleading information, and using information viewed or retrieved from the systems for non-work use.

Qualities and Traits Required:
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Strong analytical skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines is essential for a fast-paced environment
Innovative problem-solving skills; the individual identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner, gathers and analyzes information skillfully
· Focused and self-motivated
· Effective verbal and written communication skills; possessing high level of professionalism
· Strong interpersonal (teambuilding) skills
· Ability to complete tasks with minimal direct supervision

Education/Experience Required:
· Bachelor’s degree, preferably in computer related field
Proven experience learning and supporting proprietary applications and data
2-3 years Data Analytics experience
Knowledge of Salesforce Administration
SQL Server experience, including SSIS and SSRS
Data Integration experience using tools such as CozyRoc, Celigo, or other
Knowledgeable and capable in the use of BI and Analytics tools such as Tableau, Quicksight, or other
1 year Data Science experience
1 year programming experience
Proficient with: MS Office, SQL, Excel, Python
Tableau experience is a plus
Proven technical aptitude

Note: This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employee(s) will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments.

position: Senior Data Analyst - Tech, (Store No. 8 | Commerce / Extended Reality)
details:
About Store No8

Position Summary... What you'll do...

We are the incubation arm of Walmart. Store No8 was formed in 2017 as part of Walmart’s larger innovation mission to shape the future of commerce. We pursue big ideas and take risks by stepping outside of Walmart’s core business to focus on leapfrog capabilities across conversational commerce, mixed reality, in-store digitization, and more. Our ultimate goal: fuel Walmart’s core business, create new operational efficiencies, and unlock amazing experiences for our customers in the long-term.

This stealth team within Store Nº8 is paving the way for extended reality applications in the retail space creating productive and entertaining immersive shopping experiences.

About The Role

This is the opportunity to get in early with a stealth project currently developing in Walmart's Store No8 incubator. At Store No8, the team will discover and deliver capabilities for the future of how we engage with technology and people, through the unparalleled scale of Walmart’s platform. In this role, you will contribute to the operations

Top Reasons To Work With Us
This is a rare opportunity – you will help shape the growth of a stealth project from the ground up, ultimately helping Walmart’s customer of tomorrow to live better every day.
Startup energy, Walmart backing – you will move at the speed of a startup with the backing and of an established company.
Long term vision – we are focused on transforming the way people engage and connect with technology and each other.
What You’ll Do

You Will Make An Impact By

As a Senior Data Analyst, you’ll leverage your sharp analytical skills and strategic thinking to help us develop and refine technical products and business models. You are comfortable organizing and presenting data around customer intelligence, user engagement and adoption metrics as well as analysing trends and patterns. This is an individual contributor position reporting to the Head of Product. You will get in on the ground floor with a small fast-paced team in an emerging technology industry.
Defining business models and strategies – You will work collaboratively with teams across Walmart to locate, pull and utilize data to define and refine business models and strategies
Defining business plans and projects – You will help identify best paths forward for technical projects, making recommendations for testing, rollout strategies, scaling and more
Improving technical products through data analysis – you pull and organize data to help the team understand, analyze and prove our hypotheses in the extended reality domain.
Establishing strong data best practices – You will act as a data leader by defining and promoting best practices for organizing, utilizing and communicating data
Who Will Love This Job
You have a test and learn mentality and an agile way of using data
You have strong data visualization skills and a working knowledge of multiple data visualization tools (for example, Python, R libraries, Ggplot, Matplotlib, Plotly, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
You’re able to pull metrics to improve performance and make strategic recommendations based on data
You’re excited about solving complex challenges and are customer-centric in spirit and in execution
You’re comfortable influencing others, managing stakeholders, and communicating clearly
You’ve worked in small teams/incubators
What You’ll Need
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 2 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field.
Or a Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field.
4 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, in the retail industry, gaming or related field.
Successful completion of assessments in data analysis and Business Intelligence tools and scripting languages (for example, SQL, Python, Spark, Scala, R, Power BI, or Tableau)
Perks and Benefits

Beyond competitive pay, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role.  It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. About Toptal

Toptal is a global network of top freelance talent in business, design, and technology that enables companies to scale their teams, on-demand. With $200+ million in annual revenue and over 40% year-over-year growth, Toptal is the world’s largest fully remote company.

We take the best elements of virtual teams and combine them with a support structure that encourages innovation, social interaction, and fun. We see no borders, move at a fast pace, and are never afraid to break the mold.

Position Description

Toptal is seeking an experienced, results-driven Data Analyst, SEO who will be responsible for analyzing data and obtaining insights for use in daily activities and projects which will be focused on increasing the organic visibility of the Toptal website. This person will be responsible for interpreting market, web, and business metrics to identify high-impact optimization opportunities and working cross-functionally with product, engineering, and content teams to implement them. This role will also have a heavy focus on conducting experimentation, technical SEO, and helping maintain and build our analytics capabilities.

This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere. Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship. Resumes and communication must be submitted in English.

Responsibilities
Monitor and report on KPIs, share with the SEO and adjacent teams, and quickly respond to divergences.
Help design SEO experiments and test new strategies and opportunities for growth.
Analyze SEO test results and execute next steps at a fast pace.
Analyze keyword, traffic, user, and business trends to gain insight and take action.
Lead, manage, and prioritize projects that involve cross-functional stakeholders.
Grow the business through technical SEO, data analysis, and various optimizations.
Participate in understanding each department’s SEO needs and evangelizing SEO.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct coding problems.
Help locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
The Successful Candidate For This Role Will Be
Passionate and curious in problem-solving: You’re genuinely curious about how and why people search, interested in SEO best practices and trends, and relish in the analytical and technical depths of the industry. You have a knack for identifying problems and finding solutions.
Extremely detail-oriented professional: You can also see the forest from the trees, balancing the intricacies of a discipline like SEO with larger company objectives.
Quantitative yet Pragmatic: You have a data-driven approach to making decisions.
Analytical, tactical & strategic: You have experience building a strategic and tactical plan based on analyzing large amounts of data, from multiple sources.
Responsible and Responsive: You’re able to work autonomously and take pride in your work, with a sense of urgency, and grit through difficulty to deliver high-quality results. Strong organizational skills to manage multiple concurrent projects.
Driven: You’re an ambitious go-getter who takes initiative without being asked and over-delivers on promises.
An excellent communicator: You have the ability to clearly communicate and evangelize data insights.
Results-driven: You’re focused on achieving results, setting ambitious goals, and able to prioritize appropriately by understanding the balance of value.
Innovative: You’re constantly focused on improving, growing, and coming up with new ways to grow and scale the business through actionable data-driven opportunities and trends.
Teamwork & positive attitude: You work collaboratively with a positive and can-do approach to opportunities and challenges to get the right things done quickly.
In The First Week, Expect To
Onboard and integrate into Toptal.
Familiarize yourself with current and past SEO strategies and tactics.
Dive into the roadmap and the biggest opportunities for improvement.
Connect with a series of direct and adjacent team members.
In The First Month, Expect To
Hit the ground running with analysis and deriving insights from available data for SEO/Business.
In The First Three Months, Expect To
Expand your abilities into specific projects and getting more acquainted with opportunities.
In The First Six Months, Expect To
Contribute to high-value projects and experimentations.
In The First Year, Expect To
Develop ideas for SEO through data analysis and dive deeper into data projects.
Requirements
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience (preferred in quantitative fields such as economics, mathematics, statistics, or computer science/engineering).
Demonstrable track record of success at driving significant results & business growth.
3+ years of web analytics experience with enterprise level websites (i.e. hundreds of thousands or millions of pages).
Advanced excel/google sheet skills and SQL is required.
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills; experience synthesizing data into information, and presenting concise analyses.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Experience with text analytics.
Experience with Google Analytics, Google Search Console, Tableau, Kibana strongly desired.
Experience and knowledge of statistics and statistical packages for analyzing datasets using R and/or Python.
Functional knowledge of JavaScript, CSS and HTML is strongly preferred.
Ability to analyze optimization needs of webpages is a plus.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks).
Knowledge of SEO tools and data sets, and an understanding of search engine workings are a plus.

theSkimm'

We're hiring a Data Analyst.

About Our Team And What We'll Build Together

Our team provides robust measurement and actionable insights on our growing membership base. We partner closely with product, engineering, and marketing teams to build innovative products, understand customer demand signals, and measure growth and engagement.

As our company grows, we're looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. Reporting to theSkimm's Data Analytics Sr. Manager, your core focus area will be social media analytics, where you will be developing centralized social analytics reporting and defining key performance metrics. There will also be opportunities for you to conduct more advanced analytics to inform strategies for other teams (Marketing, Product, and Editorial).

How You'll Contribute To Our Mission
Support our Director of Social Media and Data Analytics Sr. Manager as we focus on follower growth on our social media accounts
Establish key performance indicators and performance benchmarks by platform, campaign and content type across our social channels
Streamline reporting and workflows for the social team

Conduct experiments with content and measure success to drive social strategies

Identify, collect, and transform data from disparate sources using SQL, R, Python, or other statistical tools

Familiarity and enthusiasm for theSkimm: a passion for our audience and mission

High EQ

We are collectively building an impactful brand for millennial women by helping them maneuver through life's necessities. Every role has a purpose and allows us to equip and enable women to make their best decisions, feel more educated and have the right knowledge at the right time.

We are values driven at every point - how we work, the way we work and our culture come straight from our core values. Each of us supports this incredible brand and takes part in its continued growth, fulfilling the needs of our audience each and every day.
