position: Data Analyst - Data Science and Statistics
details:
Data Analyst – Data Science and Statistics

Overview Of Position

The Data Analyst will apply data science and analysis techniques to analyze and synthesize data, construct data analytics processes, and develop information necessary to guide Change Healthcare’s clients in their business decision making process. The incumbent will effectively apply their knowledge of healthcare, risk adjustment, data analysis, and statistics to these analyses. This position requires analytical skills and the ability to independently research business, technical, and solution design related questions toward the goal of improving the analytics portfolio. This position requires a specific focus toward aspects of data science and the ability to find statistically significant results. The ability to work independently and prioritize competing demands is critical.

What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job?
Complete simple and complex analytics on risk adjustment data, applying mathematical and data science techniques to find statistically significant results, automating where possible
Build simple and complex reports to meet internal and external needs, automating where possible
Design visualizations to support analytics and to “tell the story” Of the data, driving insight and actionable findings
Participate in internal meetings to explain the results and findings of the data analysis
Demonstrate excellent interdisciplinary relationship building, interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of stakeholders
Collaborate with business leaders to provide data insights, design strategies, or inform decisions in Risk Adjustment strategy
Work with internal stakeholders in refining and documenting analytical needs to develop clear specifications
What are the requirements needed for this position?
Bachelor’s degree
2+ years of experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence
Experience applying data science and statistical techniques to a variety of datasets and problems to provide meaningful insights
Experience using visualization suites such as Tableau, Superset, Spotfire, Power BI, Qlik
Experience using SQL and Python
What other skills/experience would be helpful to have?
Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, or Engineering
Ability to work with large amounts of data, including checks for integrity, summation
Experience in designing and implementing AWS cloud architecture
Demonstrate good judgment and analytical skills to conduct open ended analysis and present recommendations
Demonstrate excellent interdisciplinary relationship building, interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with all levels of stakeholders
Excellent written and verbal communication/interpersonal/organizational skills
Self-starter attitude with the ability to excel in dynamic work environment
Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects
Ability to overcome project barriers, and follows up with stakeholders on status

Position Summary:

The Data Analyst will be responsible for research and preparing analysis to support product development decisions as well as ongoing production and performance of current and future products within the newly formed Emerging Markets Group. The data will originate from multiple sources within the Baldwin Risk Partners organization as well as industry sources. The candidate will be tasked in conducting research, compiling data, identifying trends, and partnering with colleagues to match data from multiple resources to make recommendations. This may also include organizing special financial and business-related studies.

Principal Responsibilities:
Collecting, auditing, compiling and validating data from multiple sources, maintaining files.
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques or relational databases and produce as-needed and ongoing reports to support recommended product/programs.
Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns and improvement opportunities in complex data sets to assist in product design, risk modelling, and recommended pricing.
Communicate internally and with other BRP partners to collect and validate data as well as answer questions regarding reports and data.
Create ad-hoc data sets through graphs, tables and other visuals based upon business requests.

Education, Experience, Skills and Abilities Requirements:
Undergraduate/Associates degree in related field preferred, equivalent years’ experience considered.
At least two years of data related or analytical work experience.
MS Office skills including intermediate skills in Excel with the ability to create, manipulate and formulate spreadsheets, to include v-look-ups, pivot tables, formulas, charts and graphing.
Basic to intermediate experience with SQL queries, with MS SQL Server database experience preferred.
Ability to grasp database structures and understand the underlying relationships and dependencies.
Comfortable compiling data integration from multiple sources; performing quality control on data sets; identifying and scrutinizing anomalies and/or outliers in the data; ability to manipulate data and complete required analysis.

Click here for some insight into our culture!

Remote - US - Remote - US - United States of America

Responsibilities

Responsible for ensuring the business makes better decisions through collection and usage of data. Ensures business data and analysis requirements are met by properly applying data concepts, including data structures, collection and cleansing, and structured and unstructured data analysis and reporting. Ability to collect, analyze, manipulate, and report on CBRE data.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities

Performs ad-hoc, strategic analysis of structured and unstructured data across multiple data sources, reflecting global real estate markets and the operations of real estate assets.

Develops data structures and pipelines to organize, collect, cleanse, and standardize data in order to generate insights and addresses reporting needs.

Defines data requirements and gathers and validates information, using judgment and statistical tests.

Utilizes programming and analytical tools, including open source programs including Python, R and SAS, SQL, Oracle, or similar relational database tools to formulate models and/or extract insights. Well versed in knowledge of creating algorithms, identifying patterns and insights from structured and unstructured data sets utilizing graphs, trees and/or other data representation techniques as required.

Identifies and troubleshoots data integration and integrity issues in cooperation with the appropriate CBRE business units; Designs work flows and procedures.

Identifies opportunities to maximize data usage, applying modeling and optimization methods to develop new strategies and improve business performance.

Develops ad-hoc analytics and reporting based on analysis of existing data sources, utilizing a variety of tools (i.e. SSRS, Tableau).

Exhibits analytical rigor, judgment, and ability to present a comprehensive 'data story' to multiple levels of the organization.

Other Duties as Assigned

Supervisory Responsibilities

No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. May coordinate and assign tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION And EXPERIENCE

Bachelor's degree from top tier school in computer science, math, engineering or related field with a minimum of 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data modeling, reporting, relational database tools, data warehousing, database architecture, and SQL, SAS and/or SPSS including 2-3 years technical experience in software development, machine learning or statistical analysis, data engineering and data visualization related work.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

None

Communication Skills

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

REASONING ABILITY

Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

OTHER SKILLS And ABILITIES

Experience with Microsoft BI stack (e.g., SSRS) a bonus.

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook.

Strong analytical skills.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

We're Bloomberg Enterprise Data - fast paced, innovative and rapidly growing. We partner closely with our clients, taking time to understand their unique businesses and individual data and technology needs. Our endless selection of datasets, covering all asset types, with multiple delivery technologies and flexible scheduling mean our clients are able to get exactly the data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer. Without us, they simply can't operate. Firms that contribute to applying only highest-quality data can eliminate the data inconsistencies inherent to working with multiple vendors and lower their costs overall. A partnership with Bloomberg Enterprise Data allows just this, giving them strategic advantage.

What's the role?

The business is looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join the Enterprise Data Quality Assurance team. The successful candidate will be responsible for creating and maintaining testing frameworks that automate test plans used to ensure that Enterprise Data products are of high quality before launch.

The Quality Assurance team works with Product/Business teams and Engineering to accomplish the following:
Creating testing strategies - Identify the test scope and objective with focus for launch of new enterprise data product or dataset
Presenting test results - Able to articulate and discuss data quality issue and remediation with multiple stakeholders
Driving continuous improvements of testing tools and processes - Open-minded to new insights/technologies on how to perform testing in more reliable and efficient way
Researching solutions to address client needs - Able to research/learn independently and provide possible solutions
We'll Trust You To

Position Overview

Autodesk is looking for a Senior Data Analyst for the Cloud Platform Analytics and Insights team. The team's focus is managing data across the entire cloud platform, with thousands of developers, hundreds of APIs, dozens of services, and the AWS infrastructure that everything sits on top of. As a team member, you'll dive into massive datasets to help bring new insights to service usage, platform costs, and the entire developer ecosystem for Autodesk's platform, Forge. You will partner with other analyst teams in Autodesk to bring together data from across the company to generate novel analyses.

As an Analyst on the team, you'll not only get to work with a modern tool stack and huge datasets; you'll get to be part of a team that's growing, giving you new opportunities to learn and grow for the future.

Responsibilities
Perform prescriptive analytics on usage data to help senior leadership and product leaders understand specific customer usage patterns and trends

Perform analysis across service usage of AWS, identifying opportunities for multi-million-dollar costs optimizations
Work closely with product groups to understand, identify, define, track and report key metrics and performance indicators that measure overall product health for solutions built on the platform
Improve data literacy across the product organization and help establish standards for making data-informed decisions
Collaborate with data scientists to develop predictive models that will serve product teams, business leaders to surface product-related metrics to executives, data engineers to optimize data flow to stakeholders, and user experience and user researchers to build compelling solutions

Bachelor's degree with 5+ years as a data analyst/scientist, or master's degree
Excellent communicator both in-person and virtually, as well as a team player

Excellent data visualization and data-story-telling skills
Dashboarding experience using tools like PowerBI and Looker
Proficient programming for Analytics.Python preferred
Willingness to learn the ins and outs of our products to be an effective data partner
Comfortable owning projects from concept to delivery and working autonomously
Preferred Qualifications
Analytics experience in a cloud platform environment
Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing experience
Predictive modeling experience
Familiarity with PySpark programming concepts for processing large datasets
Familiarity with data warehouse ELT concepts (Astronomer Airflow, DBT, Snowflake)

The mission of the Data Science team is to enhance Cvent’s products with AI and machine learning driven features, and to enable the company to make data-informed decisions at all levels. Cvent has a vast amount of data, and significant domain expertise, which we are using to design intelligent features that deliver value to our customers. We are on AWS, use Tableau as a reporting & dashboarding tool, and have recently started using Snowflake as an enterprise data warehouse.

We are hiring a Data Analyst II to work on statistical analysis of data, creating dashboards, and building and maintaining documentation on data. You must be highly collaborative and used to taking initiatives: you will work with data scientists, software developers and product managers on a daily basis. You will be an integral part of a fast-growing team, strongly committed to impacting the company via industry-leading machine learning, data products and data analytics.

What You Will Do
Perform statistical analysis of data.
Design randomized controlled trials (A/B tests), and analyze results.
Build and maintain dashboards for the Data Science team, using Tableau, Amazon QuickSight, and possibly other tools.
Understand Cvent's data: for example, what data points are captured from a particular product line and how specific data tables were created.
Use this understanding of data to create and maintain data dictionaries relevant to the Data Science team.
Communicate relevant findings and results to the team.
Basic Qualifications
A Bachelor's degree in statistics or another quantitative field.
At least 2 years of experience working as a data analyst in industry.
Proficiency working with relational (SQL) databases.
Proven skills in data visualization and dashboard creation.
Deep experience with Tableau.
Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests.
Critical thinking and strong problem-solving ability.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Advanced Qualifications
Master's or higher degree in statistics or another quantitative field.
Proficiency in the Python language.
Experience with noSQL data stores.
Familiarity with AWS services, especially QuickSight as a dashboarding tool.
Familiarity with Snowflake.
Understanding of data modeling and data store management.
Conceptual understanding of machine learning.
Proven ability for proactive, independent work with minimal supervision.
If you are a good fit for the role, please apply! Your resume should be no more than two pages in length.

details:

The Data Analyst (Healthcare Analytics) will have the opportunity to make a significant impact through the discovery, development, and implementation of leading-edge analytics that answer important business questions. The analyst will collaborate with key corporate and health plan business partners for the purpose of identifying and delivering robust reporting and analytics capabilities to drive improved business performance.

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Knowledge of query development of basic to moderate complexity using SQL or other coding languages. Knowledge of basic statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Working knowledge of analytical tools, including R, Python, SAS, ArcGIS, QGIS, Microstrategy, Tableau, Hadoop, or related tools preferred. Working knowledge of relational databases preferred. Working knowledge of automation capabilities such as batch processes, stored procedures, scripting languages, Microstrategy, or other tools preferred.

Experience in provider contracting, claims pricing, financial reporting/analysis, data modeling, statistical modeling, or data science analysis preferred. Experience working closely with business partners, using analytic techniques & tools to explore financial performance trends; Familiarity with healthcare data such as member eligibility, medical and pharmacy claims data, and utilization preferred.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. This role will aid in developing and implementation of a measurement and analytics strategy for the Enterprise Data Office (EDO). EDO partners with and serves cross-divisional teams and drives the enterprise data and analytics strategy. This person analyzes data, assesses trends and develops actionable insights and recommendations in support of business objectives.

The measurement analyst will:

Collaborate with product owners to design and implement operational and value metrics that drive product development
Create and support a culture of experimentation and statistical analysis through the use of testing and data to drive product decisions
Help product owners use data and analytics to tell clear and compelling stories around the value of their products
Aggregate measures and analytics across EDO product teams for a comprehensive view of the department’s value generated and progress against objectives
Provide product and department level analytics to divisional metrics programs
Support product teams in developing measurable objectives and key results (OKRs)
Help product teams increase transparency of product development to stakeholders through consistently reported metrics.
Drive automation of metrics

What we’re looking for:

A team player who is collaborative and curious to see where the data can lead us
An analyst with experience in measurement of both technical products and business customers, someone who seeks to measure everything that moves!
A leader who can drive a culture of change in the area of experimentation and measurement
A storyteller who uses data and analytics as the foundation for insight
A consultant who can seize the opportunity to help teams undergoing transformation

Core Responsibilities

Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and leads projects through completion. Delegates tasks and provides tactical and strategic guidance to peers.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using advanced analytical methods. Validates analytical techniques employed by other analysts.
Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
Develops, owns and manages recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Mentors, coaches, trains, and develops junior data analysts. Proactively expands knowledge of business and analytics and shares with team members. Shares and documents best practices.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum of five years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.

Special Factor

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

About GlossGenius

GlossGenius is building an ecosystem enabling entrepreneurs to succeed. We empower small business owners to focus on being creators, not admins, by offering a range of business management tools including booking and scheduling, marketing, analytics, payment processing and much more.

Tens of thousands of small business owners have chosen to rely on GlossGenius every day to run their entire set of business operations. With its powerful, intuitive platform, GlossGenius is some part a fin-tech company, some part an SMB software company, while its vibrant, distinguished brand makes it some part a consumer company.

About The Team

The Business Analytics team both serves as the "brain" of the business and builders of the "data muscle" across the organization. We wear a number of different hats, playing the roles of chief architect of our dbt DAG, joint owner and steward of our Snowflake data warehouse, expert of business intelligence tools, sought-after thought partner for strategic questions, builder of processes and best practices for governed data use, and wrangler of people, priorities and projects to keep us focused on the right things.

The team assumes full ownership of our front-end data tech stack. We're currently using Stitch for ingestion, dbt for transformations, and Snowflake for storage.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building and managing the data models, tools, dashboards, and operational processes used to deliver trusted data and insights to company stakeholders both internal and external. You will be a go-to thought partner for analytics support and data tooling solutions within the business team, and you will scope and execute high impact data analyses used to inform key business decisions and influence strategic priorities for the company.

You will work cross-functionally with marketing, product, engineering and customer support teams to place data at the center of all of our activity. You'll be expected to lead strategic conversations with stakeholders about what we should measure in each domain, framed in context of the company's overarching strategic goals.

You will report to the Head of Business Analytics.

What You'll Do
Perform deep analysis on complex business questions
Serve as a strategic advisor and trusted thought partner to teams across the company
Use dbt to design and build data models that enable great analysis
Gather and prioritize data needs from various teams, and make sure we're asking the right questions & tracking the right metrics
Build and maintain core reporting and analytics data pipelines that provide critical support to team operations and decision-making
Drive adoption of business intelligence tools among company stakeholders of varying technical aptitudes through training and ongoing support

What We're Looking For
2+ years of work experience in an analytical role, preferably in Business Operations, Strategy, or Analytics at a top SaaS organization, management consulting firm, or financial services institution
Advanced SQL skills
Experience working with modern BI tools (Looker, Tableau, Mode, etc.)
Ability to distill broad questions into structured frameworks for analyzing and drawing insights from data
Experience managing multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience

Benefits & Perks

Competitive health & dental insurance options, with premiums partially covered by GG
Fertility and adoption benefits via Carrot and Kindbody
Generous, fully-paid parental leave policy
401k benefit - employees are eligible to contribute starting day 1 of employment
Professional Development - employees receive a yearly stipend for approved learning and educational-related expenses
Pre-tax commuter benefits
Dependent Care FSA
Home office stipend
Team Bonding opportunities - annual company retreat for entire team, plus virtual events throughout the year

About us, but we’ll be brief

We are thrilled to share that FORTUNE has named Experian one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For. In addition, for the last five years we’ve been name in the top 100 “World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Forbes Magazine.

Job Description

The Client Data Analyst’s primary responsibility is the execution, review, and development of reporting and related reporting procedures. This includes communicating findings, proposed next steps, and follow through on possible issue resolutions as it relates to client and credit performance. Successful fulfillment of this role requires extensive interaction with Implementation, Account Management, Credit Operations, Data Services, Operations, and Quality Control departments. Client Data Analysts can take the lead on workload distribution across Operations teams via collaborative and proactive communication. They identify areas in which team members can supplement one another’s workloads. They anticipate client need and deadlines and proactively communicate across departments regarding competing priorities and proposals to manage and redistribute assignments. They identify new areas in need of monitoring or improved reporting and work collaboratively to develop the necessary tools and processes. They often communicate with clients and partners to better understand their workflows and reporting needs. They synthesize how those needs relate to TCC’s current reporting capabilities, and relay and prioritize technical requests back to the internal organization, as needed.

Responsibilities
Serve as a consultative partner to internal and external clients.
Lead analyses that produce actionable insights.
Leverage large, complex data sets to identify, quantify and influence tangible performance gains.
Define, collect, develop and monitor key business metrics.
Create insightful automated dashboards and data visualizations to track key metrics and trends.
Develop and test analytic solutions to be used by internal and external customers.
Collaborate with business intelligence on data warehouse requirements etc.
Active involvement or playing a lead role in testing, training, and implementation of applications/solutions.
Skills

Qualifications
Intermediate to advanced skills in Excel, SQL and data analysis software such as R, Python, and SAS
Experience developing data visualizations and using BI software such as Tableau, Power BI, and Sisense
Strong academic record, ideally in Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or other quantitative field
Intense intellectual curiosity – strong desire to always be learning
Positive, people-oriented, and energetic attitude
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving difficult problems
Passionate about data and analytics
Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred not required)

Experience
3+ years in a quantitative business role
Experience with temporary and professional staffing agencies and/or in the tax incentive industry a plus

The mission of the Data Science team is to enhance Cvent’s products with AI and machine learning driven features, and to enable the company to make data-informed decisions at all levels. Cvent has a vast amount of data, and significant domain expertise, which we are using to design intelligent features that deliver value to our customers. We are on AWS, use Tableau as a reporting & dashboarding tool, and have recently started using Snowflake as an enterprise data warehouse.

We are hiring a Data Analyst II to work on statistical analysis of data, creating dashboards, and building and maintaining documentation on data. You must be highly collaborative and used to taking initiatives: you will work with data scientists, software developers and product managers on a daily basis. You will be an integral part of a fast-growing team, strongly committed to impacting the company via industry-leading machine learning, data products and data analytics.

What You Will Do
Perform statistical analysis of data.
Design randomized controlled trials (A/B tests), and analyze results.
Build and maintain dashboards for the Data Science team, using Tableau, Amazon QuickSight, and possibly other tools.
Understand Cvent's data: for example, what data points are captured from a particular product line and how specific data tables were created.
Use this understanding of data to create and maintain data dictionaries relevant to the Data Science team.
Communicate relevant findings and results to the team.
Basic Qualifications
A Bachelor's degree in statistics or another quantitative field.
At least 2 years of experience working as a data analyst in industry.
Proficiency working with relational (SQL) databases.
Proven skills in data visualization and dashboard creation.
Deep experience with Tableau.
Experience designing and analyzing A/B tests.
Critical thinking and strong problem-solving ability.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Advanced Qualifications
Master's or higher degree in statistics or another quantitative field.
Proficiency in the Python language.
Experience with noSQL data stores.
Familiarity with AWS services, especially QuickSight as a dashboarding tool.
Familiarity with Snowflake.
Understanding of data modeling and data store management.
Conceptual understanding of machine learning.
Proven ability for proactive, independent work with minimal supervision.
If you are a good fit for the role, please apply! Your resume should be no more than two pages in length.

Regal Voice

Regal Voice is the new way brands interact with their customers at the most important moments. We are a next-gen customer engagement platform that allows brands to build phone call and text message campaigns into their digital experiences to drive 25%+ more revenue. We work with leading brands including SoFi, Angi, Via, MakeSpace, and Farmer’s Dog. Headquartered in New York City, Regal Voice is backed by fantastic venture capital investors.

Regal Voice is led by industry veterans who previously built Handy (acq. by IAC / Angi in 2018), and the rest of our team is made up of product managers and engineers who bring expertise in real-time data, digital marketing and e-commerce.

As the creators of online on-boarding and buying experiences for millions of users, we know how hard it is to engage customers once they leave your site. With Regal Voice, brands are empowered to reach customers before they buy elsewhere - using voice and SMS campaigns that are event-driven, no-code and customer friendly.

Most importantly, our team shares a common set of values:
We are customer-obsessed
We know data beats opinion
We believe fast-paced execution wins’ markets
We espouse a growth mindset

Regal Voice Data

One of the most exciting parts of Regal Voice is the massive dataset we are building. Regal Voice ingests 10s of millions of real-time behavioral data points from customers daily and combines that with rich voice and sms conversation data to drive next best actions. We also track all agent actions in the product, and can use that data to derive insights about new product features or behaviors that can improve the efficiency of agents - so they can spend more time engaging with customers.

Responsibilities
Develop internal reports and dashboards that describe product usage and business performance
Develop customer insights dashboards to be used by the Customer Success team in quarterly business reviews with customers
Analyze performance of A/B experiments run by customers or the product team
Conduct deep dive analyses to inform key product and business decisions
Create and maintain documentation of business metrics and the data model
Inform how key metrics should be calculated and presented in the Regal Voice app

What We Are Looking For
1+ years experience as a data analyst or management consultant
Fluent in SQL
Comfort working with Looker (or some other dashboarding tool)
Comfort working with Snowflake (or Redshift, Athena, or BigQuery)
Passionate about data access and empowering others to make decisions with data
Enthusiastic about the high impact, fast-paced work environment of an early-stage startup
Excellent communication skills
Excellent data presentation skills - and ability to tell a story with data

Perks & Benefits:
Paid parental leave
Competitive compensation packages, including cash and early stage equity
Medical, dental, vision insurance
Flexible PTO
Weekly happy hours
Monthly team events
Quarterly trips
Complete laptop workstation
Ground floor opportunity to work directly with the co-founders to shape the product

Company invested in a large office in NYC (Flatiron) and a smaller satellite office in San Francisco (Financial District) to offer a hybrid model of T/W/TH in office. Covid protocols in place.

Working experience in Data Analytics

We are looking for a dynamic candidate with excellent communication skills and good understanding of data analysis.
Candidate should have knowledge of ETL concepts and Data warehousing
Candidate should be able to understand the requirement quickly and translate them into requirement and ETL mapping docs.
SQL knowledge is must and basic understanding of Unix knowledge is required.

position: Senior Data Analyst - Data Science Practice
details:
Job Summary:

The data analyst will join a highly collaborative data science team in designing and implementation machine learning. The data science intern will utilize SQL and Python to develop machine learning models against our service management data that target service reliability and availability and reduce patient impact. The data analyst is expected to actively participate with the agile team in the implementation of the AIOps roadmap in collaboration with Severe Incident Management, CMDB, and Anomaly Detection teams.

Responsibilities:





Act as liaison between Data Science Practice team and EOCC service owners. This role will include modelling data, tableau development, identifying and developing machine learning models.



Provides advanced professional input to complex Infrastructure assignments/projects.
Assists in the development of logical data base designs, data models and relational data base definitions across multiple computing environments (e.g., host based, distributed systems, client server).
Assists in the identification and analysis of information flows and interfaces between corporate business processes and in transforming the information into logical data bases and relational data base definitions.
Participates in the analysis and resolution of issues related to information flow and content with clients and IT management and staff.
Assists in data modeling studies and the development of detailed data models through consultation with clients and staff.
Utilizing independent judgment and discretion, monitors data architecture standards and conventions and provides data model and entity relationship diagrams as required.
Participates in the development of a corporate data architecture. Supports and provides direction to more junior professionals.
Works autonomously, only requiring “expert” level technical support from others. Exercises judgment in the evaluation, selection, and adaptation of both standard and complex techniques and procedures.
Utilizes in-depth professional knowledge and acumen to develop models and procedures, and monitor trends, within Data Modeling.


Qualifications:

Bachelors degree in Business Analytics or similar; Work experience equivalent
1+ year experience in SQL
Familiarity and experience in Python or similar tools
Prior experience in Data Modeling


For this position, we anticipate offering an annual salary of $68,200 - $113,600, depending on relevant factors, including experience and geographic location.

This role is also anticipated to be eligible to participate in an annual bonus plan.

Job # 597728

When you join Verizon

Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

What You’ll Be Doing...

At Verizon, we run a world-class Engineering organization and as a part of the Engineering Program Office that manages large capital programs using state of the art analytics seek to improve the capital planning and management processes, enhancing systems, realigning the organization, and adding opportunities for personal skill-building and professional growth. The Network Strategy, Planning, and Engineering Analytics team supports multiple Verizon Lines of Business on strategy planning, geospatial data analytics, engineering support, and visual analytics.

As a Data Analyst on the team, you’ll work as part of an interdisciplinary team including Computer Scientists and Network Engineers and interact with internal Lines of Business and external business partners. You’re a data enthusiast eager to ingest, explore, and make connections between multiple large datasets from different sources. You’re analytical and a quick thinker capable of extracting valuable insights from data. You’re familiar with techniques for data munging and wrangling using multiple software packages. You work with a sense of urgency and have strong interpersonal and communication skills. You let your data come alive through creative storytelling and data visualization. You're able to present your insights with confidence, and have the leadership qualities to enable other teams to learn how to analyze the data. You’ll also connect various data locations to stage data before visualizations. The business insights and recommendations you provide will help to improve performance.
Identifying business problems and developing analytic techniques to provide solutions to external teams.
Driving multiple technical and data-related projects of varying scopes and complexities.
Working with other business units within Verizon, vendors, and executives to represent and drive our organization's strategy.
Using data visualization and other data-gathering methods to either provide internal strategic direction or guide decisions for other teams.
In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.

What We’re Looking For...

You are good with numbers and you love to dig into data to find the story. Crafting reports and dashboards is a fun afternoon for you. You’re able to translate numbers into compelling stories - and tailor your presentation and recommendations to the audience function and level to meet their needs. You are detail-oriented and know how to focus on what really matters. You have a knack for understanding and visualizing just the right way to share data and practical insights so that people can understand. You enjoy aligning various work streams to ensure the same vision and goal is achieved. We’re looking for someone who can partner with a product group to provide business intelligence from understanding what’s going on with the business, identifying the right data, conducting research and doing analyses, to coming up with insights and making recommendations. The business insights you provide will help your product team run better and make better decisions. Collaborating with your product group to understand business needs and staying up to date on all the product initiatives and plans.

You’ll Need To Have
Associate’s degree or two or more years of work experience.
Three or more years of relevant work experience.
Willingness to travel.
Even better if you have one or more of the following:
A degree in Business, Marketing, Information Systems, Analytics/Business Intelligence, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or in a related field.
Demonstrated experience with SQL (PostgreSQL, Oracle, Teradata).
Experience working with statistical packages like R, Python, SPSS, JMP, or SAS.
Experience creating powerful data visualizations using various tools (Tableau, matplotlib, D3.js).
Lead projects independently from start to finish in a team environment.
Experience crafting and delivering executive level presentations to non-technical audience including data summaries and visualizations.
Ability to adapt to quickly changing business environments which has changing priorities on a daily basis.
Experience working with large datasets using tools like SQL, Hadoop, MapReduce, Pig/Hive, Spark, H2O.
Experience working with NoSQL databases and big data repositories (Hadoop) and cloud-based repositories (AWS, Google Cloud).
Experience working with business intelligence systems to provide diagnostic self-serve information to clients and business units.
Program management experience.
Experience with SQL/NoSQL or equivalent programs.
Experience with Word, Excel, and PowerPoint presentation creation.
Experience with 5G, C-Band, Wireless technologies.
Business intelligence/visualization software experience (e.g., Tableau, Qlik, Splunk).
Data mining, preparation and modeling experience.
Statistical analysis language experience.
Data preparation tool experience.
Communication and presentation skills.
Equal Employment Opportunity

In alignment with Vanguard’s dedication to making advice more accessible and affordable for investors, Vanguard Institutional is dedicated to supporting all aspects of our growing advice businesses for our Institutional clients and participants. This role will deliver analytics to supplement Vanguard’s hardworking roster of advice-focused products and advisors and offer leadership and development opportunities. As a member of a growing team supporting a strategic initiative, you will have a unique opportunity to advance analytics capabilities as Vanguard’s Advice business grows.

This position is designated as hybrid (In-office + remote) and will be based in one of Vanguard’s business centers (Malvern PA, Charlotte NC, Scottsdale AZ) when the time comes for our offices to re-open in 2022.

Create the strategies and experiences that are changing an industry.

In Vanguard's Institutional (IIG) division, we serve millions of employees (known as participants) by partnering with their employers to create smart, effective retirement plans and ensure our low-cost, high-performing funds are available within retirement plans. As an analyst, you’ll help us build and evolve our advice experiences, capabilities, and product line-up to serve the needs of individual investors and plan sponsors. You’ll help us tap into unmet investor needs and disrupt the traditionally high-cost advice marketplace using quantitative insights to uncover areas of opportunity and drive strategies that enhance the client experience. You will play a critical role in implementing the use of advanced analytics into business processes to drive strategic decision making and deepen understanding of our participants.

Summary.

We are looking for passionate crew who want to leverage the power of analytics to drive strategic enhancements to the client experience. As an analyst, you will use quantitative methods to inform strategy, uncover areas of opportunity, and enhance the client experience. You will support business reporting, perform descriptive and predictive analyses, design and measure experiments with statistical rigor, and visualize data to deliver actionable insights.

Core Responsibilities

Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions, and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and supports projects through completion.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using analytical methods.
Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
May own and manage recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum of three years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.

Additional Skills:

Undergraduate degree in an analytic/quantitative field such as: Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related analytical field of study or equivalent combination of training and experience. A graduate level degree in an analytics focused field is strongly preferred
Intermediate level skills in SQL in an applied business context. Proficiency with relational databases or Big Data platforms, Data Analysis packages (Python, R, SAS etc.) and Data Visualization packages (Tableau, etc.)
The ability to understand data, process it, extract value from it, visualize it and communicate insights to audiences of various backgrounds, including senior management

Special Factor

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

position: Data Analyst III (Healthcare Analytics)- Remote Available
details:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility

Position Purpose
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims, provider, member, and encounters data. Identify and assess the business impact of trends
Develop, maintain, and troubleshoot complex scripts and reports developed using SQL, Microsoft Excel, or other analytics tools
Contribute to the planning and execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
Assist in the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation
Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers
Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines and thrive in a demanding, quickly changing environment
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products
Partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required
Provide technical guidance to junior analysts
Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility

Competitive pay

Paid Time Off including paid holidays

Health insurance coverage for you and dependents

401(k) and stock purchase plans

Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development

The Data Analyst (Healthcare Analytics) will have the opportunity to make a significant impact through the discovery, development, and implementation of leading-edge analytics that answer important business questions. The analyst will collaborate with key corporate and health plan business partners for the purpose of identifying and delivering robust reporting and analytics capabilities to drive improved business performance.

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. Master's degree preferred. 4+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management or 2+ years of IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Ability to integrate, validate, and reconcile data from multiple sources as well as design and construct analysis tools that extract, prepare, analyze, and store/present results to support business needs. Knowledge of query development using SQL or other coding languages. Knowledge of basic statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Working knowledge of analytical tools, including R, Python, SAS, ArcGIS, QGIS, Microstrategy, Tableau, Hadoop, or related tools preferred. Working knowledge of relational databases preferred. Working knowledge of automation capabilities such as batch processes, stored procedures, scripting languages, Microstrategy, or other tools preferred. Data Structure and Architecture Experience preferred.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Description

The Merchandising Execution Team (MET) within our client is a national team of 3000 field associates that go into the our client's stores on a regular basis and reset the bays (end of the aisles) to drive more foot traffic and revenue. They re-arrange the products and merchandise in a way that will meet customer demands and drive higher sales. In order to do this effectively, the MET team needs data to make decisions on which products should be placed in what area. The Data Insights MET team owns the data that is important to the MET field associates. This data consists of things like sales data, hours, associate information, which bays the MET field associates were last working and much more.

The Data To Day Work Of This Analyst Will Consist Of

As the MET team grows and promotes people, they need a contractor to help with some of the heavy lifting Data Insights work and potentially train someone to grow into a full time data scientists.
Providing weekly and ad hoc reporting to MET field associates and some internal leaders
Solving ad hoc business insights problems....for example over the past 10 years this team has accumulated ownership over things that are irrelevant and they shouldn't own, like application authorization to MET applications is not something that they should be owning so this data analyst will look at this "problem" and understand the business case, the impact, who the stake holders are, what the solution is, maintain this solution and coach people around it.
Looking at problems and being able to identify the data and then scale it...finding data, pulling it together and then creating something that would make sense to a business user
Skills

sql queries, gcp, big data analytics, data analysis, cloud, erpss, daiss

Top Skills Details

sql queries, gcp, big data analytics, data analysis, cloud, erpss, daiss

Additional Skills & Qualifications

This position sits on the business side and not IT so people must understand how the data connects to the business, not just be an expert on the execution of systematic technology.

Experience Level

Expert Level

As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. The Position
Senior Data Analyst

The Offer

Posted By: Caitlin Carrion

Loom is the video communication platform for async work that helps companies communicate better at scale. Loom makes it easy to record quick videos of your screen and camera and instantly share them with a link. More than 14M users across more than 200k companies around the world trust Loom to share feedback, updates, intros, training, and more – every day. Founded in late 2015, Loom has raised $203M from world-class investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Sequoia, Kleiner Perkins, Iconic, and Coatue.

The Role

We’re looking to add a Lead Analyst to our growing Data team to help us measure the impact of our Ecosystem initiatives and identify opportunities to expand the network of people who use async video at work. In this role you will help the Ecosystem team launch strategic initiatives with top productivity platforms like Atlassian, Slack, Microsoft Teams, and Google. You will also help understand impact and opportunity of a scalable self-serve loomSDK business targeting the developer community.

We have rich, complex datasets and our team performs a wide variety of analytical tasks, ranging from conducting ad-hoc research, creating dashboards, building funnels, designing and evaluating tests, crafting complex database queries and ETL pipelines, and developing sophisticated predictive models. The ideal candidate will be data-driven, intellectually curious, and a clear communicator.
We are currently hiring remotely in the United States and Canada
Responsibilities
Be the primary partner for the Ecosystem (Integrations and Platform) team and collaborate with Product, Engineering and Design to understand opportunities and measure impact of initiatives
Partner with the Ecosystem team and help build a culture driven by data informed decisions
Leverage data to help the team drive the overall Ecosystem roadmap and strategy
Lead the analytics team for Ecosystem and manage a small team of product analysts
Lead and mentor team members with processes and analytical and technical expertise for executing experiments, building pipelines and answering open ended business questions
Inform future experimentation design and roadmaps by performing exploratory analysis to understand user acquisition and activation behavior
Proactively derive data insights and turn them into growth recommendations, communicate results and learnings to the rest of the team
Lead A/B experiments from the Data side by supporting experiment design, tracking, implementation and owning the final analysis and readout
Design and develop core business metrics, creating insightful automated dashboards (and the necessary data pipelines) and data visualization to track progress
Collaborate with Product and Engineering to build analytics plans for new products and features, helping the Ecosystem team understand which metrics need to be measured and which events need to be tracked
Provide data insights through A/B testing, dashboards, user behavior analyses and ad-hoc requests
QA new event tracking to ensure accuracy of our data
What We're Looking For
7+ years of experience in an analytics role turning data into insights and recommendations
Strong analytical and communication skills with the ability to synthesize insights into compelling stories
Experience working with SaaS products and associated data
Experience with designing and analyzing experiments
Superior SQL (Snowflake, Postgres) skills - able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets
Experience with a Business Intelligence tool (e.g. Tableau or Mode)
Experience with a statistical scripting language (e.g. R or Python) is a plus
Experience with ETL tools such as Airflow or DBT is a plus
Experience in data modeling and ETL development is a plus
Experience collaborating with multiple business functions and stakeholders to develop metrics and key insights
A Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative field or higher
How We Work

Freedom and Flexibility: At Loom, we believe work is an act, not a place. When we disengage work from a location, we can accommodate a broad range of life choices. You can choose to work from home or while you travel. If you are in the Bay Area, you can drop by our San Francisco office on 2nd and Market St. We are able to hire across the United States and Canada and are continuing to expand our international presence. And you are free to move within a country without any adjustment to compensation.

Engaging Workday: The key to an engaging workday is finding the right balance between different ways to work sync, async, text and video. Loom makes it easier for us to say what we mean without having to schedule a zoom meeting or struggle to find the right words. And using async communication allows us to free up time for deep work every day. We believe there's a place for sync time - often a conversation on Zoom is exactly what is needed. For team meetings, this ‘sync time’ is typically between 9AM-Noon PT given where the overlap of timezones where Loommates are located.

Work-Rest Balance: The way we balance the fast-paced demands of a high-growth startup and sustainability is making rest a priority. We offer a flexible PTO policy so you're able to take time off when you need it. We also go fully offline once a year between Christmas and New Year (and twice during the Pandemic). Rest is also part of the workday, not just during PTO. Taking a break for personal commitments, whether it's watching the kids or getting some exercise is a natural part of the workday.

Social Connection: Relationships and connectedness matter. We are intentional about building trust and relationships through unique, shared experiences. Our virtual workspace keeps us connected day-to-day whether it's through Looms celebrating wins or our buzzing Slack communities. Loommates are able to meet in person with their teams at least twice a year purely for fun. We have also built local offices for those who want to work or meet in person, starting with San Francisco and New York City.

Perks at Loom
Competitive compensation and equity package
99% company paid medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and dependents (for US employees)
Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account (DCFSA)
Healthcare reimbursement (for International employees)
Life, AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability Insurance
401(k) with 4% company matching
Professional development reimbursement
Wellness stipends
Unlimited PTO
Paid parental leave
Remote work opportunities
Home office & technology reimbursement
Loom = Equal Opportunity Employer

We are actively seeking to create a diverse work environment because teams are stronger with different perspectives and experiences.

We value a diverse workplace and encourage women, people of color, LGBTQIA individuals, people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, foreign-born residents, older members of society, and others from minority groups and diverse backgrounds to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, religion, color, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. All employees and contractors of Loom are responsible for maintaining a work culture free from discrimination and harassment by treating others with kindness and respect.

company: Doctors Without Borders/Médecins Sans Frontières - USA
details:
Posted by
Rosanna Perri
Human Resources Assistant at Doctors Without Borders/Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) USA
Send InMail
Organization

Doctors Without Borders/Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) is an international humanitarian organization that delivers impartial medical care to people affected by conflict, epidemics, disasters, or exclusion from health care in over 70 countries.
We welcome candidates who bring a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences to join us in working toward MSF’s common mission.
Department
The People Analytics Unit (PAU) supports the increased uptake of data utilization for Human Resources (HR), enabling more strategic and data driven decision-making. The PAU serves as an internal resource for HR teams and leadership by leveraging data science and applied statistics to inform decision-making and strategy development around recruiting, retaining, placing, developing and administering policy and programs for MSF’s global workforce.
Key Competencies
The Data Analyst will work closely with PAU Data Scientists and MSF Subject Matter Experts to enrich and scale the PAU’s work, liaising with wide variety of stakeholders from across the organization. The ideal candidate has strong technical skills and is highly experienced in organizing and distilling data, asking appropriate questions to understand analysis requests, and can support PAU Data Scientists to visualize and present complex data in a compelling manner. They are inquisitive, creative, have strong critical thinking and analytical skills, can manage multiple workstreams and genuinely enjoy communicating data and insights.
Tasks
Job Functions and Responsibilities
Collaborate closely with stakeholders to assess business requirements, scope analytics requests, and propose and deliver timely solutions that are appropriate and relevant to the context/needs
Collaborate closely with PAU Data Scientists to generate insights and extract maximum value and meaning out of data
Communicate effectively to synthesize and present findings
Accompany stakeholders to meet ongoing needs and to facilitate the usage and linkage of the analytical work to decision-making and/or policy and strategy formulation
Continuously learn and share knowledge about new ways to distill meaning out of the data available, finding creative ways to work around limitations
Collaborate closely with the People Analytics team and support technical activities, specifically data cleaning and quality assurance
Support best practices and maintain compliance with data privacy rules and regulations as advised by MSF data privacy officers
Travel
The role will not include travel, however collaboration with teams across the MSF movement globally during irregular hours may be required.
Qualifications
Required Basic Qualifications
Minimum 5 years of proven professional experience as a Data Analyst
Master’s Degree in a relevant subject (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics, etc.)
Must be proficient in R
Must be proficient in applied statistics
Must be proficient in using BI tools (i.e. Shiny, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.) and developing visualizations to communicate and synthesize insights
Proven track record of beginning and completing projects with minimal supervision
Knowledge of how to have productive interactions with stakeholders about their research/analysis needs and requirements, with a proven ability to ask the proper questions to scope and fulfill requests
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple workstreams and competing deadlines
Ability to exercise sound judgement and use discretion to handle sensitive data and business matters
The maturity and experience to navigate the challenges of working in a resource-limited setting and to communicate with stakeholders at all levels
The ability to adapt to a rapidly growing and scaling work environment
A strong work ethic, commitment to professionalism, intellectual curiosity, and positive attitude, especially when confronting limitations (in the data or otherwise)
Enthusiasm for storytelling with data and its use in driving organizational change
A willingness to perform other tasks as assigned
Preferred Qualifications
Project Management, Business Analyst or related certification
Analytics experience in the HR, non-profit, humanitarian or global health field
Familiarity with data privacy rules and best practices
An interest or background in People Analytics, Strategic Workforce Planning etc.
Experience with People Data such as compensation, attrition/retention, and leadership pipeline development
Experience working on a global team
Experience working in consulting, innovation or with startups

Do you ever wonder what happens inside the cloud?

Headquartered in New York but based around the world, DigitalOcean is a dynamic, high-growth technology company that serves a robust and passionate community of developers around the world. Our mission is to simplify cloud computing for every developer. We are working on solving some of the most challenging and interesting technology projects around, on a scale unmatched by most.

We want people who are passionate, high performing team players who can take on new challenges and go the extra mile.

Our Finance team interfaces with the rest of DigitalOcean to ensure our ability to execute on our product vision and support our growing customer base in a data-driven and efficient manner. As a Data Analyst, you will join a growing Finance team that partners with decision-makers across the organization to catalyze business growth by providing robust and relevant analysis, insights and data products.

What You'll Be Doing
Dive into a variety of datasets to answer critical business questions and uncover valuable insights, becoming a subject matter expert on the data generated by, and used by our Finance team
Support the ongoing automation and delivery of standardized data views, dashboards, and a self-service data exploration environment to our Finance team
Handle a range of information and analysis requests that will inform decisions by our Finance teams, from simple SQL queries to more advanced, long-term modeling and strategic analysis
Partner directly with leaders across our Finance team, providing clear data-driven insights that provide the necessary information to move forward with a decision or the recommendations to jump-start a brand new initiative
Partner with managers to understand current barriers to information access, and help uncover opportunities for increased or more efficient use of data
Evangelize and facilitate the use of data in decision-making across the Finance team, including standardized KPIs and consistent measurement methodologies
What You’ll Add To DigitalOcean
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics, or other quantitative field
Experience in a quantitative analytics role, preferably in a high-growth environment, working across multiple stakeholders, teams or businesses
Demonstrable critical thinking and analytical skills, including the ability and confidence to make conclusions and recommendations from data
Proactive communication skills and track record of setting and executing on clear, realistic deliverable timelines
Hands-on ability to generate analytical reports for a variety of business functions, from start to finish (data cleaning to analysis to presentation)
Experience building easily digestible data visualizations, dashboards and reports
Advanced experience querying data (SQL), and ad hoc analysis (Excel)
Experience with data modeling in Looker or other BI tool (e.g. Tableau)
Bonus: Prior experience with Python and/or statistical modeling tools such as R or Matlab
Why You’ll Like Working For DigitalOcean
We value development. You will work with some of the smartest and most interesting people in the industry. We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. We maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development through formalized mentorship, LinkedIn Learning tracks, and other internal programs. We also provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.
We care about your physical, financial and mental well-being. We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym stipend to support your physical health, and a commute or internet allowance to make your trips to your office or your desk easier. We offer generous parental leave with transition time built-in upon return to work. We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match.
We support our remote employee experience. While we have great office spaces in NYC and Cambridge, we’re very distributed—we use a number of communication tools to connect across the company—and all remote employees have the opportunity to visit our offices and meet their teams face-to-face at team offsites. We also have an annual company offsite, Shark Week, to get quality in-person time with the entire company at least once a year. We also allow employees to outfit their workstations to meet their needs—whether remote or in office.
We value diversity and inclusivity. We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
