Job Description

Join BAE Systems' Intelligence and Security Sector and be part of an agile team that enables our employees to support our customers and their missions. As a Data Analyst, you will apply statistics, machine learning, and analytic approaches to produce products supporting the mission. You will also use machine learning techniques to find hidden patterns, trends, classifiers, and anomalies. This position will provide the analyst with an opportunity to work alongside other data scientists and engineers to develop tools and process for analysis – and author SOPs. Products and processes may be brief to customer senior leadership, making a true impact for the warfighter.

May require TDY over life of the contract.

Other possible locations include Virginia, Georgia, North Carolina, Texas, Hawaii, Maryland, Germany, Italy, and South Korea. Please go to https://jobs.baesystems.com to apply for these locations.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills

BS in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math, or related discipline and minimum 1 year of relevant experience or AA with 3 years of relevant experience.
Proficiency with R or Python, and SQL, AWS applications.
Experience implementing supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques, statistical techniques and concepts, data retrieval and storage, visualization and warehousing, and extract-transform-load (ETL) processes.
Background in visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders and Knowledge of data visualization tools.
Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills

Five years intelligence analysis experience (MOS 35/350 series or other DoD/IC equivalent)

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security

BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it's what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you'll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference.

Intelligence & Security (I&S), based in McLean, Virginia, designs and delivers advanced defense, intelligence, and security solutions that support the important missions of our customers. Our pride and dedication shows in everything we do—from intelligence analysis, cyber operations and IT expertise to systems development, systems integration, and operations and maintenance services. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

At BAE Systems, we celebrate the array of skills, experiences, and perspectives our employees bring to the table. For us, differences are a source of strength. We're laser-focused on high performance, and we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where all employees can innovate and thrive. Here, you will not only build your career, but you will also enjoy work-life balance, uncover new experiences, and collaborate with passionate colleagues.

The Role: Customer Data Analyst (Remote)

In 2021, Faethm joined Pearson, creating the world’s first truly end-to-end capability of intuitive company and employee enrichment and accelerating our cumulative mission to prepare every worker, everywhere, for the future of work and subsequent success. Our market-leading data, insights and AI capabilities will power the next generation of Pearson’s lifelong learning products to meet the rapidly changing needs of today’s workforce and bridge the global skills gap.

Faethm is scaling! We're looking for a US East Coast based Customer Data Analyst to join us on this exciting journey!  We have recently joined forces with Pearson, world’s largest learning company. Operating as a scale-up within a larger company, Faethm will continue to evolve as we leverage the resources and offerings of our new parent company.

Faethm's objective is to keep every worker, everywhere, employable . Our AI-powered SaaS platform helps clients navigate the Future of Work and impact of technology on any economy, industry, organization, or job and suggests viable transition pathways for impacted employees into 'future proof' career pathways.

Faethm is building out its Customer Insights team to manage and support a growing pipeline of client activities across the Americas. Core to your work at Faethm is an interest in process optimization, system standardization and creative analytics. We work with large workforce datasets, which are ingested into our AI engine to develop insights on the impact of external trends on a workforce or economy. This means that our Data Analysts are critical stakeholders in successful onboarding, kick-off, and value creation for our clients through analytical insights.

As such, Faethm is seeking candidates with two core skill sets:
Scrappy 'get stuff done' individuals with a desire to improve systems, create standardized processes, and automate our own capabilities
People with a passion for unique visualization and data interpretation and a willingness to experiment / create new content to generate value for our clients
We are looking for a delivery-focused and self-starting  Data Analyst  to join our team and grow with us. Initial responsibilities are detailed below, but we expect this role will evolve over time. and as such, flexibility, collaboration, a passion for your work, an unquenchable thirst for knowledge, and a sense of humor will be essential.

What You’ll Be Doing

You will be responsible for the collection and analysis of client data, improvements to process flows, and analysis of key workforce data insights.
Work closely with key internal stakeholders (Customer Insights – client delivery, Product team and Sales), to understand their priorities and shifting needs.
Utilize a client-driven mindset to ensure Faethm client accounts are set-up in a logical, intuitive manner with clean workforce data to enable impactful insights.
Engage in continuous process improvements to the client onboarding process, with a focus on working with the Customer Insights team and clients to enable a seamless onboarding experience to the Faethm platform.
Periodically communicate with clients to discuss workforce data requirements, resolve errors, gaps, and limitations in submission files.
Collect and assimilate various workforce and emerging-technology data.
Apply your analytical skillset to understand, interpret, manipulate, and visualize data (e.g., via Tableau, Excel, etc.)
Required Skills & Experience
Experience in processing, cleaning, organizing and manipulating data
Programming in scripting languages such as Python
Development, enhancement and standardization of process automation and process flows, including running and understanding scripts
Strong MS Excel proficiency including pivot tables, filtering, formulas, etc.
Familiarity with Tableau or other BI data viz tools
Ability to effectively communicate complex topics via Tableau, Excel or PowerPoint
Knowledge of AWS
Prior consulting or direct client experience with tact and professionalism in communication
Join our team in the US with a rapid scale mandate and help us build our capability as we support clients across industry verticals.

We’re looking forward to discussing the role with you. Please note, due to volume of applicants and time constraints, only successful applicants will be contacted.

The Data Analyst (Healthcare Analytics) will have the opportunity to make a significant impact through the discovery, development, and implementation of leading-edge analytics that answer important business questions. The analyst will collaborate with key corporate and health plan business partners for the purpose of identifying and delivering robust reporting and analytics capabilities to drive improved business performance.

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. Company Description

About us, but we’ll be brief

We are thrilled to share that FORTUNE has named Experian one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For. In addition, for the last five years we’ve been name in the top 100 “World’s Most Innovative Companies” by Forbes Magazine.

Job Description

The Client Data Analyst’s primary responsibility is the execution, review, and development of reporting and related reporting procedures. This includes communicating findings, proposed next steps, and follow through on possible issue resolutions as it relates to client and credit performance. Successful fulfillment of this role requires extensive interaction with Implementation, Account Management, Credit Operations, Data Services, Operations, and Quality Control departments. Client Data Analysts can take the lead on workload distribution across Operations teams via collaborative and proactive communication. They identify areas in which team members can supplement one another’s workloads. They anticipate client need and deadlines and proactively communicate across departments regarding competing priorities and proposals to manage and redistribute assignments. They identify new areas in need of monitoring or improved reporting and work collaboratively to develop the necessary tools and processes. They often communicate with clients and partners to better understand their workflows and reporting needs. They synthesize how those needs relate to TCC’s current reporting capabilities, and relay and prioritize technical requests back to the internal organization, as needed.

Responsibilities
Serve as a consultative partner to internal and external clients.
Lead analyses that produce actionable insights.
Leverage large, complex data sets to identify, quantify and influence tangible performance gains.
Define, collect, develop and monitor key business metrics.
Create insightful automated dashboards and data visualizations to track key metrics and trends.
Develop and test analytic solutions to be used by internal and external customers.
Collaborate with business intelligence on data warehouse requirements etc.
Active involvement or playing a lead role in testing, training, and implementation of applications/solutions.
Skills

Qualifications
Intermediate to advanced skills in Excel, SQL and data analysis software such as R, Python, and SAS
Experience developing data visualizations and using BI software such as Tableau, Power BI, and Sisense
Strong academic record, ideally in Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or other quantitative field
Intense intellectual curiosity – strong desire to always be learning
Positive, people-oriented, and energetic attitude
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving difficult problems
Passionate about data and analytics
Education: Bachelor’s degree preferred not required)

Experience
3+ years in a quantitative business role
Experience with temporary and professional staffing agencies and/or in the tax incentive industry a plus
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

About Torii

Torii is a rapidly-growing startup in one of the hottest emerging categories: SaaS Management. We help customers like Instacart, Palo Alto Networks, and Payoneer discover and act on every single cloud application in their portfolio. Torii is backed by leading venture capital firms including Wing Venture Capital, Global Founders Capital, Uncork Capital, Tiger Global, Entree Capital and LocalGlobe.

About The Role

The marketing analyst will have an important role in helping the company grow by influencing the decision-making of one of our main growth engines - the Marketing department.

We're looking for a candidate with great analytical skills, the ability to tell a story through data, an eye for detail, great communication, and keenness for problem-solving.

This candidate will be the first marketing analyst, and will build and define our marketing work processes, dashboards, reports, KPIs, and all data related work.

They will ensure that our data and insights are actionable to drive decisions across the business.

Key Responsibilities
Shape our marketing strategy and foster data-driven decisions by helping to set the right KPIs, analyzing users' behavior and creating visibility into our products performance.
Analyze data sets to discover product insights and help translate them into actionable recommendations.
Build reports, dashboards and metrics, in addition to monitoring the integrity and validity of the data reported
Design and maintain ongoing Marketing metrics, reports, analysis and dashboards to drive key business decisions.

Desired Skills & Experience
A minimum of 2+ years of experience as a Marketing / Business Analyst or a similar role.
Proficient level of SQL - MUST.
BA in Industrial Engineering / Economics / Statistics or equivalent academic background.
Experience with Looker or any other BI tools (our team uses Looker).
Deep understanding of numbers, as well as a strong business sense. Know when to use a single number and when to build a complex model to gain an insight
Ability to multitask and handle various priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent team player, and strong attention to details
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to present to Managers.

What You'll Love About Us
You will be the first to perform this role in the company, which will give you a lot of autonomy and ability to bring yourself.
You will join the company at a period of rapid growth and have a significant impact on the company's success and overall trajectory.
You will be an integral part of the company and will have the opportunity to directly influence the future of our product.
You will be part of a team of great people who are passionate about their work and build together the future of SaaS Management.

Benefits
100% fully paid health, vision, and dental benefits for you and your family
Generous vacation policy to encourage a health work-life balance
Unlimited Sick + Safe Leave
401k with 6% Safe Harbor Match to support your financial future
Life Insurance and Disability Insurance
Employee Discounts with SmartSpend
New Hire IT Hardware - MacBook, Mouse, Keyboard, Monitor
A sweet $1,000 WFH Stipend that you accrue to own
Team Events, and more!

Mandarin Oriental is seeking a Digital Data Analyst to form the data and reporting hub for the MOHG digital team. The analyst will scrutinize digital data to identify trends and opportunities relating to increasing direct digital revenue. The role will provide forecasts and projections to inform performance marketing budgets for source markets, hotels & campaigns. These insights will directly inform the allocation of performance marketing funds & be crucial in securing approval for additional digital investment. The Digital Data Analyst will hold responsibility for the compilation of all reporting dashboards and regular distribution to key stakeholders and senior leadership. The role will work with external stakeholders to enhance the performance marketing attribution model & expand to incorporate the customer journey on MO.com, providing a holistic view on the customer experience from initial marketing engagement to transaction. The individual will have exceptional analytical, problem-solving and communications skills and is naturally creative, pragmatic, and collaborative.

Qualifications

Minimum of four years’ experience working in digital analytics.
Strong analytical skills with excellent attention to detail.
Demonstrable experience of digital analytics platforms such as GA 360, Adobe Analytics etc.
Understanding of digital attribution and user journeys.
Experience of working with tag management systems such as Google Tag Manager, Tealium etc.
Knowledge of SQL, Big Query or JavaScript advantageous.
Strong interest in marketing and hospitality; curious about data, data modelling and strategy
Ability to adapt to and accommodate evolving projects and requests; able to work to tight deadlines.
Organized, delivery focused and comfortable working on own initiative.
Presentation and communication skills with ability to create and build relationships
MS Office – Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook
Education: 2:1 Bachelors degree

In alignment with Vanguard’s dedication to making advice more accessible and affordable for investors, Vanguard Institutional is dedicated to supporting all aspects of our growing advice businesses for our Institutional clients and participants. This role will deliver analytics to supplement Vanguard’s hardworking roster of advice-focused products and advisors and offer leadership and development opportunities. As a member of a growing team supporting a strategic initiative, you will have a unique opportunity to advance analytics capabilities as Vanguard’s Advice business grows.

This position is designated as hybrid (In-office + remote) and will be based in one of Vanguard’s business centers (Malvern PA, Charlotte NC, Scottsdale AZ) when the time comes for our offices to re-open in 2022.

Create the strategies and experiences that are changing an industry.

In Vanguard's Institutional (IIG) division, we serve millions of employees (known as participants) by partnering with their employers to create smart, effective retirement plans and ensure our low-cost, high-performing funds are available within retirement plans. As an analyst, you’ll help us build and evolve our advice experiences, capabilities, and product line-up to serve the needs of individual investors and plan sponsors. You’ll help us tap into unmet investor needs and disrupt the traditionally high-cost advice marketplace using quantitative insights to uncover areas of opportunity and drive strategies that enhance the client experience. You will play a critical role in implementing the use of advanced analytics into business processes to drive strategic decision making and deepen understanding of our participants.

Summary.

We are looking for passionate crew who want to leverage the power of analytics to drive strategic enhancements to the client experience. As an analyst, you will use quantitative methods to inform strategy, uncover areas of opportunity, and enhance the client experience. You will support business reporting, perform descriptive and predictive analyses, design and measure experiments with statistical rigor, and visualize data to deliver actionable insights.

Core Responsibilities

Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions, and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and supports projects through completion.
Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness.
Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using analytical methods.
Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement.
May own and manage recurring analytic or reporting processes.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum of three years related work experience.
Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience.

Additional Skills:

Undergraduate degree in an analytic/quantitative field such as: Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or related analytical field of study or equivalent combination of training and experience. A graduate level degree in an analytics focused field is strongly preferred
Intermediate level skills in SQL in an applied business context. Proficiency with relational databases or Big Data platforms, Data Analysis packages (Python, R, SAS etc.) and Data Visualization packages (Tableau, etc.)
The ability to understand data, process it, extract value from it, visualize it and communicate insights to audiences of various backgrounds, including senior management

Special Factor

Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

We are seeking an experienced data analyst capable of leading and supporting studies assessing the mission performance of Intelligence Community (IC) elements tasked with countering threats of weapons of mass destruction (WMD) proliferation. The National Counterproliferation Center (NCPC) is the mission manager for the Counterproliferation (CP) WMD mission, developing and coordinating strategy for the U.S. IC CP program, assessing performance against that strategy, and implementing key initiatives to advance the CP mission. The Data Analyst will be part of a team of IBM consultants and will provide full-time, on-site direct support to government personnel who require analytics expertise.

Duties Include

Supporting and advancing the team’s existing efforts to analyze mission data in support of NCPC leadership decisionmaking
Identifying new opportunities to integrate data analytic techniques (e.g., machine learning, statistical analysis) into the team’s CP mission assessments
Gathering, analyzing, and visualizing CP mission data
Supporting NCPC leaders in understanding complex CP/WMD issues

Required Technical and Professional Expertise

US Citizen with active TS/SCI and CI Poly
Experience in R and/or Python
2+ years of IC experience, including a demonstrated familiarity with and working knowledge of intelligence community entities, missions, functions, processes, and data
2+ years of experience in data analytics, to include experience in the following: Data acquisition, processing, storage, and retrieval; Data analysis and visualization; Evaluating and continuously improving machine learning methods; Communicating key findings to senior executives in the form of high-quality written deliverables and oral briefings
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, to include using formulas, pivot tables, and charts to clean, manipulate, and portray data Experience with Microsoft PowerPoint
Demonstrated ability to work in a collaborative, team environment
Demonstrated ability to summarize and present complex technical issues in written and graphical manner for a non-technical audience
Demonstrated ability to work effectively under time constraints and potentially changing priorities, while maintaining a high level of attention to detail
BA/BS, preferably in Data Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related area of study

Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise

MS in a Data Science-related field
Experience running AI/ML algorithms against large datasets
Full-scope Polygraph
Experience supporting the DNI
Experience using Databricks or other cloud based analytic environments

About Business Unit

IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.

Position Summary

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data Science department. The position is primarily aimed tracking OKR and KPI metrics for our Acute & Payer division to track progress towards key business objectives. The Data Analyst will be responsible for using real-time and historical healthcare data to report on metrics and trends in a variety of areas such as utilization, facility onboarding, data quality, platform user metrics, and platform notifications and related functionality. The Data Analyst will prepare, analyze, and review health care data; visualize data, interpret results, and provide recommendations; and manage relationships with our internal partners.

Key Responsibilities
Extract data to build metrics or create/update Tableau dashboards to track success toward company, department, and customer KPIs
Share insights with customers regarding drivers of success or areas of opportunity
Research new ideas to help prioritize areas of focus
Consult with internal and external customers to develop new dashboards, metrics, KPIs, and outcomes evaluations
Respond to ad hoc analytic requests from internal and external customers
Understand and use the data warehouse and relational databases
Ensure accurate quality of deliverables by participating in peer review
Who You’ll Work With
The Data Analyst will work closely with other members of our Data Science department as well as many teams throughout the organization such as Account Management, Operations, Sales Operations, Finance, and Product.
Required Experience
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in data science, analytics, mathematics, statistics, public health, economics, social science, or actuarial science. Master’s degree preferred.
0-2 years of experience related to analytics work or equivalent combination of education and experience
Previous healthcare related industry experience a plus
Experience with data mining and visualization tools such Python and Tableau, as well as querying languages (SQL, etc.)
Knowledge of all Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Ability to meet deadlines, work with tight schedules, and manage multiple priorities under minimum supervision
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong analysis skills
Strong attention to detail
Experience with cleaning, aggregating, and pre-processing data from varied sources. Experience creating complex SQL queries for standard as well as ad hoc data mining purposes

Job Description

Tittle: Data Analyst

Location: New York, NY // Sunrise, FL // Phoenix, AZ

Duration: 6+ months

The Data Analyst supports the client's team by owning the data model that underlies our enterprise transformation effort. The analyst is able to understand their company's strategy and develop the right metrics and supporting data model, partners closely with stakeholders to collect data efficiently, and is the key team member to help us measure, track, and report on program goals.

Responsibilities

Work with various Technology teams and unit CIOs to understand their resourcing move strategy and leverage existing datasets to create an SOR data model that underlies this strategy

Develop intuitive online collection templates and clear instructions to gather resourcing data from a wide variety of stakeholders across the enterprise

Solicit and gather data from stakeholders, answer questions and remove impediments in data collection

Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.

Analyze the data to uncover trends and assess data quality and completeness. Recommend additional data sources when needed.

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.

In collaboration with project/program leadership, define the key insights and metrics which the business needs to address, and develop appropriate business intelligence datasets, analytics, dashboards or methods.

Work closely with stakeholders across Technology, Finance, Vendor Management, and others.

Be responsible for taking data analysis and insights capability to the next level by working with data infrastructure to ensure the data is accessible, auditing existing visualization dashboards, and working with stakeholders to recommend and create new reporting/insights.

Provide clear, timely and accurate communication to business unit leadership/ appropriate audiences on business performance trends and key insights.

Qualifications

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst, ~5 yrs. experience

Self-starter with experience working in a dynamic environment.

Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques

Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings

BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Experience in resourcing models across geographies and large corporate with financial management preferred

Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, Tableau etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks) a plus

Job Description

As a member of the Retail Pharmacy Product Development organization you will be responsible for the design, development and delivery of analytic solutions. You will collaborate with business partners from product development and management, operations, finance, and marketing to demonstrate value of CVS Pharmacy products and services. You will enable data-driven strategic decision-making and identify opportunities for existing product improvement and new product development. This role will have a direct impact in the budgeting and program management of a 300+ million prescription patient care programs.

Required Qualifications

2+ years of experience using analytical languages like Python and SQL to drive analyses and derive insights to optimize program processes

2+ years of experience designing and implementing analytic and reporting solutions to support identified project needs
1+ year of experience constructing and delivering reports of analytic findings in a variety of formats (reports, PPT etc.), including visualization of data and findings
COVID Requirements

COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement

CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated.

You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience communicating complex technical subjects to technical and non-technical audiences, such as but not limited to training analytic and business users on how to use data layers and reporting tools, including development of documentation and training materials
Independent, curious, eager to tackle a wide variety of problems and able to quickly develop knowledge and understanding of new domains and underlying data sources
Has experience accessing data, design summary data layers and manipulate large datasets to support planned analyses, using Python, SQL and similar tools
Has previously collaborated with key internal and external stakeholders in gathering and analyzing needs and understanding reporting requirements
Has 3+ years of experience in data analysis, cleansing, transformation, advanced analytics etc.
Education

Bachelor's degree is required.

Advanced degree in a qualitative field preferred.

Designs and builds business analytics tools covering optimization, logistics, production, and contracting for the Carbohydrates group. The Role: Customer Data Analyst (Remote)

In 2021, Faethm joined Pearson, creating the world’s first truly end-to-end capability of intuitive company and employee enrichment and accelerating our cumulative mission to prepare every worker, everywhere, for the future of work and subsequent success. Our market-leading data, insights and AI capabilities will power the next generation of Pearson’s lifelong learning products to meet the rapidly changing needs of today’s workforce and bridge the global skills gap.

Faethm is scaling! We're looking for a US East Coast based Customer Data Analyst to join us on this exciting journey!  We have recently joined forces with Pearson, world’s largest learning company. Operating as a scale-up within a larger company, Faethm will continue to evolve as we leverage the resources and offerings of our new parent company.

Faethm's objective is to keep every worker, everywhere, employable . Our AI-powered SaaS platform helps clients navigate the Future of Work and impact of technology on any economy, industry, organization, or job and suggests viable transition pathways for impacted employees into 'future proof' career pathways.

Faethm is building out its Customer Insights team to manage and support a growing pipeline of client activities across the Americas. Core to your work at Faethm is an interest in process optimization, system standardization and creative analytics. We work with large workforce datasets, which are ingested into our AI engine to develop insights on the impact of external trends on a workforce or economy. This means that our Data Analysts are critical stakeholders in successful onboarding, kick-off, and value creation for our clients through analytical insights.

As such, Faethm is seeking candidates with two core skill sets:
Scrappy 'get stuff done' individuals with a desire to improve systems, create standardized processes, and automate our own capabilities
People with a passion for unique visualization and data interpretation and a willingness to experiment / create new content to generate value for our clients
We are looking for a delivery-focused and self-starting  Data Analyst  to join our team and grow with us. Initial responsibilities are detailed below, but we expect this role will evolve over time. and as such, flexibility, collaboration, a passion for your work, an unquenchable thirst for knowledge, and a sense of humor will be essential.

What You’ll Be Doing

You will be responsible for the collection and analysis of client data, improvements to process flows, and analysis of key workforce data insights.
Work closely with key internal stakeholders (Customer Insights – client delivery, Product team and Sales), to understand their priorities and shifting needs.
Utilize a client-driven mindset to ensure Faethm client accounts are set-up in a logical, intuitive manner with clean workforce data to enable impactful insights.
Engage in continuous process improvements to the client onboarding process, with a focus on working with the Customer Insights team and clients to enable a seamless onboarding experience to the Faethm platform.
Periodically communicate with clients to discuss workforce data requirements, resolve errors, gaps, and limitations in submission files.
Collect and assimilate various workforce and emerging-technology data.
Apply your analytical skillset to understand, interpret, manipulate, and visualize data (e.g., via Tableau, Excel, etc.)
Required Skills & Experience
Experience in processing, cleaning, organizing and manipulating data
Programming in scripting languages such as Python
Development, enhancement and standardization of process automation and process flows, including running and understanding scripts
Strong MS Excel proficiency including pivot tables, filtering, formulas, etc.
Familiarity with Tableau or other BI data viz tools
Ability to effectively communicate complex topics via Tableau, Excel or PowerPoint
Knowledge of AWS
Prior consulting or direct client experience with tact and professionalism in communication
Join our team in the US with a rapid scale mandate and help us build our capability as we support clients across industry verticals.

We’re looking forward to discussing the role with you. Please note, due to volume of applicants and time constraints, only successful applicants will be contacted.

Faethm is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Under-represented communities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Learning is the most powerful force for change in the world. More than 20,000 Pearson employees deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose – to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. We are the world’s leading learning company. Learn more at pearsonplc.com.

Program Overview: The Comcast Center Coop Program (CCIP) is an 26-week summer coop program based at our Philadelphia Headquarter location. In this role you will immerse yourself into the Comcast culture, working side by side with innovative and talented Comcasters. Job Description

Position Summary:

The role of the data analyst co-op on the Comcast Business Strategic Analytics team is to consolidate, organize, and facilitate the dissemination of knowledge about Comcast data assets to enable informed analytics that drive profitable growth.This involves information gathering, data research, data flow modeling, business process mapping, data integrity analysis, and creation of documentation to help standardize our efforts on a single source of truth. This role involves working with teams across the business to understand business workflow, data generated at different touchpoints, and how it is represented in various systems.

Core Responsibilities:

Data research, discovery, data profiling and curation for Comcast Business using data from different business functions and systems.
Understand the business data flow and perform analysis of use cases in coordination with Analytics and business teams.
Support data maturity efforts (documentation, education, etc) for Comcast Business data objects.

Required Skills and Experience:

Currently enrolled and pursuing aBS/MS degree in Computer Science from a United States-based college or university.
Ability to analyze data and work independently
Ability to collaborate with people across the organization in seeking required information.
Ability to consolidate information about data in a comprehensive and simple way
Ability to communicate findings and make recommendations regarding data gaps and situations that are uncovered in the course of this work.

Technical Skills:

SQL is required. Hands on experience with Teradata, Hive, SQL server.
Good understanding of different RDBMS and database concepts, data flow processes are required.
Good knowledge of database structures, theories, principles, and practices.
Analytical and problem-solving skills, applied to business processes is required.
Ability to correlate business process with data generation and end use for analytics.

Education

Master's Degree

Relevant Work Experience

0-2 Years

About Bridgewater

Bridgewater Associates is a premier asset management firm, focused on delivering unique insight and partnership for the most sophisticated global institutional investors. Our investment process is driven by a tireless pursuit to understand how the world's markets and economies work — using cutting edge technology to validate and execute on timeless and universal investment principles. Founded in 1975, we are a community of independent thinkers who share a commitment for excellence. By fostering a culture of openness, transparency, and inclusion, we strive to unlock the most complex questions in investment strategy, management, and corporate culture.

Explore more information about Bridgewater on our website here.

Our Culture

Bridgewater's unique success is the direct result of our unique way of being. We want an idea meritocracy in which meaningful work and meaningful relationships are pursued through radical truth and radical transparency. We require people to be extremely open, air disagreements, test each other's logic, and view discovering mistakes and weaknesses as a good thing that leads to improvement and innovation. It is by continually striving together for the highest levels of truth and excellence that we create meaningful work and meaningful relationships. Within this culture, Diversity and Inclusion is a top priority because it is essential to finding the best talent in the world, enabling our idea meritocracy, and creating an environment where all types of people can thrive. We have a full-time team as well as affinity networks that work on these issues - If you would like to learn more, please let your Bridgewater recruiter know.

Explore more information about Bridgewater's culture on our website here.

About The Research Department

Our mission is to understand how the world works — building and compounding our understanding of the timeless cause-and-effect relationships that move global economies and markets. With curiosity, cutting-edge technology, and deep sets of data, we build frameworks and analytical models that explain everything from long-term debt cycles to currency devaluations; and we use that compounded understanding to create the investment strategies that drive Bridgewater.

About The Team

The Data Specialist role is part of the Investment Engineering team. Their mission is to build the core pieces of modeled data which underlie Bridgewater's investment understanding and trading strategies.

About Your Role

As a Data Specialist, your job is to ensure Bridgewater uses the best data possible for our investment goals and our researchers, engineers, and operators deeply understand the data under your purview. This requires, within your area of expertise, a thorough understanding of the investment concepts and their real-world measurements as well as being the person responsible for data availability in the outside world. You will spend your time developing a point-of-view on the external world's data landscape and showing researchers how new content could fit into Bridgewater's understanding of the world. You will work with our investment engineers, who are tasked with turning the outside world of data into datasets usable by the algorithms used to generate Bridgewater's views on markets, to ensure the data is well represented in our investment process. You will work with our investment operations team, which is responsible for the daily validation of our investment models, to answer questions related to the models where you are the expert, including how to validate such data.

Interested in learning more about working at Bridgewater? Hear about the experiences of our employees here.

You will drive the following responsibilities:
Be the expert for data in your area (e.g. corporate financial statements, security market data, analyst estimates, etc.), including both mechanics (i.e. what is captured in the vendor representations of different statement line items) as well as color (i.e. best data providers; up-to-date on market action; in the flow of what is happening in the sector, etc.), and cost
Comfortable investigating data to understand it, doing basic analysis, and synthesizing the impact of various choices on our investment processes and research
Working closely with our data procurement team to bring on the best data available for our internal investment needs
Answer questions from investors about data quality, provenance, release timing, methodology, etc.
Partnering with our technology teams to ensure the best possible data is delivered excellently for internal consumption to meet our investment needs
Note: While the core function of this job does not require building data pipelines you may, from time to time, need to build some for exploratory needs

You will be a click for the role if you:
Enjoying digging into data and understanding what is behind the numbers
Are already or have a strong desire to become an expert in an area of the market
Are analytical and structured in your thinking, and can communicate this well with others of varying degrees of content expertise
Can perceive problems and resolve them by identifying and weighting tradeoffs
Can make practical tradeoffs while ensuring excellent work is done
Enjoy learning about new data tools and programming languages

Minimum Qualifications
Direct experience and demonstrated expertise within a major asset class and with the relevant data providers / data sets (i.e. Bloomberg, Refinitiv, ESG, etc.)
4-year degree from an accredited undergraduate institution with a focus on finance, economics, operations research, or STEM
For common data providers (Bloomberg, Refinitiv, etc.) very familiar with data models, cost models, and access methods (i.e. APIs)
Experience with a broad range of data schemas (e.g., ontologies, taxonomies, etc.)
Proficiency in data modeling for relational and dimensional data platforms
Strong SQL skills
2-3 Years at investment management firm or data provider

Physical Requirements

This role requires individuals to work at our offices in Westport, CT at a minimum of two days (and some cases three) per week with the option to work offsite on other days.

Why Choose Bridgewater?

It takes all types to make Bridgewater great. We seek a diverse group of innovative thinkers and push them to engage in rigorous and thoughtful inquiry. We develop people through an honest examination of their abilities and performance, enabling personal growth and professional development. We strive to provide you opportunities that will challenge you and unlock your potential.

In this role, you will grow with us by:
Undergoing a training program of structured classes and on-the-job apprenticeship.
Taking ownership of increasingly complex systems and processes.
Taking on oversight and mentorship responsibilities to grow talent as you gain experience.
Opportunities to grow your career across Bridgewater depending on your strengths, weaknesses, and experience.

Health insurance with 100% premium covered and access to additional concierge medical services
401(k) plan with generous employer match
Paid time off, including fully paid parental leave and a competitive PTO package
Workplace flexibility and access to back up childcare
Financial assistance for family building support, including adoption and egg freezing
Workplace wellness, including on-site gyms, free meals and healthy snacks , and meditation rooms
An engaged and active community that includes many company events, affinity networks, and extracurricular interest groups

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

Who We Want

Strategic thinkers. People who enjoy analyzing data or trends for the purposes of planning, forecasting, advising, budgeting, reporting, or sales opportunities

The Data Sales Operations Analyst for Emergency Care will be responsible for providing the sales organization with information, content, and tools that increase sales productivity and effectiveness. In addition, they will escalate system issues and find resolutions as required. With the data they provide, they will assist in the territory alignment, regional quota assessment and provide recommendations to the Sales Directors.

Along with the creation of sales metrics, they will be super user to complete analysis and feed the sales teams with key data. They will improve and evolve processes, metrics and job duties to improve efficiency, accuracy and enable the team for sales growth. This individual will be an integral part of ensuring our sales team has the necessary tools and equipment along with removing roadblocks that would prevent them from selling. Accountable for supporting ERP work stream, CRM implementation, and successful migration to Power BI
Responsible for utilizing sales tools as a super user to complete analysis and recommendations for territories.
Execute the analysis of internal and external data sources to support sales strategies and programs.
Support monthly business reviews and highlights for the sales organization.
Partner with National Accounts and marketing teams to analyze and identify targeted sales opportunities and customer business reviews
Liaison between commercial functions and IT/IS, Finance, and Market Development teams – ensuring that key requirements are met and execution is accomplished in a timely fashion.
Responsible for the development and completion of sales measurement metrics.

Experience with Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Superior Excel and PowerPoint skills are required.

Job Description

Join BAE Systems' Intelligence and Security Sector and be part of an agile team that enables our employees to support our customers and their missions. As a Data Analyst, you will apply statistics, machine learning, and analytic approaches to produce products supporting the mission. You will also use machine learning techniques to find hidden patterns, trends, classifiers, and anomalies. This position will provide the analyst with an opportunity to work alongside other data scientists and engineers to develop tools and process for analysis – and author SOPs. Products and processes may be brief to customer senior leadership, making a true impact for the warfighter.

May require TDY over life of the contract.

Other possible locations include Virginia, Georgia, North Carolina, Texas, Hawaii, Maryland, Germany, Italy, and South Korea. Please go to https://jobs.baesystems.com to apply for these locations.

Required Education, Experience, & Skills

BS in Data Science, Statistics, Applied Math, or related discipline and minimum 1 year of relevant experience or AA with 3 years of relevant experience.
Proficiency with R or Python, and SQL, AWS applications.
Experience implementing supervised and unsupervised machine learning techniques, statistical techniques and concepts, data retrieval and storage, visualization and warehousing, and extract-transform-load (ETL) processes.
Background in visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders and Knowledge of data visualization tools.
Preferred Education, Experience, & Skills

Five years intelligence analysis experience (MOS 35/350 series or other DoD/IC equivalent)

About BAE Systems Intelligence & Security

BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. Knowing that our work enables the U.S. military and government to recognize, manage and defeat threats inspires us to push ourselves and our technologies to new levels.

Overview

At Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.

We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.

Perficient is on a mission to help the Healthcare industry take advantage of modern data and analytics architectures, tools, and patterns to improve the quality and affordability of care. This is an excellent opportunity for the right individual to assist Perficient and its customers to grow the capabilities necessary to improve care through better use of data and information, and in the process take their career to the next level.

We are looking for a Healthcare Business Data Analyst with Healthcare Payer Data experience to join our Healthcare Data & Analytics Practice.

Job Overview

The Healthcare Data Analyst will work as part of a project team to gather data and business requirements, perform technical and data analysis, define data requirements, and create logical mappings for data ingest and integration to enable new data pipelines to move, transform, cleanse and populate data into downstream data models and interfaces. You will collaborate with some of the best talent in the industry to create and implement innovative high quality solutions, all done while working with Perficient and client team members.

Responsibilities

This analyst will create business, functional and data requirements for a cloud-based data lake, warehouse, and BI reporting system. Experience with Payer and Pharmacy Benefits Management industry is desired.

> Must have strong data analysis experience with ability to think on their feet

> Must have significant experience working with healthcare payer data

> Must have significant experience performing data profiling and data mapping for the purpose of data ingestion, integration, and data presentation

> Must have strong written and verbal communication and customer facing interaction skills

> Must be able to work unsupervised within a dynamic client organization

> Must have strong SQL query language skills

> Must have experience creating data requirements and mapping specs and documentation

Qualifications
MUST HAVE A HEALTHCARE PAYER DATA ANALYSIS and MAPPING EXPERIENCE
Strong sql query language skills.
Data requirements and data mapping elaboration and documentation experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong consulting and customer relationship skills
Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work.

More About Perficient

Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.

Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index.

Perficient is an award-winning Premier Level IBM Business Partner , a Microsoft National Service Provider and Gold Certified Partner, an Oracle Platinum Partner , an Adobe Business Solution Partner , and a Salesforce Platinum Consulting Partner .

Job Title: Data Analyst

Requisition ID: 197503BR

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to live every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

How will you make an impact?

This Data Analyst role will support the Commercial Excellence Analytics Team with ad-hoc analyses and projects that support critical sales management decisions and empower sales, account managers, and leaders to make well-informed business decisions.

What will you do?

This role’s primary focus will be to support ad-hoc and strategic divisional analytics projects. The projects will have a strong focus on Sales critical metrics, including territory alignment/management and other critical business activities. This role will also support the development and maintenance of PowerBI dashboards and SQL queries that are used to provide useful information to the business while providing analytical support to the Finance and Sales departments.
Collect sales and utilization data with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail. Implement procedures for data validation and quality control of reporting to effectually support commission plans, actively review data for forecasting, and provide ideas for improvements.
Through the analysis of business processes, clearly define and document requirements to align on BI design, metrics and viable, required data sources that are mutually acceptable to the clients and the business.
Proactively evaluate and find opportunities for existing BI system and process improvements.
Gather and implement feedback from business users to further improve existing reporting.
Partner with system analysts on technical design and coordinate development work with development teams.
Present results of analytic/BI reports and facilitate training for effective usage across the business.

How will you get there?
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Information Management, or Mathematics/Statistics is preferred.
Healthcare or Life Sciences industry experience is not required but is a plus
Strong technical background, especially with Excel and BI reporting tools (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, etc.). Solid understanding of source systems, especially with SQL databases.
2-3 years of experience delivering business intelligence solutions. Strong analytical, diligent approach, critical thinking skills, and documentation skills.
Strives for accurate and timely results, able to manage multiple projects in parallel and complete assignments independently and collaboratively.
Brings a strong sense of “customer service” and interpersonal skills to all levels in the division including executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Comfortable with large amounts of data and able to identify key trends and variances.
Ability to conceptualize user-friendly reporting for multiple audiences and convey a clear, digestible, and insightful story with data.
Cross-functional teams in the Hillsboro office, Netherlands, Czech Republic, and remote Sales team leaders and teams. Additionally, this role will work closely with Commercial Excellence teams, IT, and Finance.

Other Job Requirements:
Adhere to OHS policies and procedures and ensure a safe and healthy workplace environment.

About The Team

Through the centralization of strategic analytics and knowledge within the Learning, Evaluation, and Research (LEvR) Division, the Strategy and Analysis Team increases efficiency and consistency in our collective work to optimize how we convey College Board’s impact across all programs. The Strategy and Analysis team convenes analysts across College Board to establish a shared understanding of how and where analytics requests are being fulfilled and, when appropriate, that requests are addressed using a research and learning lens. This team anticipates strategic analytic and/or visualization needs of LEvR and College Board, and collaborates with stakeholders to deliver products that meet those needs.

About The Opportunity

The Data Analyst works with members of the Strategy and Analysis Team within the Learning, Evaluation, and Research Division of the College Board, to respond to data analytic inquiries throughout the organization with efficiency and accuracy. You will utilize your skill sets in data analytics to work cross-functionally and collaboratively to ensure clarity of requests and high-quality exploration of the data required to respond to requests.

In This Role, You Will
Develop and deploy analytics to respond to inquiries from across the organization
Distill complex analyses into digestible results
Visualize results of analyses in ways that are easily understandable for non-technical audiences
Be able to prioritize tasks and effectively manage their time


You Have
Expertise in educational data analysis using appropriate statistical methods and software (e.g., SAS, Stata, SPSS) with 1 – 3 years of experience analyzing data in the social sector, education industry preferred
Knowledge of and utility using SQL
Strong organization and prioritization skills and the proven ability to move forward multiple projects in concert, both independently and as a member of the team
Adept problem-solving skills, including using data to inform decisions and actions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
A passion for supporting the educational opportunities for millions of students
Once COVID travel restrictions are lifted, travel 1-2 times a year to our NYC office
Experience with large, national datasets related to the education industry (preferred)
Ability to quickly analyze data, generate results, and summarize effectively (preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills (preferred)

Vevo is the world's leading music video network, connecting an ever-growing global audience to high quality music video content for more than a decade. Founded by Universal Music Group and Sony Music Entertainment in 2009, Vevo offers fans worldwide a vast array of premium content to choose from, showcasing official music videos alongside a constantly developing lineup of live performances and innovative original programming. From top superstars to rising new talents, Vevo brings incomparable cross-promotional support to artists across the musical spectrum, at every stage of their careers.

Vevo has consistently evolved over the past decade to lead within today's ever-changing media landscape, embracing partnerships with a number of leading distribution platforms to deliver extraordinary content within ad-supported environments. With more than 26B views across television, desktop and mobile devices each month, Vevo brings music videos to the world – when, where, and how fans want them.

Vevo is available on YouTube, Samsung, Samsung TV Plus, Amazon Fire TV, Amazon Echo Show, PlutoTV, Apple TV, Roku, Comcast (Xfinity X1 and Xfinity Flex), VIZIO, Sky (NowTV and SkyQ), Foxxum, XITE, NetRange, Redbox, T-Mobile Play, Virgin Media, Xumo, Telstra and Vewd.

The Junior Data Analyst forms a key role at Vevo by helping with all facets of Vevo’s

analytics needs including data automation, data accessibility, data quality and

reporting on key trends and insights across the entire organization

Primary Responsibilities
Ideate with Data Leads on solutions to improve data accessibility and increase user adoption of Analytics tools
Maintain and routinely monitor the quality and integrity of data across all systems
Work cross department with key stakeholders and Data Engineering to update and remediate any discrepant data
Create and automate new DQ checks that can be used to flag data inaccuracies
Work in partnership with Data Leads to ideate, collate and create regular and Ad Hoc metrics reports
Collaborate with various departments within Vevo to gather data and reporting needs
Automate the reporting of key trends through dashboard creation within our various BI tools
Ideate, create and format all visuals for presentations
Work collaboratively with Analysts and Data Leads to request Analytic product enhancements from vendors
Validate, maintain and routinely monitor the quality and integrity data across all systems
Requirements
Recent graduate with Bachelor’s Degree with a focus on Data Analytics
Preferable with Internship experience in the Data Analytics field
Advanced experience with MS Excel including the use of pivot tables, macros, v-lookups, concatenate and If-then functions
Beginner SQL and/or Python experience
This is a full-time position based on-site/in the office. Vevo will operate in a hybrid work model and will require employees to be in office 2-3 days a week, on average. To qualify for the role you will need to be currently located near the office that you will be based out of, as well as provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19 prior to employment.

Vevo considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other legally protected status under local, state, or federal law.

At AT&T, we’re connecting the world through the latest tech, top-of-the-line communications and the best in entertainment. Our groundbreaking digital solutions provide intuitive and integrated experiences for millions of customers across online, retail and care channels. Join our mission to deliver compelling communication and entertainment experiences to customers around the world as we continue to evolve as a technology-powered, human-centered organization. As part of our team, you’ll transform the way we deliver a seamless customer experience with digital at the center of all you do. In our world, digital is much larger than just an eCommerce channel, we are transforming all channels to digitally perform as one team to create a better customer experience. As we move through 2021, the digital transformation will revolutionize the digital space and you can build a career that will propel your future.

About The Team

Our Sales Analytics & Insights team is looking for someone who is passionate about driving sales performance and has analytical and multi-task abilities to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

You will support our team and partners across the enterprise to ensure that projects & initiatives are on track, and that requirements are not missed. You will also execute analysis, research, and solution development to aid the Online Business in attaining sales targets and setting future goals. You will have an intimate knowledge of the current state of the business, current technology, and implement plans to achieve the desired future state.

About The Job

This role is at the frontline of AT&T’s digital transformation, supporting ecommerce and sales performance for our online properties. This role will act as part analyst, part internal consultant. Areas of impact include, but are not limited to sales reporting, analysis, insights and assistance in planning of all online consumer sales.

Responsibilities and Day-to-Day View
Lead analysis of sales, traffic, conversion, and order yield data to support improved sales performance
Work with analytics, product, and sales to improve operational performance
Drive requirements to automate and build self-service solutions for routine reporting requests, e.g., Executive Reporting Dashboard, User Story intake, etc.
Work with product managers and digital marketing teams to optimize end-to-end sales performance of the site
Develop deep insights on special sales events, and derive generally useful insights from them
Measure campaign effectiveness

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (finance, mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science, electrical engineering, physics, Marketing Information Systems (MKIS), etc.) or equivalent experience
Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud or Google Analytics a must
Experience with SQL & Tableau
Experience with Python, R, Tableau, PowerBI, SAS, and other BI software
2-3 years experience at a large-scale web property or equivalent experience in management consulting
Experience within high tech, software and/or wireless/telecom industry highly desired
Proven ability to lead initiatives without having direct managerial control
Strong analytical skills and the ability to convert consumer insights and performance data into high impact product initiatives
Proactive and anticipatory problem solver
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

Preferred Qualifications
MBA, analytics or consulting background
Experience with A/B, multivariate testing
Experience with Adobe Experience Cloud or Google Analytics
Experience with executive storytelling, presentations

AT&T is leading the way to the future – for customers, businesses and the industry. We're developing new technologies to make it easier for our customers to stay connected to their world. Together, we’ve built a premier integrated communications and entertainment company and an amazing place to work and grow. Team up with industry innovators every time you walk into work, creating the world you always imagined. Ready to #transformdigital with us? Apply now!

JobCategory:Technology

Description

FASHIONPHILE is more than just fashion — we’re revolutionizing the ultra-luxury fashion experience in order to create a sustainable alternative that extends the life cycle of products and makes them more accessible to a diverse customer base. As we strive to become the world's most sought-after brand in luxury re-commerce, we know it's our team members who make it all happen! We value diversity in our people, perspectives, and products. For us, it's the only way to cultivate the creativity and innovation essential to achieving our mission and supporting our customers. We do this both in-person and through our digital omni-channel experiences. If you're someone who embraces change, is authentic, and wants to make an impact this is the place for you.

About The Opportunity

FASHIONPHILE is looking for a full-time data analyst to join our Data Science and Analytics team in LOS ANGELES, CA! We are customer-obsessed and want to give our customers something to write home about by using data to improve their experience through operational excellence. The Data Analyst is a key member of the Data Science and Analytics team and you will be influential in establishing the use of data to optimize inventory at FASHIONPHILE.

Responsibilities Include

The ideal candidate is someone with a background in Operations Research or Management who is always curious and has a passion for data and providing insights. Even though the team sits in the Digital organization, you’ll work closely with other teams across the company to improve FASHIONPHILE’s supply chain through high-quality and timely reporting and analysis.
Ensure that FASHIONPHILE has the right inventory, at the right levels, in the right place, at the right time, and at the right cost
Forecast demand and inventory volume to prescribe target levels and maximize availability
Use data to optimize inventory mix across categories, brands, and styles to meet demand and increase profit
Determine the optimal physical distribution of inventory
Monitor and regularly assess the full supply chain, identifying opportunities to increase performance in terms of productivity, profitability, and quality
Present to stakeholders and support their initiatives with data and analysis
What We’re Looking For
2+ years of of operations, supply chain, or data analysis experience or a degree in statistics, analytics, industrial engineering, operations research/management, or business administration
Working knowledge of SQL with the ability to write queries from scratch
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau, Sisense/Periscope, MicroStrategy, Looker, or QuickSight
Familiarity with regression analysis and optimization
Proficiency with a programming language (Python and R) to import, process, summarize, and analyze data
A commitment to and appreciation of accurate and consistent data
The ability to learn autonomously and work with only some guidance
Good verbal and written communication skills and an ability to convey findings to non-experts
A willingness to take the initiative
Nice To Have
Experience with Sisense/Periscope or QuickSight
A background in r/e-commerce and an interest in fashion
Familiarity with dynamic models. simulation, and queuing theory
What We Offer
Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage
FSA options for Medical, Dependent Care & Commuter Benefits
Paid Time off, Paid Sick Time, and Paid Holidays
401(k) with generous match program
Free Life Insurance and AD&D
Long Term Disability Insurance
Employee Discount
