Description

Many of the world’s top engineers and scientists come together in our Water business because they view a community’s interaction with water a bit differently—as a single holistic system, rather than unconnected networks divided by jurisdictional boundaries. Working throughout the hydrologic cycle, we are delivering sustainable solutions to make sure water is where it should be and available when needed. Our experts guide our work with scientific rigor, an innovative spirit, and a vision for growth. Every day, we help communities improve, reuse, and protect this precious resource for future generations. By 2025 we’re hiring 2,000 people (like you) to join our team. Grow with us, H2O+U.

As data continues to grow in size and complexity, we need more robust tools to help clients manage, understand, and interact with it. Our focus centers around developing strategy alongside client needs and using software as a platform to deliver value and centralize insights across services. Software and digital strategy are the solutions that bridge the data to knowledge gap to deliver insights and analytics for clients to stay on top of the information that matters most and ultimately drive efficiencies in the operations of their assets.

Our shared focus is to combine digital transformation, modern visualizations, user experience design, data contextualization, and narrative science to help clients reach their full potential. Stantec is ranked No. 10 on the Top 150 Global Design Firms (http://www.enr.com/toplists/2017-Top-150-Global-Design-Firms-1) list by Engineering News-Record (ENR) and No. 10 on the Top 300 Architecture Firms (http://www.architecturalrecord.com/Top300/2017-Top-300-Architecture-Firms-1) list by Architectural Record , both leading industry publications. We want our digital practice to enter this upper echelon as well and it is our vision within the Water business line to increase awareness of Stantec as a global leader for digital solutions.

Your Opportunity

We are seeking a Data Analyst to increase our capacity in product development and project delivery. Candidates must have experience in managing large data sets, optimizing data schemas, and enabling accessibility of data through insights revealed in visualizations and metrics. This work includes applying quantitative analysis techniques, processing automation, and development of visualizations.

Stantec’s Digital Practice in our Water business line works closely with project managers and clients to develop and deploy solutions that enable our clients to have top tier information access and analytics. This journey includes identifying, defining, developing, delivering, and supporting those products. Data analysis and visualization are key parts of those steps.

This technical role will include working with multiple project and software development teams. Collaboration with other Digital Practice leadership, product owners, and development teams is anticipated. The ideal candidate will have experience as a data analyst with proven experience in analysis and management of data.

Your Key Responsibilities
Work with remote teams for development and implementation as needed for a variety of digital solutions for data collection, data analysis/processing automation, review interfaces, and key performance dashboards.
Contribute from a data science perspective in solution architecture and user interface design.
Develop and automate data collection, analysis, and extraction pipelines
Design and implement data schemas for temporal and spatial data sets
Design and implement insightful visualizations and metrics to make complex data accessible
Be well organized, self-motivated, and enjoy finding solutions to problems using data
Conduct work in a safe manner and promote health and safety within the office and outside of the office while visiting clients and job sites.
Effectively challenge and inspire staff to work together (even if we are apart) within our Water Digital Solutions business and being accessible to our staff.
Ability to lead and collaborate in project team setting and to engage in creative and critical thought.
Recommend solutions by identifying problems and understand the business problem & need.
You will be receiving direction from Digital Practice leadership in various locations and working with teams in remote locations.

Qualifications

Capabilities and Credentials
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts in writing and verbally.
Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, along with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
Excellent documentation skills.
Exceptional analytical and critical thinking
Candidates must be well organized, self-motivated, and enjoy finding solutions to problems.
This role may require some travel to attend meetings with clients and dev teams.
Proficiency in using tools such as Python, R, SQL or similar
Experience using source version control with Git.
Experience with temporal and spatial data analysis techniques and software
Experience with ingesting data from telemetry-based sources.
Experience in working with clients to ensure satisfaction.
Experience with writing academic styled papers for presenting both the methods used and results for data science projects.
Can work well in a distributed team environment without direct supervision.
Possess a hard-working and positive attitude.
Experience working in a consultant role is preferred.
Experience with Microsoft Office 365 and the Power Platform (BI, Automate, Apps) is preferred.
Education And Experience

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution. Minimum of 5 years of experience in data cleaning, data analysis, and automation of those workflows.

Typical office environment working with computers and remaining sedentary for long periods of time. Field work may include exposure to the elements including inclement weather.

position: Data Analyst - Nike Direct Loss Prevention - North America
details:
Who Are We Looking For

The Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in providing consistent and integrated reporting, translate complex findings into simple formats, empower data-driven decision making and communicate useful insights!

We're looking for a strong leader with experience in extracting data from various sources, completing complex analyses, providing data and reporting that help solve varied business problems. In addition, lead research and analytical work to identify, resolve and help implement solutions to key business issues that arise!

THIS CANDIDATE NEEDS TO HAVE:
Strong business relationship skills; Able to influence and make recommendations
High intellectual curiosity and growth mentality, with a willingness to learn new technologies and skills
Ability to look at problems from a high level and offer recommended solutions across the company (cause and effect) to articulate business cases
Capacity to navigate cross-functional relationships and influence with a strategic and analytical approach

What Will You Work On

This role will be responsible to:
Provide analytic support on projects, new initiatives, and strategic business decisions
Lead research and analytical work to identify areas of risk, resolve and implement solutions/risk improvement programs
Proactively gather the right data from appropriate sources, probe/consider all of the facts, consider other perspectives; conduct root cause analysis; refer to long term plans and goals; prioritize key factors; act decisively, promptly and confidently
Monitor existing metrics and partner with internal and external teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities
Turn data into visualized, useful analysis and metrics
Design and implement reporting solutions that enable partners to manage the business and make effective decisions
Development and maintenance of reports on daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly business and operational metrics; identify trends and opportunities that tell a story with data
Prepare data findings and insights, package them in a consistent & cohesive message and recommend clear actions on a continuous basis

Who Will You Work With

You will be a part of the Loss Prevention Ops team within North America Direct, while working collaboratively with Field Loss Prevention, Digital Loss Prevention, North America Retail Operations (NARO), Retail Store Teams, Finance, Sales Audit and Global Loss Prevention.

What You Bring
Bachelor's degree or higher; or combination of relevant education, experience and training
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in statistics, computer science, data science or related combination of education and experience
Advanced Excel, Data Visualization Platforms (i.e. Tableau) and PowerPoint skills required
Snowflake, Python and SQL experience preferred
Familiarity with analytics tools (Spark, Git, Jupyter) and cloud computing platforms (AWS preferred)
3-5 years of experience integrating qualitative and quantitative analytics to produce comprehensive conclusions
2-3 years of experience in broad-based business analytics roles including application of insights to complex business problems, and developing high-impact management and operational reporting
Prior experience in design and execution of analytical projects
Exceptional written, verbal, electronic communication and presentation skills with the ability to articulate complex business drivers
Works independently using excellent prioritization skills
Exercises discretion in confidential matters and uses independent judgement

ENTRYLEADER: Be Empowered to Grow within Nike and Create the Future.

Requisition ID: req25541

Job Title: Data Analyst

Sector: Information Technology

Employment Category: Regular

Employment Type: Full-Time

Open to Expatriates: No

Location: New York, NY HQ USA

Job Description

Background/IRC Summary

Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius – and a lot of courage – to move in the opposite direction." (Albert Einstein)

The International Rescue Committee responds to the world’s worst humanitarian crises and helps people to survive and rebuild their lives. Founded in 1933 at the request of Albert Einstein, the IRC offers lifesaving care and life-changing assistance to refugees forced to flee from war or disaster. At work today in over 40 countries and in 22 US cities, the IRC restores safety, dignity and hope to millions who are uprooted and struggling to endure. The IRC leads the way from harm to home.

Technology and Operations supports the organization’s work by providing reliable and scalable solutions for the IRC’s offices around the world.

The Data Team at IRC is responsible for the design and delivery of data technology and data programs at the IRC. Our team is committed to high-impact results by encouraging relationships across the organization, driving continuous improvement, and delivering value through the implementation of high-quality, strategic data programs.

Success looks like a leader with a strong understanding of the value of data, technology, programs and operations. You are highly organized and aspirational, adept at collaborating with a small team or working alone, have a high level of emotional intelligence (e.g., empathy, self-awareness, self-management), a positive outlook, and seek feedback for continuous improvement.

Job Overview/Summary

The Data Analyst will be responsible for the documenting requirements and technical specifications, testing and validating technical and data changes, data analysis, and troubleshooting of dashboards, reports, integrations, and data collection tools.

The successful candidate will be responsible for the development and maintenance of the SQL Servers and Data Warehouse on-prem and Cloud environment, ensuring its operational readiness (security, health, and performance), executing data loads, and performing data modeling in support of multiple domains. Must be capable of working independently and collaboratively.

Major Responsibilities
Compile, map, and analyze current processes, infrastructure & system data to capture business requirements and document current and future state through interaction with key business users, internal stakeholders, and 3rd party vendors.
Work with internal partners at all levels of the organization and across functional areas to understand business processes and their integration with business systems (people, processes, technology).
Understands business problems specific to organizational initiatives and opportunities; recommends solutions to management based on data analysis to enable the organization to achieve goals.
Manages, analyzes, and resolves data initiative issues and manages changes needed to meet the requirements of business partners while adhering to organizational data standards.
Tests and troubleshoots new and existing products in the portfolio – develops test practice to ensure data collection tools, reports, and dashboards are correct.
Participate in the implementation of new business data collection and visualization tools and technologies; ensure requirements and functional designs are accurate.
Ability to work with data sets, data manipulation and analysis
Conducting in-depth data cleaning and analyses using traditional and advanced methods. Running key statistics and analysis as directed by the senior members of the team.
Aggregate and transform data to meet the needs of efficient data analysis and reporting.
Actively address user questions and issues related to the data analytics platform
Generate ‘On-Demand’ Analysis and Reports based on user requests.
Provide training to users on new features prior to roll out of the analytics solutions and generate documentation.
Work with Business and Technology teams to determine and define application maintenance windows.
Required Skills / Experience / Education
Humanitarian first mindset
Positive outlook and compassionate communications
Ability to lead and be flexible to change course through ambiguity and change
Self-starter and be able to operate independently, plan workloads and deliver on commitments
Personally driven to utilize both proven and unique solutions to address business problems until issue is resolved.
Ability to speak and present on status of Projects as well as get in the weeds with partners and technical team
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to work independently, manage time and execute tasks
Solid technical knowledge and experience working with project management and documentation tools such as:JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, PowerPoint, and Excel, as well as related collaborative tools/platforms.
Excellent written and verbal communication
Flexible, team player, “get-it-done” personality
Ability to organize and plan work independently
Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment
Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams
Intermediate SQL and data analysis skills
Degree in degree in business analytics , computer science, MIS, economics, or other STEM area preferred
Previous Non-Profit Experience a plus
Experience with Power BI a plus
Working Environment
Standard office working environment.
Some international travel as needed.
The IRC and IRC workers must adhere to the values and principles outlined in IRC Way - Standards for Professional Conduct. These are Integrity, Service, and Accountability. In accordance with these values, the IRC operates and enforces policies on Beneficiary Protection from Exploitation and Abuse, Child Safeguarding, Anti Workplace Harassment, Fiscal Integrity, and Anti-Retaliation.

IRC et les employés de IRC doivent adhérer aux valeurs et principes contenus dans le IRC WAY (normes de conduite professionnelle). Ce sont l’Intégrité, le Service, et la Responsabilité. position: Data Analyst, Private Equity Performance Improvement
details:
Alvarez & Marsal is a leading independent global professional services firm, specializing in providing turnaround management, performance improvement and corporate advisory services, is seeking to expand its Private Equity Performance Improvement (PEPI) team. With more than 5,000 professionals based in 40 locations across North America, Europe, Asia, and Latin America, our firm excels in problem solving and value creation. Drawing on a strong operational heritage and hands-on-approach, our professionals work closely with organizations and stakeholders to help tackle complex business issues and maximize value.

A&M’s Private Equity Performance Improvement Services (PEPI) practice, with offices throughout the US, focuses on serving upper middle market and large cap private equity firms who have engaged A&M to help improve operating results at their portfolio companies. The companies we serve are upper middle market in the $50 million to over $1 billion plus range.

Data Analyst

A&M is seeking a data analyst to bring their energy, passion and expertise to help PEPI leadership gain insights into the reporting and processes of the practice. The Data Analyst is an internal role within A&M’s Private Equity Performance Improvement group, reporting directly to the CFO/COO of the practice. PEPI is a growing business targeting high growth in the next two to five years. We offer excellent opportunities for career advancement and building leadership skills.

Job Description
Create customized dashboards that turn practice data into meaningful summaries for the PEPI leadership teams and professional staff.
Apply financial knowledge to make key insights into the data
Use critical thinking skills to continuously improve reporting capabilities
Rethink current processes to improve efficiency and scalability
Liaise with A&M’s corporate finance organization to obtain data and analysis in a timely and efficient manner
Partner with other business units to share best practices and benchmarks across the firm
Assist in the preparation of presentation materials for leadership meetings
Ad-hoc projects
Ideal candidate profile
A Bachelor’s degree, preferably with combined studies in Information Systems and Finance or related business and technology field
2+ years of relevant experience
Applied proficiency with at least one programming/scripting language (Python or SQL)
Proficiency using data visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBI
Exceptional project management skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Flexibility to work as both a team member in a collaborative setting and as an individual contributor
Ability to thrive and be effective in fast-paced settings
Diversity & Inclusion

A&M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity and we foster inclusiveness. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&M way.

Voluntary Inclusion

It is Alvarez & Marsal’s policy to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, pregnancy, marital status, family status, religion, national origin, age or disability or any other non-merit based factor in accordance with all applicable laws and regulations.

Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters

Please note that as per A&M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters were engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting? Then come and join our global team!

Our global team: We are a team of 66,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture: We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success. As part of Siemens Clinical Innovation and Informatics Team, advise and assist the Ci2 team in using Siemens product portfolio, tools, and services, and help drive efficiency and effectiveness in hospital processes, including improving quality while reducing cost.

Analyze customer raw data extracts to support observed customer workflow.

Prepare weekly status reports on all project activities. May assist in pre-sales support activities as needed.
Work closely with the local Siemens team, including direct interaction with clients.

Microsoft SQL, Azure Data Warehouse
Business Intelligence Software

The Role: Customer Data Analyst (Remote)

In 2021, Faethm joined Pearson, creating the world’s first truly end-to-end capability of intuitive company and employee enrichment and accelerating our cumulative mission to prepare every worker, everywhere, for the future of work and subsequent success. Our market-leading data, insights and AI capabilities will power the next generation of Pearson’s lifelong learning products to meet the rapidly changing needs of today’s workforce and bridge the global skills gap.

Faethm is scaling! We're looking for a US East Coast based Customer Data Analyst to join us on this exciting journey!  We have recently joined forces with Pearson, world’s largest learning company. Operating as a scale-up within a larger company, Faethm will continue to evolve as we leverage the resources and offerings of our new parent company.

Faethm's objective is to keep every worker, everywhere, employable . Our AI-powered SaaS platform helps clients navigate the Future of Work and impact of technology on any economy, industry, organization, or job and suggests viable transition pathways for impacted employees into 'future proof' career pathways.

Faethm is building out its Customer Insights team to manage and support a growing pipeline of client activities across the Americas. Core to your work at Faethm is an interest in process optimization, system standardization and creative analytics. We work with large workforce datasets, which are ingested into our AI engine to develop insights on the impact of external trends on a workforce or economy. This means that our Data Analysts are critical stakeholders in successful onboarding, kick-off, and value creation for our clients through analytical insights.

As such, Faethm is seeking candidates with two core skill sets:
Scrappy 'get stuff done' individuals with a desire to improve systems, create standardized processes, and automate our own capabilities
People with a passion for unique visualization and data interpretation and a willingness to experiment / create new content to generate value for our clients
We are looking for a delivery-focused and self-starting  Data Analyst  to join our team and grow with us. Initial responsibilities are detailed below, but we expect this role will evolve over time. and as such, flexibility, collaboration, a passion for your work, an unquenchable thirst for knowledge, and a sense of humor will be essential.

What You’ll Be Doing

You will be responsible for the collection and analysis of client data, improvements to process flows, and analysis of key workforce data insights.
Work closely with key internal stakeholders (Customer Insights – client delivery, Product team and Sales), to understand their priorities and shifting needs.
Utilize a client-driven mindset to ensure Faethm client accounts are set-up in a logical, intuitive manner with clean workforce data to enable impactful insights.
Engage in continuous process improvements to the client onboarding process, with a focus on working with the Customer Insights team and clients to enable a seamless onboarding experience to the Faethm platform.
Periodically communicate with clients to discuss workforce data requirements, resolve errors, gaps, and limitations in submission files.
Collect and assimilate various workforce and emerging-technology data.
Apply your analytical skillset to understand, interpret, manipulate, and visualize data (e.g., via Tableau, Excel, etc.)
Required Skills & Experience
Experience in processing, cleaning, organizing and manipulating data
Programming in scripting languages such as Python
Development, enhancement and standardization of process automation and process flows, including running and understanding scripts
Strong MS Excel proficiency including pivot tables, filtering, formulas, etc.
Familiarity with Tableau or other BI data viz tools
Ability to effectively communicate complex topics via Tableau, Excel or PowerPoint
Knowledge of AWS
Prior consulting or direct client experience with tact and professionalism in communication
Join our team in the US with a rapid scale mandate and help us build our capability as we support clients across industry verticals.

We’re looking forward to discussing the role with you. Please note, due to volume of applicants and time constraints, only successful applicants will be contacted.

Faethm is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Under-represented communities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Learning is the most powerful force for change in the world. More than 20,000 Pearson employees deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose – to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. We are the world’s leading learning company. Learn more at pearsonplc.com.

Job Title: Data Analyst

Requisition ID: 197503BR

As part of the Thermo Fisher Scientific team, you’ll discover meaningful work that makes a positive impact on a global scale. Join our colleagues in bringing our Mission to live every single day to enable our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer. We provide our global teams with the resources needed to achieve individual career goals while helping to take science a step beyond by developing solutions for some of the world’s toughest challenges, like protecting the environment, making sure our food is safe or helping find cures for cancer.

How will you make an impact?

This Data Analyst role will support the Commercial Excellence Analytics Team with ad-hoc analyses and projects that support critical sales management decisions and empower sales, account managers, and leaders to make well-informed business decisions.

What will you do?

This role’s primary focus will be to support ad-hoc and strategic divisional analytics projects. The projects will have a strong focus on Sales critical metrics, including territory alignment/management and other critical business activities. This role will also support the development and maintenance of PowerBI dashboards and SQL queries that are used to provide useful information to the business while providing analytical support to the Finance and Sales departments.
Collect sales and utilization data with a high level of accuracy and attention to detail. Implement procedures for data validation and quality control of reporting to effectually support commission plans, actively review data for forecasting, and provide ideas for improvements.
Through the analysis of business processes, clearly define and document requirements to align on BI design, metrics and viable, required data sources that are mutually acceptable to the clients and the business.
Proactively evaluate and find opportunities for existing BI system and process improvements.
Gather and implement feedback from business users to further improve existing reporting.
Partner with system analysts on technical design and coordinate development work with development teams.
Present results of analytic/BI reports and facilitate training for effective usage across the business.

How will you get there?
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Information Management, or Mathematics/Statistics is preferred.
Healthcare or Life Sciences industry experience is not required but is a plus
Strong technical background, especially with Excel and BI reporting tools (i.e. Power BI, Tableau, etc.). Solid understanding of source systems, especially with SQL databases.
2-3 years of experience delivering business intelligence solutions. Strong analytical, diligent approach, critical thinking skills, and documentation skills.
Strives for accurate and timely results, able to manage multiple projects in parallel and complete assignments independently and collaboratively.
Brings a strong sense of “customer service” and interpersonal skills to all levels in the division including executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Comfortable with large amounts of data and able to identify key trends and variances.
Ability to conceptualize user-friendly reporting for multiple audiences and convey a clear, digestible, and insightful story with data.
Cross-functional teams in the Hillsboro office, Netherlands, Czech Republic, and remote Sales team leaders and teams. Additionally, this role will work closely with Commercial Excellence teams, IT, and Finance.

Quaero360 provides a view into the patient experience as they move through the treatment lifecycle. Producing actionable insights allows our clients to remove barriers to patients getting on therapy and to measure if their actions are improving the patient experience. Our Insights Driven Approach (IDA) to tracking brand, patient, market and operations insights manages the intake, processing and delivery of data in a HIPAA compliant (de-identified) fashion and visualizes the insights leveraging our Quaero360 platform. Job Description

Job Description:

Summary

Data Analyst / Data Governance Analyst :

The main function of a business operations specialist is to maintain vendor relationships, acting as a data analyst for non-IT projects or filling organizational roles above an administrative level, but below a management level. Other responsibilities may include maintaining all project management processes, including project goals, deadlines and metrics. He will report to the data testing manager.

Job Responsibilities

To help scope out requirements for data management framework adoption.
To help collect, collate and capture data elements as identified by report owners and data providers into excel spreadsheets and maintain the files on an ongoing basis to provide the most up to date view of scope.
Investment Banking and Asset Management product knowledge is required to perform the day to day operations.
Any regulatory reporting knowledge like CCAR, RDAR (BCBS 239), FRTB, IBOR is preferred
To update the files as each element is implemented to reflect the latest status

As a Data Analyst, you will be working closely with leadership to collect requirements, design reports, and present data to ensure our stakeholders make the best business decisions. Work you'll do

The Role: Customer Data Analyst (Remote)

In 2021, Faethm joined Pearson, creating the world’s first truly end-to-end capability of intuitive company and employee enrichment and accelerating our cumulative mission to prepare every worker, everywhere, for the future of work and subsequent success. Our market-leading data, insights and AI capabilities will power the next generation of Pearson’s lifelong learning products to meet the rapidly changing needs of today’s workforce and bridge the global skills gap.

Faethm is scaling! We're looking for a US East Coast based Customer Data Analyst to join us on this exciting journey!  We have recently joined forces with Pearson, world’s largest learning company. Operating as a scale-up within a larger company, Faethm will continue to evolve as we leverage the resources and offerings of our new parent company.

Faethm's objective is to keep every worker, everywhere, employable . Our AI-powered SaaS platform helps clients navigate the Future of Work and impact of technology on any economy, industry, organization, or job and suggests viable transition pathways for impacted employees into 'future proof' career pathways.

Faethm is building out its Customer Insights team to manage and support a growing pipeline of client activities across the Americas. Core to your work at Faethm is an interest in process optimization, system standardization and creative analytics. We work with large workforce datasets, which are ingested into our AI engine to develop insights on the impact of external trends on a workforce or economy. This means that our Data Analysts are critical stakeholders in successful onboarding, kick-off, and value creation for our clients through analytical insights.

As such, Faethm is seeking candidates with two core skill sets:
Scrappy 'get stuff done' individuals with a desire to improve systems, create standardized processes, and automate our own capabilities
People with a passion for unique visualization and data interpretation and a willingness to experiment / create new content to generate value for our clients
We are looking for a delivery-focused and self-starting  Data Analyst  to join our team and grow with us. Initial responsibilities are detailed below, but we expect this role will evolve over time. and as such, flexibility, collaboration, a passion for your work, an unquenchable thirst for knowledge, and a sense of humor will be essential.

What You’ll Be Doing

You will be responsible for the collection and analysis of client data, improvements to process flows, and analysis of key workforce data insights.
Work closely with key internal stakeholders (Customer Insights – client delivery, Product team and Sales), to understand their priorities and shifting needs.
Utilize a client-driven mindset to ensure Faethm client accounts are set-up in a logical, intuitive manner with clean workforce data to enable impactful insights.
Engage in continuous process improvements to the client onboarding process, with a focus on working with the Customer Insights team and clients to enable a seamless onboarding experience to the Faethm platform.
Periodically communicate with clients to discuss workforce data requirements, resolve errors, gaps, and limitations in submission files.
Collect and assimilate various workforce and emerging-technology data.
Apply your analytical skillset to understand, interpret, manipulate, and visualize data (e.g., via Tableau, Excel, etc.)
Required Skills & Experience
Experience in processing, cleaning, organizing and manipulating data
Programming in scripting languages such as Python
Development, enhancement and standardization of process automation and process flows, including running and understanding scripts
Strong MS Excel proficiency including pivot tables, filtering, formulas, etc.
Familiarity with Tableau or other BI data viz tools
Ability to effectively communicate complex topics via Tableau, Excel or PowerPoint
Knowledge of AWS
Prior consulting or direct client experience with tact and professionalism in communication
Join our team in the US with a rapid scale mandate and help us build our capability as we support clients across industry verticals.

We’re looking forward to discussing the role with you. Please note, due to volume of applicants and time constraints, only successful applicants will be contacted.

Faethm is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Under-represented communities are strongly encouraged to apply.

Learning is the most powerful force for change in the world. More than 20,000 Pearson employees deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose – to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. We are the world’s leading learning company. Learn more at pearsonplc.com.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Future of Work

During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.

As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.

When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).

The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

Description

Robert Half is currently working with a client seeking an Alteryx Data Reporting Analyst. To be successful in this role, you should be able to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Responsibilities include developing analysis and reporting capabilities and conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. You will also identify improvements to quality control plans by monitoring performance. MUST be in Cedar Rapids, IA area. For immediate and confidential consideration on this Alteryx Data Analyst opportunity, it is best to contact me directly via LinkedIn, Meg Liles, Sr Recruiter, and email resume CONFIDENTIALLY & directly to me OR you can ONE CLICK APPLY on our Robert Half Website. This is a contract / temporary position with one of our client companies in the Cedar Rapids, IA area.

Your Responsibilities
Support other departments in reaching their goals through analysis
Identify changes in financial and business trends by monitoring data
Communicate the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to managers
Regularly examine data reports to locate and resolve mistakes throughout
Accurately analyze and collect data for various types of business reports
Create business reports that provide insight into key data points
Maintain databases and perform updates as necessary for accuracy
Design business analysis and data recording systems for use throughout the department
Requirements
Alteryx and SQL experience
Familiarity with object-oriented programming and other data analysis programs
Skilled in creating pivot tables, graphs, and charts using data tools
Tendency to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
Skilled in written and verbal communication to effectively relate data to coworkers
Demonstrated ability to manage time and prioritize projects to meet deadlines
Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions
General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow
Analytical skills that allow for the development of data-driven reports

POSITION PURPOSE

A Data Analyst, Supply Chain leverages technical abilities to synthesize complex analytical tasks into easily understood data-driven stories. Responsible for working collaboratively with other analysts to apply established analytical processes on diverse datasets to deduce insights and solve real-world business problems. Also ensures that all reporting and analytical responsibilities are completed competently in a timely manner, continually seeking out opportunities to hone existing technical skills (e.g. writing SQL/code, statistics, machine learning, etc.) and learn new skills. Operates under the supervision and mentorship of more experienced managers and data scientists.

Major Tasks, Responsibilities And Key Accountabilities
30%-Executes existing reporting and analytical responsibilities
20%-Leverages data analytics tools to create new dashboards, reports, and any additional ad-hoc requests
20%-Ensures the quality of work output by displaying a keen attention to detail
20%-Develops additional technical competencies and subject matter expertise within core functional group
10%-Presents findings in easily understood ways, focuses on how the data analytics fits into the bigger picture
NATURE AND SCOPE

This position reports to Manager

This position has no Direct Reports

For Colorado, Connecticut, Nevada and New York City residents: The pay range for this position is between $54,600 and $77,800. Starting salary may vary based on a number of factors including, but not limited to, the position being offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. The Home Depot offers additional competitive financial and non-financial benefits, which may include a performance-based bonus program or a profit sharing program depending on position.

Environment

ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTS

Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant condition

Travel

Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time.

Minimum Qualifications

Must be eighteen years of age or older.

Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.

Years of Relevant Work Experience: 0 - 1 years

Physical Requirements

Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.

Preferred Qualifications

Work experience with SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or comparable database systems

Knowledge, Skills, Abilities And Competencies

Critical thinking skills to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions; ability to understand and foresee implications of new information for current and future problems solving.
An unquenchable intellectual curiosity for getting at the underlying story being told within the data

Gabe Carrillo

Analytics plays a key role in delivering on company’s mission to make the world’s collectible gaming information accessible and useful. Buyers, sellers, site visitors, partners and affiliates, internal teams and more all rely on our ability to deliver information that allows them to make critical decisions, run their businesses, or learn about and collect the products that they love.

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work with stakeholders and team members to define our data needs, build the tools, systems and reports that empower all users of this platform, and deliver data and insights by creating data-driven applications, data visualisation solutions, and reporting for the company.

Essential Functions
Collaborate with Senior Leadership to define KPIs for the business
Create Tableau dashboards and other data visualization that help the Product, Marketing and Senior Leadership teams manage performance of the business
Conduct advanced analysis using SQL and R or Python to understand the drivers of the business and make strategic recommendations
Help build a company-wide data culture where team members feel empowered to use data to make everyday decisions
Contribute to our data model by writing dbt code (including unit tests and documentation) and committing to our Github repository
Own relationships with stakeholders and use an agile planning process to ensure the most impactful projects are prioritized
Own Tableau, including data sources, folder structure, and permissions
Manage day-to-day support of data reporting and analytics
Advocate for and ensure data integrity and accuracy

Secondary Functions
Mentor and/or manage other business intelligence team members, ensuring the integrity and usefulness of their work
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports, dashboards and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Locate, define and present new process improvement opportunities

Competency (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)
Comfortable using statistics to communicate significance, confidence, or probability
Experience driving key business metrics such as customer acquisition cost, customer lifetime value, monthly recurring revenue, or customer retention rate
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong verbal and written communication skills in order to present data analysis findings
An interest in learning and working with new technologies
Experience collaborating and communicating across technical and non-technical departments

Required Qualifications
4+ years of experience in a similar role
Experience with relational database management systems, business reports, dashboards and data analysis
Experience using SQL to write complex queries that join data across multiple systems (bonus points for proficiency in dbt!)
Experience creating visualizations using tools like Looker, Tableau, Mode, or Periscope/Sisense for Cloud Data Team
A strong passion for data and applying that data to decisions

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with statistical computing and scripting with tools like Python and R
Experience working in an agile environment
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Economics, Information Systems, Statistics, Applied Math or other related field.

position: Data Analyst II (Healthcare Analytics) - CA only
details:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 25 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, multi-national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Position Purpose
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims, provider, member, and encounters data. Identify and assess the business impact of trends
Develop, execute, maintain, and troubleshoot complex scripts and reports developed using SQL, Microsoft Excel, or other analytics tools
Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers
Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines and thrive in a demanding, quickly changing environment
Support the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products
Support multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required
Less than 5% travel required
Our Comprehensive Benefits Package
Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility
Competitive pay
Paid Time Off including paid holidays
Health insurance coverage for you and dependents
401(k) and stock purchase plans
Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development
The Data Analyst (Healthcare Analytics) will have the opportunity to make a significant impact through the discovery, development, and implementation of leading-edge analytics that answer important business questions. The analyst will collaborate with key corporate and health plan business partners for the purpose of identifying and delivering robust reporting and analytics capabilities to drive improved business performance.

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience working with large databases, data verification, and data management, or 1+ years IT experience. Healthcare analytics experience preferred. Knowledge of query development of basic to moderate complexity using SQL or other coding languages. Knowledge of basic statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. Working knowledge of analytical tools, including R, Python, SAS, ArcGIS, QGIS, Microstrategy, Tableau, Hadoop, or related tools preferred. Working knowledge of relational databases preferred. Working knowledge of automation capabilities such as batch processes, stored procedures, scripting languages, Microstrategy, or other tools preferred.

Experience in provider contracting, claims pricing, financial reporting/analysis, data modeling, statistical modeling, or data science analysis preferred. Experience working closely with business partners, using analytic techniques & tools to explore financial performance trends; Familiarity with healthcare data such as member eligibility, medical and pharmacy claims data, and utilization preferred.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

We Are Hiring

We are hiring a full-time Sr. Data Analyst to join the Ascension Data Sciences Institute.

The Ascension Data Sciences Institute (ADSI) was created in July 2019 with the mission of supporting Ascension in achieving its Quadruple Aim with uniquely skilled, high-performing associates who develop analyses, models and applications to enable Ascension in providing higher value healthcare and making strategic decisions. ADSI is comprised of 6 domains addressing 1) Clinical quality and patient safety; 2) Health Economics and Clinical Outcomes; 3) Strategic Operations and Financial Analytics; 4) Actuarial and Managed Care Analytics; 5) Registry Abstraction Healthcare Solutions; and 6) Healthcare Data Intelligence. We recognize that the healthcare environment is a complex ecosystem of rapidly evolving clinical and economic practices that affect patient and provider experience and demands increasingly sophisticated and complex measurement. Our objective is for advanced analytics and data science to play a critical and foundational role in the transformation of care delivery, quality and financial outcomes to enable our organization’s competitive advantage.

Remote Opportunity

#ADSI

What You Will Do

Support and contribute to the development of analytics for services resulting in operational business insights and recommendations for improvement that will be presented to leaders based on current reporting and requests.

The Senior Analyst Will Be Responsible For
Developing knowledge around existing business processes, functions and data sources that will be utilized in the business insights and recommendation development.
Working together with the lead analysts in coordinating across functional, data, operational teams and with leaders to ensure accuracy, consistency and optimization of the overall work product and business insights.
Ability to engage with stakeholders to obtain necessary data for analyses which could include disparate source systems and data structures.
Experience with large data sets utilizing cloud-based platforms, SQL or similar query tools.
Generating recommendations for improvement
Participating in the development of complex visualizations.
Education

What You Will Need
High school diploma/GED with 2 years of experience, or Associate's degree, or Bachelor's degree required.
Work Experience
3 years of experience preferred.
Additional Preferences
Proficient in SQL is strongly preferred
Why Join Our Team

When you join Ascension, you join a team of over 150,000 individuals across the country committed to a Mission of serving others and providing compassionate, personalized care to all. Our inclusive culture, continuing education programs, career coaches and benefit offerings are just a few of the resources and tools that team members can use to create a rewarding career path. In fact, Ascension spent nearly $46 million in tuition assistance alone to support associate growth and development. If you are looking for a career where you can grow and make a difference in your community, we invite you to join our team today.

Description

Robert Half is currently working with a client seeking a Data Analyst. The Data Analyst will prepare financial reports that serve as summary information for managers. As the Data Analyst you will be compiling, interpreting, and reporting information on a variety of data types. This Data Analyst position is for someone who is deadline driven and highly analytical.

Key responsibilities
Compile analytical reports and identify relevant insights
Interpret corporate reports, such as quarterly earnings, to build sound financial reports
Implement and execute data mining projects, utilizing investigative, organizational, and analytical skills
Extract, manipulate and organize data in response to management requests
Supply key decision-making data for market assessments, forecasting and further investigation
Requirements
Excellent verbal, written, and social communication skills
5+ years of experience in financial planning and analysis, data analysis or similar role
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills, and a high attention to detail
Must have advanced knowledge of reporting and spreadsheet applications, including V-lookups, pivot tables, and queries
BS/BA in Accounting, finance, or economics
Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision
Solid understanding of various data models
Well-rounded in data management and manipulation

The Marketing Data Analyst is responsible for assembling and analyzing all Ranpak direct customer/transactional and North American Sales Team metrics information. The position will provide insights into the Ranpak customer and direct more relevant segmentation and communication. The incumbent will provide the North America Sales and Marketing teams with analysis and reporting to help achieve top line sales/fulfillment goals and other company wide objectives. Responsible for the day-to-day data analytic, reporting and dashboarding needs of our cross functional business leads. Will work directly with our leadership team to identify key metrics and create tailored reports.
Key Responsibilities
Ability to connect customers across channels and draw insights through the integration and analysis of multi data sources.
Mine and analyze customer purchase behavior and develop targeting & segmentation strategies.
Develop and maintain customer reporting and dashboard creation.
Develop an understanding of channel behavior and ROI to make recommendations on marketing channel mix.
Work with Product Manager(s) and Marketing Communication Team to develop product forecasts and sales opportunities.
Perform data collection, analysis, and reporting to support Sales, Order Fulfillment and Customer Service team stakeholders.
Help to refine and produce KPIs (Key Performance Metrics) for the organization.
Develop reporting dashboards.
Drive daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly reporting in support of the Sales, Order Fulfillment and Customer Service teams.
Produce regular and ad-hoc analyses, modeling, reports and presentations.
Support ongoing efforts to ensure integrity of and improvements to our data environment and supporting reporting tools.
Ability to extract, analyze and present complex data in meaningful, insightful manner through effective visualization and organized presentations.
Qualifications
4+ years’ related experience in a B2B analytics role
Deep understanding of marketing databases - experience with customer files, demographics, transactional data, 3rd party data overlays.
Expertise in Excel and off the shelf reporting & analytic platforms - database design.
Thorough CRM experience required.
Familiarity with business intelligence tools.
Able to work cross-departmentally ensuring success in all areas.
Sustainability, plastic pollution and climate change have never been more at the forefront of our world as they are today.

At Ranpak, sustainability has been in our DNA since our founding in 1972. Ranpak’s goal then was to create the first environmentally responsible system to protect products during shipment and today, our mission remains the same: To deliver sustainable packaging solutions that help improve supply chain performance and costs, reduce environmental impact, and support a variety of growing business needs globally. The development and improvement of materials, technologies (such as automation) and total solution systems have earned Ranpak a reputation as an innovative leader in eCommerce and industrial supply chain solutions.

Ranpak’s customers span across a variety of industries including automotive parts, electronics, eCommerce, machinery and homegoods. Our customers include Amazon, IKEA, Sephora, Misfit Market and BMW.

Ranpak’s corporate headquarters are in Concord Township, Ohio with European and Asia Pacific headquarters in Heerlen, the Netherlands and Singapore City, Singapore, respectively.

Ranpak Holdings Corp. is a New York Stock Exchange listed company (NYSE: PACK). EOE STATEMENT We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.
Desired Skills and Experience
Experience
3 - 6 year(s): 4+ years’ related experience in a B2B analytics role
